That he talks in quite accentless prose.
Of course I speak correctly,
Glaswegians abjectly,
And Brummies all talk down their nose!

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
If I told you that you were gelastic
You'd suspect me of being sarcastic,
But if I said "Hi,
You're a comical guy!"
You would think, "Yes, it's true, I'm fantastic!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My real feelings I cannot conceal:
The invention of chrome-nickel steel,
Good for watch-springs, was neat.
It's resistant to heat.
What a feat! It's a very big deal!

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
It isn't a radish. This neat
Root vegetable's really a beet.
When it's pickled, I crave
This deep purple beetrave,
And a Harvard beet dish is a treat!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The Aeneolithic's prolific
Inventors were always specific
To make things by dint
Of copper and flint;
Using mud wasn't half as terrific.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I don't think that I'm speaking unfairly.
My wife's handwriting—legible? Rarely!
Like this note for the store:
"Peanuts (something) or more."
It's decipherable, yes, but just barely.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
The gesture (two fingers, bestowed
By half of the people who showed
Up to vote) starts to droop,
But this comedy troupe
Are still kicking the can down the road.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Any wrong line of thought, you should know,
Or a misguided action, will show
As mistaken. We're marking
Up the wrong tree you're barking;
You've been fooled, it's the wrong way to go!

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
We can't wait while our enemies plan
To come here, kill each child, woman, man.
Let's go there—to Iraq—
And prevent their attack.
Baghdad first. Next Pyongyang. Then Tehran.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We consultants all fear and we dread time
That's idle; it's not-earning-bread time.
When jobless, we yearn
To get busy, return
To a schedule without any dead time.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Sixty rpm's one cps.
Dear reader, I'm sure you can guess—
With r: "revolutions"—
For his contributions
One Hertz shall this unit express.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
The barbwire fence and the train
Reshaped the American plain.
It's no longer a home
Where the buffalo roam,
And none of the cowboys remain.

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
In this prison regime we are under,
One must try, dearest friend, not to blunder.
It's a grievous faux pas,
Shouting, "Hip hip hurrah!"
When the dogs rip your cell-mate asunder.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
These trousers may save you and me.
Breeches buoys may turn out to be
Not an odd pair of pants
But a major advance
That is useful in rescues at sea.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Greek centaurs (half man and half horse)
Combine charm with a brute hippic force.
While endowments equestrian
Are far from pedestrian,
Don't ride if you can't stay the course.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Euclid sired Euclidean space,
Where a parallel "rule" made his case.
Einstein proved gravitation
Creates perturbation;
Al's case for curved space we embrace.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Take a risk. Go and do something risky.
Whisk some stimulants in with your whiskey.
Scarlet red, paint the town.
Hair and pants —  let 'em down!
Have some frisk (which is "fun") and get frisky!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
You knead water, yeast, flour (stone-ground).
Bake me slow, 'til my top's lightly browned.
I'm a georgy — a loaf,
Who, as any old oaf
In old Oz knew, weighed in at four pound.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
When you're done with the sink, close the spout!
Frequent baths, flushing loos — do without.
Do whatever conserves
Squandered water reserves.
Isn't that what a drought's all about?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I say "CREPuscule;" some say "crePUScle"—
It's the time that a skirt's flirting rustle
Will inspire a young swain
To commence a campaign
To obtain what lies under its bustle.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
The femto-: a prefix for when,
Fifteen times, you've cut something in ten.
Its naming is plainish
To speakers of Danish,
From which we next borrow again.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To bring home the "Big O," I'm aggressive.
My foreplay, some say, is excessive.
Pleasing women's my aim,
So then how can you claim
As a stud I'm not all that impressive?

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A migrating bird told her mother,
"I want to fly north like my brother!"
So her mum asked the shop
If the airline would swap
Her own Arctic return for another.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Hey, honey, it's getting quite late.
The sun is still up, but just wait!
Let's go out on a hill
In the evening's sweet chill
And enjoy an acronychal date.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Effeminacy: womanish traits,
Signs revealed by some gays (versus straights):
Effete manner of walking
And grooming and talking
Which to nature, not nurture, relates.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I was white-water rafting with Frank,
The rich asshole I married who drank.
Well, he drowned when we flipped;
My composure just slipped,
And I laughed all the way to the bank.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"An earwig's a hideous creature,
And there's one on the face of our teacher!"
The student was pained
Till a classmate explained,
"That's no bug, but, in fact, a defeature."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The sepals quite soon fall away
(They're caducous, and not meant to stay),
So, while these are deep-sixed,
All the petals stay fixed
For a sepal-free floral bouquet.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
You serve, I return with a dink
(This will certainly make your eyes blink).
I play softly, and yet
The ball's over the net,
Then abruptly it's starting to sink.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I met a petite demoiselle;
She was sweet and a real southern belle.
We went out on a date,
But I erred—sealed my fate—
When I drove to the local motel.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Candlewasters sat up through the night
Working hard in their small pool of light.
Nowadays midnight swotters,
With neon-drenched jotters,
Waste nothing but bulbs and their sight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Nate has got a new yacht, but the craft
Is as yet not entirely staffed.
Soon he'll slate waitress Kate
To become second mate,
As he states she is great, fore and aft.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Soon as diastase meets up with starch,
Biochemistry starts on a march
One might call diastatic,
Making glucose, pragmatic,
Giving strength to build Hadrian's Arch.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
He was wanting a shot (the photographer)
Of the friends of the great oceanographer.
But to count them, he knew
His own math wouldn't do;
He was forced to consult a demographer.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Malicious young swine! Getting plastered
On sacrament wine, when the pastor'd
Shown faith in supplying it,
And now you're denying it?
Coward! My, my, what a dastard.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My coach dog's a canine sensation.
"That's his breed, silly, not his vocation!
He's not coach of a team
Of brave sled dogs!" I scream.
"He's a champion full-bred Dalmatian!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This poem is lyric, not stony—
Italian, but not by Marconi.
Perhaps Provençal,
Although not by Mistral,
It's the songlike, medieval canzone.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Cleopatra's erotical fame
Prompted Julius Caesar to claim
Her most fertile of regions...
To feed all his legions
Or fan his own personal flame?

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
If you love the taste of Engraulis —
Anchovies, I mean — here's some solace:
Your friends at the table
May scream they're unable
To stand it, but I think it's flawless.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Two patrons, each one a big spender,
To a barmaid flash large legal tender.
She, wanting their tips
But not pinches or lips,
Keeps 'em sober so they don't offend 'er.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
These fruits of my loins are bad kids.
They display to the world only ids.
I am sick of all three —
You can have them for free!
(They're on eBay, but nobody bids.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I was bred in Keewatin—a scion
Of indigenous groups—Chipewyan.
Nature's lure's oversold
And the cold's getting old.
Hell, I'm numb! If I'm lyin', I'm dyin'.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
To the timid (but nonetheless coachable),
Many topics are wholly unbroachable
When meeting a lady.
But this won't sound shady:
"Beg your pardon, I find you approachable."

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
A poet sits late at night burning
The midnight oil, versing and churning
Out rhyme after rhyme,
Unaware of the time.
Seems this girl shows no sign of adjourning.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Code Orange is used for a spill
That is radioactive (no drill!)
Or a violent guy
(Who knows what he may try)
Judged by docs to be mentally ill.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The automobile is obscene—
An infernal combustion machine!
It's a waster of fuel
That we need to retool.
(My new Hummer is emerald green.)

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
Dr. Mehran Anvari can slice
With a robot, in very precise
Operations in space,
Or a most remote place,
And with joysticks, control the device.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Faye's a bit off her rocker, I'd say,
And when stressed has a horrible day.
Please ease off of her case,
'Cause it isn't  your place
To say, "Faye, come what may,  go away."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Hungry, looking for catfish to kill,
The tall shoebill remained very still.
Then he rapidly struck,
Saying, "Boy, I'm in luck!
This fish is just right: fits the bill."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cush-cush is one kind of yam.
You can cook it with ham or with lamb,
Although eating a yampee
May just make you crampy—
I had some for lunch, and I am!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A change key will open one lock.
Other entries? You'll just have to knock.
When the master key's yours
You can open all doors —
And I've got it right here in my sock.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
A Volvo, tests say, should be crashworthy.
It's built like a tank to be smashworthy.
But a car like my Yugo
(Which didn't when new go!)
I'd designate only as trashworthy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When we buried my father, we had
A cortege that my neighbors thought sad:
Ten town drunks bellowed verse
As they followed the hearse—
An appropriate funeral, Dad!

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
In Hebrew, his name is Abaddon,
This king that the patchwork folk had on
The throne of the pit
Into which you can't spit
To the bottom, and boy! He's a plaid 'un.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I said I would meet you today,
And I'll do it, I swear, come what may.
Though the track to our tryst
Hugs a cliff, in the mist,
There's no peril shall keep me away!

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
A neighboring star is Altair;
It has speed of rotation to spare.
If there's life (which I doubt,
Though I can't rule it out),
They could listen to Sonny and Cher.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Gentian violet, stoppered in bottles,
Is a violet dyestuff that throttles
Bacteria and yeast.
North America's northeast
Bottle (closed) gentians' blue rarely mottles.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When you excavate something, you dig,
With the hope that you'll find something big.
You may find a rare relic—
A Madonna, angelic—
Or the humble remains of a pig.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When we get to the zoo we make bee-lines
For the cheetahs and tigers—the felines,
Our favorite mammals—
Not llamas, or camels,
Or manatees, orcas, or sea-lines.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Most aver that Miss Piggy's not real,
	But a Muppet, and one with appeal.
	If alive, she'd be pink
	As a duroc, they think,
	With nice hams, curly tail and a squeal.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's ten people, a room that is sealed,
And a corpse!  You must keep your eyes peeled.
For when push comes to shove,
There is no one above
Suspicion till the killer's revealed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In close quarters, like in an OR,
You'd think gas passers maybe would jar.
You'd be wrong. He or she
Fills a need to a T.
One in every OR's about par.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Billy dressed up as "12" Halloween
While his sister went out as "15".
"That figures," I thought
Since their father has taught
Mathematics at Yale as their dean.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
As a youngster, beginning life's race,
I competed at leisurely pace.
As I aged, then I ran,
But I've learned that I can,
At the best, just attain second place.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Watch the moth; it's enkindled in flame:
Burnt to ash. Yes, temptation trumps shame.
Destruction has charms
When seduction disarms.
Gird your loins, son, or don't play the game.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
All for naught, I'd become overwrought
'Bout that fish that I oughta have caught.
I've gone shoppin' instead,
Where they're already dead.
Shoulda seen what I coulda done bought.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Debbie Dram-Drinker's head is on screwy:
She says, "Without drink I feel bluey.
Fill my dram-cup now, Jim;
Fill it clear to the brim
With that whisky liqueur called Drambuie."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This will surely be solvable. Still,
Decidability's currently nil.
But be patient, okay?
I get closer each day,
Using doggedness, genius and will.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
He shouted "I'll not be a slave!"
It's the tale of an Indian brave
Who, in one act abhorrent,
Leaped into the torrent —
Consigned to a watery grave.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In creating my Christmas decor,
I string cranberry garlands galore.
I use holly with berries
As red as ripe cherries,
And mistletoe hangs o'er the door.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
If you're after a verse on the duck,
Our old web-footed pal, you're in luck.
Yes, this limerick reveals
Not just mallards and teals,
But the... sorry, no room left. You're stuck.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Any small or young dove, many know,
Is a dovelet and, while it is so,
Cooing lasses confirm
That it's also a term
They are dubbed now and then by a beau.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A crate just arrived from the Mafia.
It's got bottles, all wrapped up in raffia,
And the postmark is Haitian—
But it's no aberration—
Cosa Nostra's now dealing in taffia!

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade
By twenty-three nations was made,
Till the W.T.O.
Meant that GATT had to go.
Both ensured fewer tariffs were paid.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Each year towards the end of November,
A calendar meant for December
Appeared on the  wall
Of my family's front hall—
It's something I'll always remember.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On her wedding night, Nan will allow,
They will consummate God's holy vow.
But the word is a puzzle;
In their bed, will they guzzle
Thin beef broth? She can't figure how!

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
A Munch picture entered my dream.
Alas, frightfulness came as its theme:
The revulsion, the dread,
Swirled around in my head,
Till the images caused me to SCREAM.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
After six months away I still know
Where I stored my seeds (now under snow).
I'm a bird, mostly gray,
From the west U.S.A.—
Clark's nutcracker (also Clark's crow).

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Here I come to the club, a new writer,
OLder sure, but not grown any brighter.
Good old faithful agnostic,
Early fan of acrostic,
Rhymes in rhythms that leave lyrics lighter.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Here's a scheme of Egyptian devising:
In four years, the heliacal rising
Of Sothis, they say,
Would advance by a day.
'Twas a doggone long way from reprising.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
To remove a carboxyl group, you
(In your rival lab) toil the day through.
Yet, asleep, through my proxy, late,
I decarboxylate!
I'd say that I've pulled off a -COOH.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My government makes all the rules—
Runs the court system, army, and schools.
Some opponents are planning
Rebellion while manning
A counter officialdom. Fools!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
It's your grave that I'm watching you dig
With a knife and a fork.  You're too big.
Much too soon you'll be bound
For a hole in the ground.
So eat wiser, and don't be a pig.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A big shot of rye whiskey—it goes
Down his gullet, and watch how he glows,
Feels superior, big,
Shot with power (the prig!),
Like a big shot, right down to his toes.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Round a table they clash, do-or-die,
Circumtabular, fixed eye-to-eye.
Tables don't intervene,
Though, once talk turns obscene…
Or depart when, at last, feathers fly.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Wrenching sob stories, pleading, and such
Move my third cousin Flo very much.
Are you broke? Go to Flo
With a sad tale of woe.
She's a do-gooder, Bro, a soft touch.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Being gored by a bull is no fun—
His corniculate head you should shun.
If he pokes your behind,
You will painfully find
You have three holes where once there was one.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
One former commander-in-chief's
Claim to fame involved sex, not beliefs.
Even now, people care
What he's wearing down there.
(It's commando, not boxers or briefs.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If ever you travel Down Under,
The gardens will thrill you like thunder.
Their Banksia bowers
Of bottlebrush flowers
Will fill you with joy and with wonder.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
With his financing out of control,
Having mortgaged both body and soul,
Ed turned to the Mob
To bankroll the job.
Their investment's his ace in the hole.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
You might think that this region of Spain
Would be lacking in cats in the main.
I once dreamed it was known
For just one cat alone:
Catalonia—mouse-free terrain!

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
This beats all that I ever have seen!
On this scale you can see what I mean:
Your blood alcohol count
Shows what crazy amount
You've knocked back — and you're barely thirteen!

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
Do you suffer from PTSD?
Abreact and you'll finally be free
Of the stress and the strife
That has messed up your life.
Reliving the trauma's the key.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We're so plainly amazed at the way
That the airlines make every flight pay.
Now my seat-mates and I,
Lying nigh thigh-to-thigh,
Form a perfect coplanar array.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
A comma provides a short pause
In a list, or before a new clause,
While a coma's a deep,
Sometimes shock-induced, sleep.
(Semicolon abuse is one cause.)

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"There's a man lying dead in the street!
Send some help!" came a pitiful bleat.
"No assistance required.
My husband's just tired.
He is not dead — he's only dead beat."

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I designed  our new LAN and I'm proud
That its diskless. I find that the cloud
Is much quicker than disk,
And it lessens loss risk.
I'm a big step ahead of the crowd.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Queried Joe, who'd unearthed a mosaic
With a text in a language archaic:
"Is it so? I don't know.
My research seems to show
In Passaic, folks spoke Aramaic."

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Ancient Misty the dog was in pain.
She stopped eating; her anguish was plain.
At the vet's, on a bed,
Triple shots made her dead.
Now encindered, her ashes remain.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
Now, an airbrush was like a paint shooter
That would make a nude model look neuter.
It seems quaint to recall,
When considering all
That's explicit these days on computer.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
In my church's fine atrium hall
Gleams an orange, white-veined, marble wall.
How strange, then, to hear
That it's ashlar veneer,
And is not solid marble at all.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the kidnapping, first thing—I pinned 'er,
So's her efforts to struggle I'd hinder,
Then I sez, "Mary Lou,
I mus' abligate you
So's you do not escape out dat winder."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In Israel he garnered much praise
As his troops set the desert ablaze.
Sure, his gaze was awry
With his patch-covered eye,
But it still only took him six days.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
There were times when my life saw me stray.
In review with St. Peter today,
I made known what I'd change.
He said, "God won't arrange
For a do-over, son.  Better pray."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Whenever tornados come 'round,
It's the place where your family's found:
You'll be waiting en masse
For the cyclone to pass
In your cellar that's deep underground.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Is a culture so terribly strange
Whose traditions are subject to change?
Some begin, others end.
Evolution's our friend,
As it helps to extend custom's range.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
To my darling toothed whales, I bequeath
This cool, chewable dolphin-shaped wreath.
(They're all denticetes, Betty.
They're Odontoceti.
Porpoise, sperm whale — the dear things have teeth.)

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
She once kept her friends out of danger,
But a falling-out served to estrange her
From wizards and owls;
Now Hermione prowls
Through the West, where she's dubbed the Lone Granger.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Want a  tan that can't fade for the beach?
A new product's within easy reach.
Try the handy Tan Fast Stick—
Results are fantastic!
Big bonus: the color won't bleach.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Devatas receive veneration
From Hindus of high or low station.
Minor deities' worship
Feeds entrepreneurship,
Exploiting their subtle gradation.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
What an excellent student you are!
Your report card is far above par.
That's a bang-up job, son,
But you're grounded for one
Super dent when you banged up my car.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
At a farm, in an ancient Welsh house,
There's a taster-in-chief who's a mouse.
What he's testing's a dream
Made from curds made from cream:
The eponymous Caerphilly caws.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
It's as English as having one's supper—
From the lowest class, through to the upper.
Since it first came from China,
Tea's never been minor:
"Here, darling—cheer up, have a cuppa."

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
There's a cherry plum tree near the street,
Which the curious children find neat.
"It bears cherries or plums?"
"Plums. When summertime comes,
You'll find sweet reddish treats you can eat."

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
An ambiguous proverb I chose
On the shedding of clothing. It goes:
"You must ne'er cast a clout
Till May's seen to be out."
May—the month or the blossom? Who knows?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A face shield, you'll surely agree,
Can protect you from flying debris.
There are all kinds of articles,
Small fragments, and particles,
That are harmful to faces, like scree.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The national bird of Iraq
And of Pakistan goes way, way back.
When the mating urge rises,
They're trained to earn prizes:
For fighting they've clearly a knack.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a teen, I once "borrowed" Dad's 'Vette
For a date on the beach with Georgette.
We were drunk on his gin
When the high tide came in.
Did I catch hell that evening?  You bet!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Fresh coffee, self-served with a smile,
Fine burgers and fries in a pile,
Pert checkout girls, cooks
Giving welcoming looks:
In my dreams, cafeteria-style.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
So this morning, the boss cut my pay.
And my project?  In full disarray.
My Toyota tonight
Went berserk.  What a fright!
All in all, a disquietive day.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Got a fun job?" Yes, that's what the boy meant
At the agency, seeking employment.
Said the agent, "There's work
If you're not prone to shirk.
Bosses pay for your toil, not enjoyment."

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
Fibre optics: the use of long sections
Of glass to guide light-ray reflections.
High-speed information
Criss-crosses the nation,
A telecom web of connections.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The UK's clever MPs designed
The early day motion, a kind
That has helped draw attention
To matters they mention
That should be engaging the mind.

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
Fleur De Lim
BobHale
limerick_list.text:
A besom's a brush or a broom
For sweeping the floor of the room,
Made from bundles of sticks,
To which you affix
A handle — to grip, I presume.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Jackdaws love my big sphinx made of quartz,"
Queen of Pangrams Joanna reports.
I replied, "Did you know
That's a clattering, Jo?"
"No, I didn't," she sneered. "Eat my shorts!"

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Flights of stairs with a turn like a vee
And no well, but a landing, would be
A quite aptly named spot
For a pooch to be caught;
Both are dog-legged. One's taking a pee.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Ground-up beef, pressed to make a Big Mac'd
Be agglomerated (clustered, or packed),
Like grains in a dough
Or the crystals in snow—
Granules crowded together attract.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The auditor goes without sleep
To pore through my records and peep
At whether my COLA
Has boosted my whole a-
ssessed tax — yes, the dread bracket creep.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She tried out for the circus, and blew it,
But with sheep, she knows just how to do it:
Watches over our stock,
Cuts one out of the flock.
Where's her contract? I want to renew it.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
So you stole from a poor mom-and-pop shop;
Worse still, from a charity op-shop.
That was lower than low.
This time, lad, you will go
Right on down to the station — the cop shop.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Tears cascading from Emily's eyes
Say she's finally seen through Nick's lies —
Flowing saline solution.
Deferred retribution
Will follow. Em plots as she cries.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Out of nowhere, a bear approached.  Fear
Overtook me.  I froze like a deer
In the headlights, since shock
Made my muscles all lock.
He was full, else I wouldn't be here.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A country whose culture's anomic
Is one that is quite tragicomic.
This social unrest
Can lead, I suggest,
To failures of things economic.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The first state giving honor to Chris?
(This is one that is easy to miss.)
Columbus Day parties
Were held by some hearties
In the Rockies, where pot is now bliss.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As I'm heading for town I will stop
And I'll spend a few hours with my pop
Tinting cloth in the dye-works.
That's where the old guy works.
It's fun when I visit his shop.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Was this governess prim or quite vain?
And did Rochester spy the young Jane
Air her knickers and scanties
And hang her pink panties
On a clothesline in sight? How profane!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though the figure is heavily robed,
And its gender's not easily probed,
I declare it's a female.
No way can it be male!
Its chest is distinctly bilobed.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Wartime France: you'd be wise to defer
Confrontations with brave franc-tireurs.
French Resistance deployed them
So, wise to avoid them;
Free snipers—Effrayants Messieurs!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What a bore! She keeps talking and talking
And talking and talking and talking
And yakking and yakking.
An off-switch she's lacking.
She drones on and on. (Hell, I'm walking.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In her youth, she researched Dinocerata,
And remains of extinct Eurypterida.
Now she's old and retired,
And this tag she's acquired:
She's Professor of Fossils Emerita.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
I've been told I've a mind analytic —
Do you think it's my background? (Semitic.)
Every thought is explored,
Not a word is ignored,
Each encounter's a test diacritic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"The weather is balmy. Go out,"
Said our mommy, "I haven't a doubt
You'll have fun in the sun.
Take the dog for a run.
That's what fair summer days are about!"

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
While shopping at Wal-Mart you'll find
Different places for things—every kind
In its own special space
(Toys or men's-wear), each place
A department, in one store combined.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Ever wonder how bone may be grown?
Ectostosis (the process) has shown
That we get bone formation,
Called ossification,
Beneath the dense membranous zone.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In old radios I'm a believer.
The early cat's whisker receiver
Was a radio set,
Very simple, and yet
Of most wavelengths a first-rate retriever.

limerick_list.author: Anonymity
limerick_list.text:
The cotton plant's seed is the source
Of gossypol—I feel remorse;
Now my sperm count is nil.
Damn that gossypol pill!
I should've used condoms (of course).

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
When arranging a boogie, we need:
1. Some turboprop airplanes, for speed.
2. Both lodgings and lunch.
3. A skydiving bunch.
4. An airfield — important indeed!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For college, Mom sewed Judd a duffel,
But the large sturdy bag had a ruffle.
As he stuffed his clothes in,
Judd expressed his chagrin:
"Ruffled duffels can cause a kerfuffle."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Just one dandelion, hosting a bee:
"Tell me how many flowers you see?"
"Only one." "Not quite true,
When you take the close view.
Count the corollets — dozens," said she.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
To get to my villa in Spain,
 I hopped in my aerospace plane.
Though three hundred miles out
Is a long way, no doubt,
It's much faster than taking the train.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
Adaptivity helps one through life,
With which problems and pitfalls are rife.
Being able to go,
Under stress, with the flow
Will help you dodge sadness and strife.

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
An artist, turned boxer for pay,
Accomplished his goal this fine day.
He had courage, you see,
And conviction, for he
Ended up on the canvas his way.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
A clothes horse ain't equine in breed,
Nor a camel, nor any old steed.
It's a rack for wet washing:
Quite humble—or poshing—
It'll do for both sackcloth and tweed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
By the ruins of ancient Cyrene,
In Libya, Lynn tried linguini.
"Sic transit…," she thought,
"Once on top, come to nought."
Then she ordered another martini.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Now I see on today's jailbird roster
Someone here's a 'repeat fake accoster'.
Just who might that be?"
"Warden Borden, that's me —
A persistent assailant imposter."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'M AWAY FROM MY DESK FOR THE DAY.
The boss put this sign up to say
That you'd best disappear.
Well, he's really still here
But won't see you — it's such a cliché!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
And now for a Romany riddle:
What's stroked with a bow down its middle
By fakers, while swaying
And ceaselessly playing
A bosh with panache? It's a fiddle!

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Absinthium's a most bitter plant
Called "wormwood", and eat it you can't.
But in absinthe (the drink)
It's much better I think;
Just a few sips will truly enchant.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Behindhand: it isn't a stroke
Used in tennis, nor is it a joke.
Behindhand's what I'm
If I don't pay on time,
And I'm late with my bills 'cause I'm broke.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Many plays that were penned by old Will
Are collected herein, and it's still
The definitive text
When a scholar's perplexed.
The First Folio gives me a thrill.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To a bartender newbie said I,
"It's a grasshopper I'd like to try."
He walked straight out the door.
Gone an hour or more,
It took that long for him to comply.

limerick_list.author: Meechpod
limerick_list.text:
There once was a chap from Ravello
Whose goal was to master the cello;
He'd practice all day
'Cause his aim was to play
Just as well as that Yo-Yo Ma fellow!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Clofazimine's useful to treat
Folks with leprosy—germs to defeat
(Though as B 663,
It was made for TB).
Add two drugs and the treatment's complete.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Entailment's a state that I hate,
As it legally binds the estate.
Disentailment's for me,
As at last I break free:
Long gone forebears no longer dictate.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With a temp of a hundred and three,
I moaned, "Call a mortician for me."
Now today, ninety-nine
Is the figure. I'm fine,
Since my fever has broken, you see.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Desynonymization's a case
Where two words, having shared the same space
In a language, will change.
They evolve, rearrange,
And a shift in their meanings takes place.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
There's no stopping it: Day Zero nears,
And the people in Cape Town have fears:
Will the folks all go barmy?
Will they call out the army
When the tap water all disappears?

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When dad's back ached (which caused him to grouse),
Embrocation my mother would douse
And rub in. It eased pain
But we all felt the strain
Through his moans—and the pong in the house!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"The Democratic-Republican Party,"
Says a student of history, Artie,
"Fought Al Hamilton's bank.
Tom and James we must thank
For the party. Its founders were hardy."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Grandma May turned 113
And still smiles when describing the scene
To us kids every day
How she met Grand-dad Clay.
She, this way, keeps the memory green.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
I need breathing space — back off a bit.
If you don't, there's a chance you'll get hit.
Let me do my own stuff,
'Cause you've more than enough
Of your own space; in mine, you don't fit.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
On his arm, Henry had an infection,
So he asked for a doctor's inspection.
He came out feeling grim,
With one less upper limb,
For the  doc did a thorough dissection.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
The rumor is hot, so let's bruit it—
No time to confirm or refute it.
Though maybe it's truthless,
The grapevine is ruthless;
We got us some bull—gonna shoot it.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Aptly called, since it means "deftly done",
A fair maiden named Crisply had fun:
With élan she might do
Something rude and taboo,
And conclude ere one knew she'd begun.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
It exhilarates me when I swim;
Makes me happy and fills me with vim.
So I can't understand
That man covered in sand,
Looking drowned: there's no vim about him.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Cybersurgery — this is where hands
Are replaced by computers' broad bands
Of high-tech devices,
Which cut up in slices
Your body — their knife in your glands!

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A rooster's a Yank's name for cock;
He's the chicken who's head of the flock.
If you think cock's a curse word,
Consider the worse word
I call them around 5 o'clock.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Scott Foresman did help me attain
Skills in reading that, with me, remain.
Yes, of cheers, I'm a leader
For that old basal reader
And my childhood pals, Dick and Jane.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A mud cat's a very large catfish;
A yellow cat, also, is that fish,
Plus shovelhead, goujon,
Bashaw—he's a huge 'un
That sticks to your ribcage: a fat fish.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
When you're forming a common contraction,
Please avoid a familiar infraction.
Do be sure that, with taste,
Your apostrophe's placed
With precision and great satisfaction!

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
Alternating current reverses
As it powers our homes and disperses,
Running all that we need,
But be cautious, take heed:
It's provided some business for hearses.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My exocrine glands will secrete
Slimy fluids at times indiscreet —
Not just sweat, they comprise
Salty tears from my eyes,
Bile and more to digest what I eat.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You study all night and all day;
You're exhausted, burned out, so I'll say,
Better come up for air,
Take a break! Don't you care
If I bug you with such a cliché?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Listen, slumlord! I just have to say
That the heat is not working OK.
The water pipe's rusted,
And the toilet is busted.
Please address these three problems today.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
In the courthouse, the one down on Main,
Mr. Coltrane appeared to obtain
A license to wed.
"It's my ninth one," he said,
So the judges adjudged him insane.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
You're a Christian (a Mom or a Dad)
And your job stinks—it's making you mad.
Join this work at home group—
You will smile, you will whoop—
'Cause to be your own boss makes you glad!

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
We skipped the light trippy fandango
To wild castanets and charango.
The walls were revolving,
Receding, dissolving ...
All quiet now. Where did the gang go?

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
My name isn't Heinrich or Hermann
Or Hans, and I cannot confirm an
Extraction Teutonic—
Which makes it ironic
That all my first cousins are german.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Individual space we define
By a personal boundary line;
And it tells us who's who—
This is me; that is you.
I'll resist if you violate mine!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
John Dewey, well-known by the nation,
In philosophy and education,
Spoke up for reform.
Not content with the norm,
He suggested a different foundation.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
When a factory came under assault,
Its assembly line ground to a halt.
Yelled the boss, "Don't you leave
Or you'll all get the heave.
The union be damned—it's default!"

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I goyng tly foh assimirirate,
Tly yoh food, learn spik Engwish, wait—
You wiw see, I do good—
Wohk reew hahd rike folks should,
Come Amelican fast, not too late.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
"I'm accepting all comers," said he,
"I can win any fight as you'll see."
Then a hulk came along,
Quickly proving him wrong.
He whined, "How could this happen to me?"

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Fabric artist: interpreter whose
Experience leads her to fuse
Views she weaves in her head,
Framed in cloth and in thread,
With the novel techniques that she'll use.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The election is over; let's dance some.
Obama has won. Yes we can! Some
Have started to notice
We now have a POTUS
Who's actually tall, dark, and handsome.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Get protected by guards and a gate.
There's a vacancy — no need to wait.
At our gated community,
Seniors seek unity;
Shuffleboard; golf carts; a mate?

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Some say nationalism is cool,
But I'll not be a jingoist fool.
My greater attachment
Belongs to my catchment—
Go Area Seven! You rule!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
My extremities all have turned blue,
My toes and my fingertips, too.
They're so far from the fire
Of my heart, they'll expire
From exposure. Then what'll I do?

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though lungless and "shapeless," they thrive
(Where it's humid) in trees. There were five
Kinds of tree salamander;
Now six, climbing, meander
And skitter. Let's hope they survive.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm observant and Jewish; I pray.
Yes, I daven three times every day.
Sabbath? Holidays? Four,
And Yom Kippur, one more.
It keeps tsuris away. No? Oy vey!

limerick_list.author: Maddog
limerick_list.text:
People say I'm gray-headed.  They're wrong!
My hair's SILVER, and SILKY and STRONG!
While it's aged just a bit,
It's remarkably fit
(Says the beauty who's borne it so long).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a small yellow flower that begs
Her to pick it, but Peggy reneges.
"You are merely a weed,
And you'll never succeed.
You're just toadflax, or butter-and-eggs."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Mafia seldom says "please"
When the cash in your pocket they seize.
They'll suggest (if you owe
Them a bundle of dough):
"Cough it up, or we're breaking your knees!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
She hides notes in her bra (she's big-busted)
But her character's warped, maladjusted.
She's a spy for Peru
But helps Ecuador, too.
Double agents like her can't be trusted.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
At the moment, we want room to store stuff:
Obscene figurines and decor stuff.
But the chest won't align.
This encoignure works fine:
Unobtrusive and holds even more stuff.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
When physicians or surgeons would say
Something's different, they say it their way.
Yes, they sound quite ingenious
When they say allogeneous.
You believe that they're earning their pay.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As I study his face, my pen slides
Across Bristol board.  Swiftly it glides
As I draw my friend Walter.
It's nice: if I falter,
I can flip it and draw on both sides.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
As a cop, I don't search to be mean.
It's not fun, it's a simple routine.
I'm not groping your charms;
I'm just patting for arms.
You'll be right on your way — if you're clean.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Cans and boxes of edibles go
To feed families that run out of dough.
When a food drive is started,
Hey, don't be hard-hearted —
It might have been you on skid row.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Rented tuxes just never seem right.
Hired limos are corny and trite.
  This corsage is quite lame.
  I've forgotten my name!
So much awkwardness looms here tonight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Are there tooth fairies out on a mission—
To purchase deciduous dentition?
Coins replace teeth that fall;
Some kids know, after all,
That their parents fulfill that position.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a chef, Betty Ann is a silly girl.
On top of each dish, she'll add Dilly Girl.
"Though this garlicky cheddar,"
I said, "makes meals better,
Don't use Dilly Girl so willy-nilly, girl!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend Pete loves his meat; he's a glutton
For chops, whether veal, pork or mutton.
When his wife chops up meat
To make meatballs to eat,
He repeats, "Gimme chops, or serve nuttin'!"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
An invention has managed to spare
You the pain in your bottom, I swear,
If you purchase a seat,
Anesthesia-complete,
In the very first Novo-caned chair.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My kid sister was angry and whiny:
"Ma, you oughta spank big brudder's heinie!"
It was true what she'd said.
I'd put bugs in her bed,
And the beetles (Goliath) weren't tiny.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I like bread, but I don't eat the crust.
That brown edge leaves me full of disgust.
So I don't end up grossed,
When you're making me toast,
You will trim off the margins, I trust.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Divine providence brought me to you.
My bashert, you're my soulmate; it's true.
What will be, predesigned,
Is two lives intertwined.
We're a match made in Heaven.  "I do."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"He's my albatross," Doctor Dan sighs,
With a world-weary look in his eyes.
"The man's chronically ill
And he'll stick with me till
The day one of us finally dies."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My friend was a very late bloomer,
A joker and squirt gun consumer.
When his aim went awry,
I got shot in the eye.
I'm a victim of aqueous humor.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
'Twas a hall full of patients senescent—
A parade of the slow and quiescent,
Some crabbing and aching,
Some fecklessly faking,
And a few with complaints delitescent.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Coruscatingly witty, he shines;
On each topic he brightly opines.
He's so dazzlingly smart
That he's captured my heart...
(I've had nine of these blackberry wines.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you're making a figure in clay,
An armature helps the clay stay.
And to further protect
It, and keep it erect,
Use a back iron; then it won't sway.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You don't need a double or triple—
Just one mark in the margin, a diple,
To express what is meant.
It's a line that is bent,
And more useful, I'd think, than a stipple.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
It is time that we called us a truce,
But I shan't wear that silly burnoose.
I don't mind the false nose,
And the surgical hose,
But I like my clothes tight, sir, not loose.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Which is taller?  The guy on the right.
They've crossed sides now — he's lost all that height!
This clever illusion
Engenders confusion.
The Ames room befuddles your sight.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I dislike you. My loathing runs deep.
I would lose not a minute of sleep
Should I learn you were dead;
Bugger off, go ahead.
Find yourself a ravine—and then leap.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl and man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Get used to this polar location,
The cold and the bare isolation.
The snow's off the chart,
So you might as well start
Acclimation to life at the station.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Harold's crimes were all real but not great.
His parole bid brought lots of debate.
He'd received five-to-ten.
Would the board vote again,
And set lawbreaker Hal loose in eight?

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Capybaras will capture your heart:
They're a capital rodent, and smart.
In captivity, they
Like to caper and play
With your carp—hard to keep 'em apart.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I don't think that you've heard what I said.
All your doodling is doing my head
And your damn doodle-sack
Is pressed right up my back.
Do you have to play bagpipes in bed?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As I choke back a tearful display,
I get this from my wife, Ellie May:
"I can't take any more!
You've seen Bambi before,
So it shouldn't affect you this way!"

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
A pirate sends greetings with thunder,
Inflamed with the prospect of plunder.
There's nothing so jolly
As Roger's rude volley,
Striking gold-laden victims asunder.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
A busload of cheerleaders stopped by,
And into my hot tub they hopped.  My!
There were giggles and screams . . .
(Wait, it's one of those dreams,
A result of those pills that I popped. Sigh.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
David Carradine, everyone knew,
Was a star back in '72.
Though Kill Bill was a treat,
The role no one can beat
Was his "Caine" from the program Kung Fu.

limerick_list.author: joankay
limerick_list.text:
Said the nautilus, "Cousin, keep back.
As an octopus, you never lack
For romantic, dark charms,
Like philandering arms
Or your cephalopod's inky sac."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
San Francisco's mass transit, to me,
Is a huge disappointment.  I see
That no cable car has
Such amenities as
I'd expected, like cable TV.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A brake disc's a disc on a wheel
Of a bike or an automobile,
Which the brake pads will grip,
Controlling its slip,
And should slow it down with no squeal.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Sneered the pirates, "Girls, welcome aboard—
You outshine all the treasure we've stored!
Our curved blades will persuade
Any hesitant maid..."
(And each cutlass is marked, once they've scored.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With Livia, Vivie must divvy a
Cash prize from a quiz based on trivia:
Candomblé dance? A samba.
Right. What's Cochabamba?
A city in Central Bolivia!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There is nothing in life I recall
That disturbs me as much as a brawl.
Though I try from each angle,
There's nought in a wrangle
That might recommend it at all.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
I have copped a feel on a cop
Name of Mike, and I don't have to stop.
Always liked boys in blue,
So I married him too.
He's so cute that my friends' jaws just drop.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Living long was Victoria's fate,
While son "Bertie" the prince, had to wait.
Though he had a wild fling,
Edward VII, as king,
Brought the monarchy right up to date.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Lots of fauna, including our race,
May be studied in time or in space.
And such records, faunistic
(Unlike those, floristic)
Show most creatures move place to place.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
With technologies splitting off midstream,
It's every computerized kid's dream
To buzz round the world
On a network empearled,
With bazillions of words all in bitstream.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Here's a gibe (to wit, taunt) he would wield,
Causing hurt if a name was revealed:
Her resolve to avert
Being labelled a flirt
Meant she always would easily yield.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The creed of our newest foundation—
For animal equalization:
No creature's superior
And none is inferior.
Crustacean is peer of Dalmatian.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
You complain of how often we fight—
Sure, we argue all day and all night,
But you must want to row,
'Cause our feud could end now
If you'd simply concede that I'm right.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
In sickness and also in health;
To share body and soul (and my wealth):
I said, "Yes, this I vow,"
But I disavow now,
As I plan my departure in stealth.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I don't like how you dress like a clown.
I don't like how you strut about town.
But, of course, I'll be there,
Even if people stare:
It's a given I won't let you down.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Coming up on Survivor: Malaysia,
Each tribe gets a wild ox of Asia
Called a banteng. They're tough.
Tie it up with your buff
And milk it. You're up, Anastasia.

limerick_list.author: Jane A Russell
limerick_list.text:
There was a young baby called Daniel
Who wanted to cherish his spaniel.
He said, "I'm too new—
I can't look after you!
I wonder perhaps if my Grannie'll?"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I went down by the river to jog,
Saw some ferns, and jumped over a log;
There my shoes were enslurped,
Stickied, spongied, and burped
By the damp, grasping, Hoover-esque bog.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
As the camera moves close for a zoom,
Not a sound can be heard in the room,
And it's obvious why:
The mike's thirty feet high—
"Hey, José!  Time to lower the boom."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As the pretty young girls run along,
From your park bench, you lust—that's so wrong!
You wear hideous clothes.
Snot runs out of your nose.
(Can't believe you're the star of this song!)

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Sexuality, Abelites said,
Had no place in the marital bed.
But today, one suspects
That abstaining from sects
Is a path that is much more widespread.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Do all back-seat drivers annoy?
No, I'm one—mine's a job I enjoy.
You may see me zip by
Because I am a guy
In the fire department's employ.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
You have come to my bar Christmas Eve;
My liqueur's almost gone, so I grieve.
When you go, not a lot'll
Be left in the bottle—
My absinth you took without leave!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Emergency medicine can
Be defined as the whole treatment span
From where trauma care starts
Till the patient departs
The ER — at least, that is the plan.

limerick_list.author: Kakuzan
limerick_list.text:
In Paris, a boulevardier
Will saunter the Champs-Élysées;
He's a name in cafés
And in smart ateliers,
And an opera habitué.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Le Musée showed concern; they were driven
By the fear of another limb riven.
And so to make peace,
Venus signed a release
As "Old Armless", the name she'd been given.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf and Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Kay received many comments (quite crass!)
From the biblicist teaching the class.
At her first faint complaint,
He replied, "I'm no saint!
I can't help it... I covet thine ass!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
For my birthday I often beseech
You to spirit me off to a beach.
By your gift I'm bemused:
A chlorometer (used),
To determine the power of bleach.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Cisternography's not about rain
Nor the spider you flushed down a drain.
Subarachnoid's the space
Where a doctor will face
Something scary that's deep in your brain.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
We abbreviate down with dn.
Unambiguous?  Yes, except when
It is turned on its head:
Then it reads up instead.
What a contrary stroke of the pen!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
When the light turns to red, don't you dare
Stop your car in the crossing or square.
That's called blocking the box,
Causing gridlock for blocks:
You'll be fined, and mad drivers will swear!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Dee Steinway, cut down in her prime,
Had arrived at the scene of the crime
Just exactly when planned,
As a stray concert grand
Fell to earth at the very same time.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
My Sunday out's ruined! You said
We could catch Johnny Ray, but he's dead.
And Ray Charles? Gone too;
Guess the beach has to do,
So let's just catch some rays there instead.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He's a famed good-time Charlie, they say,
One who parties all night and all day.
Chasing women and boozing,
It's clear he'd be choosing
A life of no work and all play.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
There's a feeling I just cannot hide:
With my mouth opened up side to side
I look like an ape,
Full of fear, mouth agape,
When the dentist says "Now, open wide."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In our poli sci classroom, our mentor
Asked us each our political bent.  Her
Poll questioned our views
On the GOP—choose
One: __assentor, __dissentor, or __center.

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
A corkscrew I fear I am lacking,
So this bottle I've taken to whacking
On the side of this ship,
In the hope of a nip,
Should the bottle oblige me by cracking.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
She declared, "Someone else loves me true,"
To which he replied, "Good for you!"
She gasped: "Such extolling
Is very controlling."
Amazed, he said, "Who controls who?"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Many comics will bank on their lewdness
And their jokes are all weighed by their rudeness;
They are base and maligning.
In truth, they're declining—
They must overcome all this crudeness.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
In Sumer, the god of the air
And the king of the gods worshipped there,
Was called En-lil, and he
Let the tempests roam free,
Which could lead to a nasty affair.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"The body text": That's the main part
Of my book on Romanian art,
Without footnotes or headings
(Like "Artists and Weddings")—
Between the last  word and the start.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Hybrid blindfish, as scientists find,
Sometimes see, once their genes are combined.
In the land of the lightless,
These partially sightless
Are kings, blindly leading the blind.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
A frame grabber video grabs,
For machine vision; research in labs,
With precision and speed.
Not what YouTubers need:
A mere capture card their output nabs.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Your coworker sleeps on the job
While you dutifully polish each knob.
You're the diligent one.
He's the president's son—
Groomed for management, yessiree Bob!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A lady I knew lay in waiting
For a man versed in deft carbon-dating.
But the "C" in her mind
Was the crystalline kind,
Used in wooing, pursuing, and mating.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
You were quite unaware of the menaces
Of bioelectro, uh, genesis.
Then a shock from an eel
To your groin made you reel
As if hit by a ball (one of tennis's).

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
A middle-class lass (a bourgeoise)
Disdains to wear corsets and bras.
Her bust left untrussed
Causes ladies disgust,
But the gentlemen greet her with ahs.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Shedding branches from trees make a mess.
Cladoptosis: reaction to stress?
Reproduction? Self pruning?
Or simply fine tuning?
It's a topic I'd like to address.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
First they dampened the ground on the farm.
(Wetter dirt would cause backs far less harm.)
Then these strong sons of toil
Each removed tons of soil,
Digging deep with no cause for alarm.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Kaye said, "Jennifer Aniston's there!
Ooh, what style! What a smile!" "What a pair!"
(That was me.) "Know what part
Of that Friend steals my heart?"
"Let me guess—it's her ass." "No, her hair."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Don't get huffy, kid — this is the norm.
Freshmen students must fill out this form.
Just supply what's requested,
And once we have blessed it
Your mommy can live in the dorm.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'm still young, yet my spine's out of whack.
My damn duty belt's killing my back.
It holds gear that I need
On the job to succeed,
Right at hand if the bad guys attack.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
The Cubism school Analytic
Drew kudos from many a critic.
Picasso and Braque
Rendered facets like rock
In forms angular, square, pyramidic.

limerick_list.author: Kim Le
Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I daringly chose to torment
The circus's bears in their tent.
I had thought they were chained,
Or, at least, were well trained…
What's left of my arm? Ten percent.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
We have Teddy as hostage, you heard?
And to trick us would be quite absurd.
Better do as we sez,
We want one million PEZ.
Unmarked bank notes? No, candy preferred.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Six abreast, the defenders stand tall:
In this soccer match, Foul's been the call.
The resulting free kick
Travels goalwards; the trick —
Bend the ball 'round or over the wall.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Peers praised, with a standing ovation,
My deftness at decerebration.
That cortex removal
Got lavish approval;
The patient withheld adulation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What's a cental?" you ask. I submit
It's a hundredweight. Yes, it's legit.
It's a hundred pounds, or
Just a little bit more—
Twelve pounds extra—that's if you're a Brit.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Soul Stirrers had as their lead
Young Sam Cooke, a great talent indeed.
When pop music called,
Some in gospel's crowd bawled
'Cause they knew with that voice he'd succeed.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Rick said, "Play it!" to Sam in the bar;
It's the line that made Bogie a star.
So why is it then
That "Play it again"
Is the quote that we hear near and far?

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
"Our supply line's been nipped in a trap,
So we're doling out ammo, old chap.
Save your bullets, says Sarge,
For the bastards' last charge."
"You Tommy die soon!" yelled a Jap.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ten years old! We have reached our decennary.
At our meeting we're planning a plenary
To salute pioneers,
As we've done other years:
On our senary—also novenary.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Medieval tribes Lucas and Lawson
Fought feudally.  Neither will toss in
The towel just yet.
Hell, these clans even met
On TV with the host Richard Dawson.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Once a witch who emerged from her tomb
Tried to fly in the sky, through the gloom,
But the fog proved a glitch;
She was pitched in a ditch
When she landed her broom in the brume.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
So you're saying invest in this stock?
What's the downside? What risk of a shock?
Is it likely to fall?
Could I lose my small all?
I'm in doubt, but that beats "I'm in hock."

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
If you happen to have a large debt,
Which you haven't paid off, there's a threat
That the person you owe
Might distrain your chateau:
Seize and hold it for balance unmet.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Said a pretty soprano from Devon,
"When I hit a high B I'm in heaven."
Said the leader, "Big breath!"
She nodded, "Oh yeth,
And I've had them thinth I wath eleven."

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
I've been training a shark, an Alopius
Vulpinus, to catch for me copious
Supplies of small fish.
Reincarnate, he'd wish
You to know he was once Walter Gropius.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
From her deep-eyed appearance, it's clear
She's been dead now for almost a year.
I can not look away
Since I know that, some day,
This is just how I too will appear.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said the judge, "Inadmissable."  She
Talked of evidence fingering me.
"Illegally gotten,
It's tainted and rotten,
This fruit of the poisonous tree."

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
"Find a number," I asked, just for fun.
"Let me guess—the first digit is 1."
Though I'm not very bright,
Three in ten times I'm right.
Benford's law figured out how it's done.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Bob the Builder's not right, I would say.
Can he fix it? He might do, one day.
But to make it more real
He needs to reveal
The bum-crack most builders display.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
You say solids don't drop very far
When you swallow? A surgical scar
Is a possible reason —
Or maybe the squeezin'
Is a cricopharyngeus bar.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
In London, the gate to the east,
Once called Ale-gate, was free for each beast.
Now that Aldgate's its name,
And congestion's the game,
Pay to enter: there's palms to be greased.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cytherea, the goddess, may be a
Fine source for a lover's idea,
But she can't guarantee a
Complete panacea
If the guy should contract gonorrhea.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
In our rugby club, non-playing Mick,
Who's in management, sure makes me sick.
Match day comes, he falls through.
Damn this alickadoo!
What the hell does he do?  Not a lick.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
Often caused by big trucks with big loads,
Corrugations are ridges in roads
(Ungraded and graveled,
Infrequently traveled,
And safest in four-wheeler modes).

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
When his gunpowder, treason and plot
Plans were foiled, Guy Fawkes' death was his lot.
Now on Firework Night,
With the bonfires alight
All his effigies get rather hot.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Gotta pee, I must go to the john —
Please fill in for me, John, while I'm gone."
"Don't use john! Just use loo,
Or your job I won't do
While you're out; I just won't carry on!"

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
A sole individual or strain
Whose chromosome group should contain
Three or more imitations
From genomic relations?
Autopolyploid's the name that shall reign.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
As a fast-food defier I try
To steer clear of those places that fry
All their grub in a vat
Full of gut-building fat—
I am not a "Large fries with that!" guy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm afraid our new boatswain has flipped.
He's gone nuts, round the bend; he's unzipped.
Seems the guy lost his grip
On his very first trip,
And he'll soon be discharged (that's disshipped).

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Lance, you'll stand in my stead with the queen.
She wants patience; you know what I mean.
When my work load decreases,
Your delegacy ceases.
The king requires royal routine.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My stock market venture was lame,
And no winnings, alas, could I claim.
Turkey futures I tried,
But success was denied;
I could not get ahead of the game.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The firemen work down the street
At the firehouse. There they will meet
On a hot August day
And complain straightaway
About sissies who can't take the heat.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The way workmen had shored up my wall
Didn't have any merit at all;
When, with dust-laden rumble,
Stones fell in a crumble,
Their excuses were feeble and small.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
The accused's disclamation went: "No!
I deny that! My lawyer can show
I was not, at that time,
At the place of the crime."
(He'd prove anything though, for more dough.)

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The city of Limerick's renown
Is its comical poetry crown:
Nowhere else has a verse
As amusing and terse
To its name—there's no haiku-based town.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Said my would-be hip prof, "While I'm riffin'
On mythos, I give you the griffin.
Its eagle half launches
From great lion haunches.
Aloft, it looks out for its tiffin."

limerick_list.author: Tristan
limerick_list.text:
Unlike visceral, there's no instantaneous
Death with the form called 'cutaneous'
Leishmaniasis...mostly,
Those lesions (red, ghostly)
Come and go on their own—they're spontaneous.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
An OEDILF writer's life sure is tough.
I can tell you I've waited enough
For those check-overs from
Workshop editors — come,
Please examine my fabulous stuff!

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Spiders and scorpions and ticks
Are not many people's first picks.
As pets they're not sweet,
They have too many feet
And they simply won't learn to do tricks.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I finally snapped from her whining,
So I killed her. There'll be no repining.
And her body? I'll stoke
Up the boiler with coke
And with her. Now her bones are calcining.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Not a tidal wave, nor was it fluvial—
The cause of our flooding was pluvial.
A terrible rain
Inundated our plain,
And caused pain due to damage diluvial.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
If you're digne, that's a reason to revel:
You are excellent, fit, on the level.
But sustain your disdain,
Being vain and a pain,
And they'll say, "You're as digne as the devil."

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Lancôme's face mask of clay's amylaceous:
As a mud pack it's quite efficacious.
Though you'll look like a fright
Caked up, pasty and white,
You'll pale more at the price. It's hellacious!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For the plural of sock, some use sox.
For decor on your sox, use silk clox.
But for docks, don't use dox —
Likewise locks (don't use lox!)
And for tick-tocking clocks, shun tick-tox.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Once a candidate, Johnny stood tall.
We were shocked by his terrible fall,
But this hero, one day,
Showed his feet made of clay,
And John Edwards embarrassed us all.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
When a scrofulous neck swells too much,
You can seek out the king for his touch.
If you're not a fanatic,
Try an antistrumatic,
Or an aspirin might do in the clutch.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
I looked my old friend in the face,
And asked how he'd paid for his space
(A mansion, it's termed).
He smugly affirmed:
"I took Alydar, three times, to place."

limerick_list.author: hugh.adler
limerick_list.text:
Start at C, go to C#, then D,
D# (Eb), E, F, F#, G,
G# (Ab), then A,
Bb, B, and then. . . hey!
You've just played a chromatic on C!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Were those clarinet lessons worthwhile?
Where's the breath control, timing and style?
Sister Anne betrayed strain;
Georgie grimaced in pain,
While Aunt Edith evinced a fake smile.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I was hoping to dazzle a chick,
And my pal said to lay it on thick.
"Get her sapphires," he said.
(I heard samphires instead.)
Well, those carrots did not do the trick.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A color-blind captain called Piggott
Got confused when commanding his frigate—
Was the sea red or green?—
But his crew thought him keen.
Bias-free, he was never a bigot.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You come late to the party, and yet
You expect equal pay?  I would bet
You thought, "Work a short day,
Earn a full day of pay,
As the Bible doth say."  That, forget.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
I'm intrepid — I chuckle at danger;
To whims of mischance I'm no stranger.
But for twenty more years
I'll have genuine fears
From my choice of this mortgage arranger.

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
You blame the black ice you can't see
For wrapping your car 'round a tree.
The cop shakes his head
And suggests that instead
Your speed was a hundred and three.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
Angry Choleric cried, "I'm so mad —
Melancholic needs help when he's sad!"
Answered Sanguine, "It's just
That Phlegmatic ain't fussed
And I don't like to stop feeling glad."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Gnathion: base of a jaw
(That thing that we all use to gnaw).
Its "G" is not sounded,
Which leaves some dumbfounded
Though gnaw is itself pronounced "naw".

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"There's a hallway that goes to his room,
And he sleeps all alone, I assume.
Plant the bomb there tonight
And before it gets light
In the morning, the room will go BOOM!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
There's a doll on my arm for the night.
She is gorgeous but isn't too bright—
Very little upstairs.
With that kisser, who cares?
My staid colleagues are envious, quite.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
I once fought with a Japanese ninja
And he sought, as a sport, me to injure.
But his blade held no fear;
He could do me no dere
With a samurai sword made of ginger.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I had sunburn, real bad, on both thighs.
Said the nurse, "There's a cream I'd advise."
When she dabbed on some aloe,
Because I'm so shallow,
I dabbed bitter tears from my eyes.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
To bathe might be fun, not just cleaning,
Even more so if you are convening
In a huge bathing tub,
At a free bathers' club,
Whatever its aims might be meaning.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Dioeciously many herbs grow
Individually sexed, dontcha know:
It's just pollen from one,
While his consort bears none.
But the seed is all hers to bestow.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
My new missile can carry a bomb
To American targets on Guam.
It's ballistic: it flies,
Reaching marvelous highs.
So don't push, and I might remain calm.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A collie's a dog that can tell
Timmy's mom that he fell down a well.
But it's tough to repair
All the knots in the hair
Of the Lassie from dog-grooming hell.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Disaffectionate—distant and cold—
Katie's attitude made me less bold.
Her demeanor, aloof,
I accepted as proof
That she prized herself higher than gold.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An octopus kept as a pet
Is a concept I just do not get.
And yet experts agree
That the bimac might be
A good choice you'll not likely regret.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
In this lim'rick my love story's written.
I love Katie, as cute as a kitten.
No maid can delight me,
Bewitch and besmite me
Like Katie, with whom I'm besmitten.

limerick_list.author: Phyl Reinhard
limerick_list.text:
She flushed when she said, "You are aces,"
To the comic who made funny faces.
With a full house of cards,
He had won her regards
In a straight poker club, of all places.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
You are cross-eyed, my friend, I maintain.
You deny it? Then let me explain.
Your chiasm serves
To reroute optic nerves
To the opposite side of your brain.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Caudipteryx—was it a bird
Or a dinosaur?  Details are blurred.
From the evidence, I
Say this thing couldn't fly,
And all scientists since have concurred.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Her cheeks show a roseate flare.
In my camera, the light makes a glare.
There's a coating of gray
On the chocolate? No way!
It's a three-kinds-of-bloomin' affair!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
A fruit-loving fellow from Guam
Loved balaustine desserts (made of pom-
egranate, whose flowers
Have medicinal powers
When dried, as a tea or a balm).

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
From the depths of the dictionary's gloom
To the light of a modern-day room
Comes "a statute", "a law",
"An enactment" (there's more),
"An ordinance": all of them doom.

limerick_list.author: woodfostersmith
limerick_list.text:
Bromouracil molecules may
Sub for thymine in one's DNA.
Their structure is such
That it doesn't take much
To put chromosomes in disarray.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
I wish I had something to squeeze,
But I'm flat as a board with two peas.
"Will a boob job help, doc?"
"It would put you in hock!"
"Can you show me a bargain rack, please?"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Little Joey would not comb his hair;
"You can't make me!" he'd often declare.
His poor mother would fight,
Every morning and night,
To remove all the tangles with care.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
For breakfast, here comes Aunt Jemima;
She knows that I'm no wisenheima.
Her syrupy grace
Stuffs a hungry man's face.
There's no waffling — no food is sublima.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
You have lumps on your neck and your head;
They're so painful, you wish you were dead.
This infection exotic
(Actinomycotic)
Is from actinomyces that spread.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
This invention is farcical, Dan! Nix
Its dumb dipping duckbill mechanics!
What ruins your wild notion
(Perpetual motion)?
The first law of thermodynamics!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
