We were treated with great cordiality;
Seems our host had a warm personality—
But long before dawn
All our money was gone.
We were fooled by his fake hospitality.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
An eastern gray squirrel will stash
Bits of food that it finds in a flash.
Using landmarks and smell,
It remembers quite well
The location of each little cache.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A debutante (call her a deb)
Has just entered society's web.
In the socialite whirl,
She's no longer a girl,
And in time may become a celeb.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
There's a Turk and a Cypriot fight,
And it's hard to say who's in the right;
For the name of the game
Is to alter the name
Of the sweet once called "lumps of delight."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Titanic Accessories feel
That their marketing's full of appeal,
But it fills me with dread
When they measure my head
And say cap-sizing's part of the deal.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"How frequent", was asked of the boffin,
"Are the times you greet females by doffin'
Your hat?" Answered he,
"I infrequently see
Any girls, so: 'not frequent'." (Not often.)

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Avocado has flesh like green butter;
On crackers, it sets me aflutter.
Its alligator skin
Keeps the pear that's within
From rotting and making you splutter.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Willie Horton was tops at the plate;
Al Kaline was hurt but still great.
McLain's 31
Hasn't since been outdone,
And the Tigers were champs: '68.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
My roofers from York, Pennsylvania,
Are cursed with severe dipsomania.
At five, they all stop,
Then imbibe till they drop—
They awaken to hammering crania.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
With Maid Marion caught in a scrape,
Friar Tuck whips a plan into shape:
By diverting the foe
Using Robin Hood's bow,
He provides her an arrow escape.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
After losing my cash playing poker,
I entrusted my stocks to a joker.
I shouldn't have spoke
When I said I was broke—
Now I'm broker because of my broker.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
At a heartbreaker picture, she weeps.
Flicks of horror just give her the creeps.
At movies romantic,
She's transformed wild and frantic,
But at technical films she just sleeps.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
My doom, like some play, was enacted
By beasts that my life's-blood attracted.
The timber-wolves blinked
While my Remington plinked
Till the fire went extinct. Then they acted.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Of Fortuna, whose ends we can't see,
The old patriarch asked, "Hid from me
Is what's writ on the slate:
What's my family's fate?"
"I won't say. It's clandestine," said she.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Eastern cooking will call for this spice,
Whose smell and rich taste are so nice.
When mulling some wine,
And you want something fine,
Let some cardamom flavor suffice.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For a gal, it's a shoe with a strap,
And a sock, kinda short, for a chap.
It's an ornament worn
On the leg to adorn.
So they're anklets, all three. That's a wrap!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
That promiscuous daughter of yours
Is a nympho — out looking for scores,
Always sex on the mind.
Any man she can find
Brings the prospect of dropping her drawers.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At the prom, Moose blew into his flute
And champagne spilled all over his suit.
"I thought music would come."
Lord, this fellow is dumb,
And his knowledge of music's minute.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Grandma's sighs were ejected, exhaled,
And first heard when her grandson was jailed.
When she couldn't raise bail,
She, tormented, turned pale,
And complained, in great pain, that she'd failed.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
It's uncanny that when I feel glamorous,
The children decide to be clamorous.
By the time they calm down
I am left with a frown —
It ensures I'll no longer feel amorous.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Once a copygraph (hectograph) pad
Reproduced printed copies. Too bad
That it's no longer used.
But you might be amused—
It's adapted for tatting your dad.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
They want me to plough the backyard,
But just scratching the surface is hard
With this quite categoric-
ally most prehistoric
Scratch-plough that is known as an ard.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When Venus's phase is a crescent,
The unlit side looks luminescent.
I wept at the sight
Of this pale ashen light,
And they fed me an antidepressant.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
His claim under "color of title"
Is a con; be aware that it's vital
To contest it in court.
The land's yours. That report
On his title's a bogus recital.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The word blow means "cocaine." That you know.
But in England it's weed that's called blow.
Fearing narcs? Watch your ass!
Do without coke and grass:
Get your high from a tasty Merlot.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
If you're living at no fixed abode,
So you spend night and day on the road,
Sell The Big Issue. Soon
You will reach for the moon.
Turn your life round by sharing your load.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The ubiquitous dandelion spreads
Its delicate seeds to new beds.
At first yellow and bright,
It turns white overnight,
Then goes bald, with the smallest of heads.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Look here, there's a cork tree for sale.
An Amur. Let us check one detail.
If the tree goes to seed
It will spread like a weed.
Read the label; make sure that it's male.

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
Bacteriophagy downed
A bug that was going around;
Because of it, Lydia
Found her chlamydia
Eighty percent less profound.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
My boss was all like, "It's a crime!"
But I just had to finish the rhyme!
I needed to shirk
All my duties at work,
For I wrote this on company time.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I am a beagle-at-large.
When my nose detects chow, in I barge.
I'll never stop begging
(For food I keep egging),
And isn't the beagle-in-charge?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Your fairylike fingers are limp.
More effort is needed: don't skimp.
Just give it some welly
And on comes the telly —
That button — press harder, you wimp!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
An anonymous letter was sent
By a customer wanting to vent.
It was hostile and rude,
Leading folks to conclude
That this crank wasn't very content.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This project is clearly ambitious;
Definitions we write are delicious.
Our goal, never fear,
Will be nearer next year
(Though my wife is becoming suspicious).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is hot and it's still, so beware.
We'll get heat stroke—or worse—I declare!
We need wind that will blow
From high pressure to low.
What we want is a current of air.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
The Diaspora: Jews have moved on;
To all ends of the earth they have gone.
From Nairobi to Nome,
They all yearn for one home,
And say, "Next year in Boca Raton!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Here's cellulose-methyl-carboxy
(Writ backwards)—it's not an epoxy.
This substance is gummy
And, put in your tummy,
Will work as a laxative proxy.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Jack the Ripper went roaming the night,
Slashing women—his source of delight.
He would mutilate chicks
For his sexual kicks.
Is that amokoscisia?  Quite.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Are you sidious, ruthful or ruly?
Or just trepid—now answer me truly.
Unpaired words (like these freaks
I've collected for weeks)
May be wieldy; disport with them coolly.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
That your love is eternal, I've trusted.
Whence twins, and fraternal? We lusted.
Your frolics erotic
Left clues dizygotic
And heteropaternal! You're busted!

limerick_list.author: cecelia
limerick_list.text:
In winter, why is it he's chosen
To dress in such short Lederhosen?
All the chafing and rubbing
(Despite constant dubbing)
Just heightens the pain when he's frozen.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Electronics: the current must flow
Where electrical fields make it go.
No switches here, mister,
Just tube or transistor.
Not physical — physics, you know.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Here's the book on this kid: He can bunt;
Stay alert, 'cause he's up for a stunt.
Look, we know the kid's smart —
Baseball head, lots of heart —
If he squares, don't charge too close up front.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
To fabricate illness, some try.
They may claim they've a pain, but they lie.
They're just seeking attention,
And yet I should mention,
One day they will actually die.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
"The comedian wasn't amusing,"
Said the patron. "In fact, he's confusing.
I never once laughed.
All his jokes were quite daft,
And for most of the show, I was snoozing."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
When the missile went wobbly, we ducked,
And I ordered: "Proceed with destruct!
Don't just sit there, you dunce —
Push the button at once!
If it falls on our heads, we'll be — out of lucked!"

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
The aardvark is shaped like a pillow
And 'round it the dirt will oft billow,
As it digs in your shrubs
For its favorite grubs—
Oh, wait, I've defined armadillo.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
For biconical shape, take a cone;
Place one more, point-to-point, like a bone.
Thus bow-tie arrayed,
An antenna is made,
For the Super-High-Frequency zone.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When our neighbors are loathsome, despicable,
Act so badly we feel they are kickable,
And they're sly, underhanded,
Then baddies they're branded.
What drives them? It seems inexplicable!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I love binary code," proclaims Kevin.
"It's the first step to programming heaven.
'It's so hard to get through,'
Say some people. Not true!
It's as easy as one, ten, eleven!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Engulfment was Jessica's goal.
She was fully engrossed, heart and soul,
In consuming her man.
"Best get out while you can,"
Warned his friends, "or she'll swallow you whole."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My football coach said, "It appears
That your bodily fear interferes
With the way this game's played."
Seems I'm also afraid
Words can hurt — his have brought me to tears.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If I'm called autotelic, don't take
Me all wrong. I'm not looking to make
A subversive decree,
But my motto can be
Represented as art for art's sake.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
So evocative, lovely is dernful:
Meaning "secret, hence sad; somewhat yearnful".
Though it's now obsolete,
Still, it's pretty darn sweet.
Now doesn't this make you feel learnful?

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Gearhart
limerick_list.text:
On a Harley, a T. rex just came
To my mind when I first heard this name,
And an image more stern
Was evoked than a fern.
Cyclosorus sounds hip but it's lame!

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
Mother's mother, my grandma or grannie,
Was known in our family as Fanny.
She nursed and protected me,
'Cause mother neglected me.
Grannie Fanny was also my nanny.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A victim of serious burns
Finds it painful whenever he turns.
In his search for relief
From his torment and grief,
For an antipyrotic he yearns.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
We sat at the campfire, in turn
Making comments on what we might learn.
With a penchant for fustian,
She called it combustion,
While I said, "We're watching it burn."

limerick_list.author: B.S. Eliot
limerick_list.text:
A buddha's a cosmic hep cat,
Who's figured out just where it's at.
When reading a koan,
One let out a groan:
"It isn't as hard as all that!"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
She loves me! I'm simply delighted,
For the passion of love is ignited.
Loves me not! It's now clear:
A delusion. I fear
That my love will remain unrequited.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Dug from mud that till now was our bed,
Two-shelled mollusks are heartlessly fed
To the fans of our kind,
Who have food on their mind—
Bivalve goodies to add to their spread.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
A biologist said, "I'm impressed
With a firm and calyculate breast.
If it's more than size B,
It is wasted on me.
I find small cup-shaped breasts are the best."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The clergy must be like a rock,
Underpinning and guiding their flock.
But if they're unsure
How to open the door
To their God, they're a stumbling block.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Neighbors needing supplies and our charity,
Sharpie altered storm's path and severity.
Would such baseless sillery
Have been spawned under Hillary?
Track the eye, and enjoy the hilarity.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"My Scotch woodcock I'm hoping you'll taste
With my Gentleman's Relish."  In haste,
She just fled.  Don't know why
She's unwilling to try
Eggs on toast spread with anchovy paste.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Painful sores on your tum's mucous lining
Are agony — might leave you whining!
They're slow healing; indeed,
Gastric ulcers can bleed
In your stomach. They put you off dining.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I had thought my new suitor was rich,
But he gave me a diamond which
He declared was first water!"
Cried my boneheaded daughter.
"Now the jerk's, with his ring, in a ditch."

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
We've steamed these young stalks till they're tender;
Made some mayo with help from my blender.
What an elegant dish,
Absolutely delish—
Come partake of asparagus splendor!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though her house had burned down, she's not bitter,
And the burn center's bound to admit her.
Life goes on. She's upbeat,
Though I just got this tweet:
"I do not like the term crispy critter!"

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I've been off of the grid since '04.
Cut the cord for a decade or more.
Is there something I've missed?
Seems like everyone's pissed.
Let me guess... Is the president Gore?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you step on it barefoot, you'll bristle.
You may curse, but you won't simply whistle.
It's the emblem of Scots,
And in Scotland, they've lots;
It's the plant that we call cotton thistle.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Cyberfeminism studies and checks
Social constructs, like gender and sex,
Whilst desiring a new
True utopian view,
And its feminist muscles to flex.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your cesspool's where waste water flows
When you've soaked in your tub or washed clothes,
Or when flushing your toilet—
Did that one just spoil it?—
It's icky where all that stuff goes!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
If a grandchild you'd fain antecede,
Interceding is needed, indeed,
To remind your descendants
They're behind in dependents,
So they'd better get busy and breed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Kindly distance yourself from my child,
All that drooling looks fearsomely wild.
I prefer to believe
She's still sweet and naïve,
So back off! I'll not see her defiled.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Disobligement: it means one's released
From a duty. For instance, that priest
Who was told to take leave
After last Christmas Eve
When he preached that the Pope rode the Beast.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The buds and the leaves on the boughs,
Like the shoots, can be eaten by cows.
They're the parts of a tree
Many loggers agree
Are a waste, and they're known as the browse.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
After arguing 'bout it for days,
Getting stuck in a word-quibbling maze,
I said, "Josh, this is it —
It is time that we split!"
So we each went our separate ways.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
Ancient Romans would call them Engraulidae.
Would those anchovies rhyme? Not with all I'd eye.
Scholars say they're Engraulidae—
Fishy snacks for my holiday.
For Engraulidae? "Dee" please, don't drawl a "dye".

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Abradants wear down (or erode)
Great canyons where rivers have flowed,
But that takes forever.
A woman's more clever:
One look and my wife has me snowed.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Ol' Gramps says his grandson's a hoot,
That he sets an example, to boot.
"Bud's exemplary, true;
He's examplary, too,
And I know that 'cuz I'm an old coot."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When a metaphor, grossly inflated,
Makes a subtlety sound understated,
Then the stoniest ear
Finds the meaning is clear,
Borne by words not just laden but freighted.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Morning gab shows all feature a crawl,
Rolling by, often cryptic and small.
Mini-headlines onscreen
Are a daily routine,
Repetitions, weird spellings and all.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Stop them sucking your blood? It's no dice:
They hang on for dear life, body lice.
They're nasty, these cooties,
For certain no beauties.
They make you feel lousy — not nice!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Daily dinner here's barely alright:
Cowboy caviar (name's a delight)—
Just your basic baked beans
Served with nondescript greens
On the side. Yup, you're farting all night.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I'm alert, and I listen intently
To all that occurs."  "Evidently,
Your ear to the ground
Let in nary a sound
As a hoodlum drove off in my Bentley!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Your ascendancy took quite a while
To achieve, but in spite of their guile,
Now you've made it; it's done,
You're the new number one,
The head honcho, the top of the pile.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My name's Strolin. In Maui I'd stress
It begins with the alphabet "S,"
Meaning "letter." But why
Does this practice apply?
It's from Japanese locals, we guess.

limerick_list.author: David R. Litwin
limerick_list.text:
As the witch-doctor pours out the tea,
I am troubled by something I see:
In the tin can whence comes
The decoction are thumbs!
They've been boiled with roots just for me.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
There once was an avant-garde pharaoh
Who ordered a peppermint Aero.
The waiter (from Spain)
Didn't come, so again
The Egyptian king yelled "Camarero!"

limerick_list.author: Prolix3
limerick_list.text:
For her birthday give wifey a boa,
And her heart will beat fasta, not slowa.
You can say, "What the heck,"
As it curls round her neck,
"If it's feathers she likes, well I'll showa!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
Full of sex and obscene titillation,
My verses oft cause a sensation;
But alas! what I write
For OEDILF (that's this site)
Is subjected to bowdlerization.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Mister Fancy Pants! You, with the cloak!
I despise all you la-di-da folk!
Ruffled shirt fronts and such?
And that stick pin? Too much!
But that fancy-pants cape? What a joke!

limerick_list.author: agingjb
limerick_list.text:
Now, birdwatchers, what's this we hear?
Is it true that, for most of the year,
The black-headed gull
Is really quite dull?
And the common gull's rarer; how queer!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The caddow or jackdaw's nefarious,
A crowlike bird, often gregarious.
Two flew to the altar
With scarcely a falter
And cawed at the priest, "Won't you marry us?"

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
I beseech you, dear Congress, impeach.
We need action, not speech after speech.
Hey, you on the Hill,
All you need is the will.
This I beg: Bush's end is in reach.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
It's dazzling, brilliant and stunning!
It's fulgurant; no, I'm not funning!
Like a bolt from the blue
Is the project that you
Have presented to showcase your cunning!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
On TV, silly bloopers we watch
Of some actors and lines that they botch
Plus the clips of some guys
Letting loose with their cries
Of great pain when they're hit in the crotch.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Can you tell me what Pat Garrett did?
Yeah, that's right. He shot Billy the Kid.
Did folks witness this feat
On a hot western street?
No, he shot from the dark where he hid.

limerick_list.author: Rose
limerick_list.text:
Said the diva, who gave a slight cough,
To the jubilant fat lady, sof-
tly, "What I'm gonna say,
Please don't take the wrong way:
They're applauding because you came off."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
At the lingerie shop, she complains,
"This brassiere lifts so high that it pains!
And I haven't a clue
As to what I should do,
Though I'm sitting here racking my brains."

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
You evolved from the apes?  Well, not me.
All my ancestors—they're monkey free.
When you say that we're kin,
You engender chagrin.
You're a nut, not from my family tree.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's tough getting children to mind;
And I know that you're often inclined
To go easy for fear
They won't love you, but, dear,
It's okay to be cruel to be kind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Is a  bar bit an act that, perforce,
You perform in a pub—with remorse
The next morning? No, it's
Merely one of those bits
That you place in the mouth of a horse.

limerick_list.author: Mr. Parx
limerick_list.text:
Upending the sausage-dog fryer's bliss,
I proclaimed to the vendor, "Too dry is this!
It just couldn't be crisper!"
He replied with a whisper,
"A link that's too pink?  Allantiasis!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Amphotericin B (drips, not pills)
Hurt my kidneys and heart, gave me chills.
But that was extraneous:
It cured mucocutaneous
Leishmaniasis. (Worth all the bills.)

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate lady named Ella
Was given the push by her fella
On account of B.O.;
She just didn't know,
Because her best friends wouldn't tell her.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"What's the use of a bicycle light?
Fewer calories? That can't be right!"
"No, you dolt. I'll be blunt:
It's the lamp on the front
Of your bike for when riding at night."

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
In a churchyard near gravestones they grow:
The wild flora which fauna all know
Pop out daisylike there,
Being pushed up from where
The departed bide time down below.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In demurrage, not back on the road,
I'm detained: took too long to unload—
What the carriage authorities
Call breach of priorities.
What a crock! They can watch me implode.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I studied a group that was ample,
No limerick gave me a sample
Of a diamb—a foot
That in sonnets I'd put.
In my note you will find an example.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"How I wish every date who's a cutie
Had this trait: a devotion to duty.
I'd convince her to mate,
That it's duty, equate
It with fate."  "Mate, that line is a beauty!"

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind and MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The approach of the next Yuletide fest
 Caused us sweethearts to be gift-obsessed.
 My long hair bought a chain
 For Jim's watch. Oh, the pain!
 He had sold it for combs. I'm distressed.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
Banana slugs ate my new fern.
I sputtered some "dangs" and a "durn."
Under mulch they lurk smugly—
Ten inches of ugly.
Salt shaker in hand...it's my turn!

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Madge daydreams of breasts that were conic
And a lifestyle once wild and hedonic.
Now she's some rich guy's spouse,
With three kids and a house...
A Madonna with children? Ironic.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Doves of peace in my sand dollar, Mummy!"
"No, they're teeth broken out of its tummy.
If that mouth is intact,
It's a lantern. That's fact:
Aristotle discerned it." "That's crummy!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At the graveyard the waiting was wearisome.
I feared that the tomb would be eerie; some-
one said, "You seem wary,
But it's really not scary,
Just gloomy, dear Mary; it's drearisome."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Aphrodite's renowned sweet patootie
Was Adonis, the symbol of beauty
Of the masculine kind
(I have rugged in mind):
Very virile, not fruity, this cutie.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
The Third Reich tried to purify race,
Choosing blondes with the kind of fair face
They thought Aryans  possessed
To lie down with their best.
Their eugenics were stopped, with God's grace.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
It's a plane, the plain sycamore tree.
Acer sycamore maple may be
What Canadians cadge
For their maple-leaf badge;
But my buttonwood better suit me.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Add on method: you need to be knowing
That the interest due's never slowing.
Every month it is paid
On the whole loan, not made
To reflect just the balance still owing.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
A Scots word for a is an ae;
It means one.  When said twice, it's ae ae.
It's a plant bearing fruits—
Rare bananas, real beauts.
They're Hawaiian; I'll grow 'em someday.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
The speaker wrapped up his oration
With an epigrammatic quotation.
This added a bit
Of succinctness and wit,
And some welcome diversification.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It's competitive, here on this cruise;
Every team has a color they choose.
In the cabin next door,
They chose red for their corps.
As for us, we're the berth of the blues.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
To his chick said a testy old vulture,
"Hey, kid, I don't mean to insult ya,
But ya won't find no prey
In that WiFi cafe:
Guess yer hooked on that darn coffee culture."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
On the worksite Jim plays a big role,
For the backhoe is his to control.
From the seat of his cab,
He aims it smack-dab
At the ground and he carves out a hole.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Julie's kittenish, feeling her oats,
And it's spreading! Shy Barb's taking notes.
But the outcome is risky
When those two act frisky:
Soon they're grabbing for each other's throats.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
To say that it's ugly's a stretch.
Besides, this is just a clay sketch,
A bozzetto; maquette.
You have no need to fret.
When I do you in stone you may kvetch.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Buying real estate? Listen, my man.
Don't go thinking it's catch as catch can.
Deed or map is a must,
Plus a rep you can trust.
Hit or miss is no sub for a plan.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We've refined this proposal all day.
Its few faults are at last fined away
(Or hidden in jargon;
It sounds a real bargain).
Aim for perfect, but deal with okay.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
In response to your recent averment
That you just didn't know what that slur meant —
With your words came a snort,
So I'm forced to retort:
Your averment's too fervent — they were meant.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A blunderkin's someone inept,
Like the lumbering doofus who stepped
On my foot on the bus
And, on hearing me cuss,
Proved at punching extremely adept.

limerick_list.author: Screenhog
limerick_list.text:
The Frisbee golf pro took a risk
Upon flinging his circular disk.
He'd hoped that the spin
Would establish his win
But it sailed past the boundary. (Tsk, tsk.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Understand me quite clearly, okay?
I could not be more truthful.  No way
Is my friend into you.
God, you're gorgeous, it's true,
But let's get something straight—Zack is gay.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Epilobium canum, it's said,
Is the hummingbird flower. Though deer tread
Near its foliage, it's stout,
And it tolerates drought.
(There's a cultivar named 'Ghostly Red'.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The question on condom expenses
Is the worst of the survey's offenses.
When the counters appear
At our door, we'll make clear
That we plan to take leave of our census.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
I'm bicultural. Yes, it is true,
Mom's a Catholic and Dad is a Jew.
 These two cultures combine
 In one problem of mine:
Oy vey Mary! Such guilt I've been through!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Peel it off, press it on. It can't hurt.
Keep in mind, though, it's tough to revert.
Ecologically "green"?
No, but easy to clean:
Contact paper protects things from dirt.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The bank? He attempted to rob it.
The bomb? He attempted to lob it.
Now Baggins's ankles
Are shackled, which rankles—
A bilbo's attached to this hobbit.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
When the talk turned to penmanship,  Merry
Shyly said, "Yes, my handwriting's scary.
So for help chirographic
I'll brave the mad traffic
To calligraphy class with Prof. Carey."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A mechanical linkage can jam
And disable a battering ram.
If the soldiers can't hear,
They might grease the wrong gear
When the squeakiest wheel is the cam.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
I adore, in a cloud-covered sky,
A blue bore when it catches my eye.
This aperture's rays,
With a hue like a jay's,
Will retreat when a haze passes by.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Your bunt is so charmingly cute,
You'll be sweetness itself when you're mute—
So bye, baby bunting,
Your daddy's a-hunting
To get you a rabbit-skin suit.

limerick_list.author: OxfordVictor
limerick_list.text:
Though the Test Match turned quite catastrophic,
My cab-driver's still philosophic:
"Guv, this series Dahn Under
Has now made me wonder
When you need 'im, where's Marcus Trescoffick?"

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
I dress down; Tessa's frown makes me wither,
And so back to the wardrobe I slither.
I return, looking natty;
Her eyelids go batty,
And blinkingly beckon me thither.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Edwin Newman was clearly dismayed
At the grammar the Times had displayed:
"Two men were convinced
To join forces." He winced.
"The verb that you want is persuade!"

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Bravely swimming their way up the river,
Those salmon are all of a quiver.
Reproducing their kind,
They collect in a bind,
And their beauty is making me shiver.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Ariadne, a princess of Crete,
Helped Athenian Theseus cheat.
Once his razor-sharp knife
Took the Minotaur's life,
'Twas her thread marked the path for his feet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though good looks are a roll of the dice,
Adorability comes at a price.
All the fellows you meet
Tend to fall at your feet,
And to kick them—it just isn't nice.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The boys in the band took a hand
In producing an X-rated band
For their record, which was
Banned in Boston.  The fuzz
With the band on his arm got them canned.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A protein biologists use
That's extracted from jellyfish ooze?
Aequorin's its name,
And its one claim to fame
Is that calcium gives it the blues.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This journal's first class; it costs plenty,
But it's read by well-bred cognoscenti.
I've submitted two pieces;
My disquiet increases.
They'll publish me, Deo volente.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A cave-to-cave salesman named Quinn
Pitched a brand new invention: the "pin."
In 12,000 B.C.,
This guy walks up to me
And says, "Hi!  Is the cavewoman in?"

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Belousov-Zhabotinsky reactions
Are compellingly striking distractions.
The swirling BZ
Reaction's set free
In an unstable mixing of fractions.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
My film about Geordies out clubbing
Came in for a critical drubbing:
"It might have been best
If you'd thought to invest
In some subtitles, signing, or dubbing."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The sight of a whip or a cane
Scares my friend till he seems quite insane.
He takes care not to fall,
Or collide with a wall—
Algophobic, he's fearful of pain.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
The blue cohosh, like cohosh called "black",
Has medicinal use from way back.
Used in easing a birth,
It's an herb of great worth,
And not only prescribed by a quack.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
God, you know that I'm ready to swoon
As you strip by the light of the moon,
But I've got to get going.
Though passion is growing,
Your husband is coming home soon.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You'll be passing Thor's house about four;
You can drop off his order; what's more,
As he's sick with a cough,
And may snooze (that's drop off),
Use the drop-off that's next to his door.

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
Lonely Ted, who camped out in a shed
And had no one to share food or bed,
Hid from love and brave deeds.
Now his epitaph reads,
"Here lies Ted.  Never lived.  Now he's dead."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Capillary: a thin tube to go
Twixt the "high side" and that which is "low".
It maintains the essential
Required differential
In pressure, when gas needs to flow.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In a vibrating system, the spot
Of the maximum amplitude's not
At a node, but instead
At an antinode—said
(By the nodes) to be swinging and hot!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
That show with Lee Majors depicts
Crash survivor Steve Austin.  A fix
Of both legs, the left eye,
And right arm on this guy
Made him feel like a million—times six.

limerick_list.author: Peter Meyer
limerick_list.text:
Egyptian pound—hard to compare
It to currencies legal elsewhere.
Just go to a bank;
In a minute they'll crank
Out the value, so do not despair!

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
It's my golf ball; the lie is quite tight,
And a tree is obstructing my sight.
With this pine to evade,
What I'll hit is a fade —
A controlled shot that curves left to right.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You're accustomed to rice that is white
Or is brown, so it doesn't seem right
When it's black rice you're served,
But do not be unnerved—
It's not burned; it's delectable, quite!

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Yeah, I dive down for fish I can grab quick.
Hi, my name's Little Grebe!  Watch me ab flick
This powder puff butt
That we studly grebes strut.
Just don't call me that sissy name, dabchick.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Two blackamoors featured in plays
In which Shakespeare attempted to raise,
Through their color of skin,
The exotic within
And the dread that reminder conveys.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On my ranch, selling cheap big horn sheep,
Inventorying costs are too steep,
Since as soon as they're countin'
Those sheep (Rocky Mountain),
The help's in a heap, fast asleep.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
An obsolete spelling of grieve
And denoting a steward or reeve;
Those historians tell us
That plate-armoured fellas
Wore greeves on their shins, they believe.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
There was an old man, name of Bill,
Who said, "I'm not over the hill.
Though I am getting on
In years, young Yvonne
Finds my age-spots and wrinkles a thrill."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Some say astronavigation is fun.
First you start with a "sight" from the sun.
Next you do it again
With the moon, maybe.  Then
Plot the pair, find a match, and you're done.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When financially strained, short of dosh,
You may have to downgrade. Scrub and wash
What you have, but as well,
You may just have to sell
Some possessions, now life's not so posh.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Said the governess, "Ions, let's glide.
All the way to the cathode we'll slide."
Grumbled Anion, "No!
I'm repelled.  I won't go!"
"Such a negative charge," Nanny sighed.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The crone and her cronies were cackling:
"To decrepitate means 'to cause crackling.'
Throw in chemical salts
Plus some chicken fat (schmaltz).
It's a recipe well worth the tackling."

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Cheyenne names an Indian tribe,
A big town in Wyoming one scribe
Wrote a book about leaving,
And a series achieving
Success, thanks to Clint Walker's vibe.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren and Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Elizabeth Phelps, known as Bessie,
Was always dishevelled and messy,
But she's smart as can be
Since she went to Paree:
With a swan on her head, Bessie's dressy.

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
Teww xliwi hixempw sj Vywwme'w hijirgi
Xs xli qer amxl xli lex, xlvii hecw lirgi.
Give each letter a score,
And then take away four —
It'll make cryptographical sense.

limerick_list.author: Rose
limerick_list.text:
My teddy bear, whom I loved dearly,
Was named Astroid because he was clearly
The shape of a star.
And that's it, there you are,
He was star-shaped (I miss him sincerely).

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I'm a slumlord: I bleed dry the poor.
I'm a pimp, and I feed off my whore.
I oppress all my workers;
Make daughters wear burkhas.
Exploiter's my name — give me more!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Shrugs an eager young bowler named Mike
Who has more of a hook than he'd like:
"I get Brooklyns. Don't knock it.
I'll hit the wrong pocket,
But ten down still counts as a strike."

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Start with "All men are mortal" and then
Declare Socrates one of these men:
Alogically, thus,
The 9:30 bus
Is coming at quarter to 10.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Overacting is what he does best:
Chews the scenery, gestures with zest.
Though he thinks he can act,
This emoter, in fact,
Is exhausting to watch. I need rest.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I chided my childly old paw:
"I am tired of you calling me maw."
Me maw ain't no more,
But now paw ain't so sure—
His dementia's a bone in my craw.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
When the first killing frost fell last night,
My tomato vine shrunk from its might.
Now a black withered blastie,
Cells blasted and nasty,
The vine weeps its last at first light.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As a calf, I stood out in the crowd;
My mellifluous moos made me proud.
But the bossy cows cowed me —
They only allowed me
To low in the loo:  "You're too loud!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
They're ubiquitous holes that we fill
With our garbage, dejecta, and swill.
We're creating these cesspits
Without any respites.
Our sewage is making us ill.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
The carbon dioxide produced
By our household—how much have we loosed?
Just how big is our sootprint,
Our own carbon footprint,
And how should we get it reduced?

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Said the vicar, "That fish that they're landing
Is so good it deserves its own branding.
I suggest they might say,
In a biblical way,
'Piece of cod passeth all understanding'."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
See the T-shirts emblazoned with Che?
That's a name that appeals to this day
To the Marxist (Rebel!
Revolution! Fidel!),
Selling well for its leftist cachet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though you once were a dutiful lad,
Most respectful of Mother and Dad,
You've become quite a rebel,
And hard as a pebble—
Your contumacy's driving us mad!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
If Wichita Falls, like old Thera,
Exploded, and formed a caldera,
Then condos anew
With a lava-lake view
Would debut at the "Red Riviera".

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
You poor baby, ah diddums, my bad
For not knowing the reasons you're sad:
First the ticket for speeding,
Now that cat scratch — you're bleeding!
What a run of misfortune you've had.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
He was brave, he was haughty. No bolder man
Held court in the county, no colder man.
(See his lip — watch it curl.)
Though today we'd say "earl",
Anglo-Saxon folk called him an "ealdorman".

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Is it possible, living sans blame
And thus honoring Buddha's good name?
To be doing no harm, a
Clear, honorable dharma,
Is worthy, but maybe too tame?

limerick_list.author: Anonymity
limerick_list.text:
Ergosterol stubbornly dwells
In the membrane of all fungal cells.
It's in yeast. It's in mold.
It's the sterol, I'm told,
That an azole-based medicine quells.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
When they're knee-length, and pockets are flappin',
It is cargo shorts one sees a chap in—
Trunks he'll never outgrow,
And as fashion trends go,
…Well, I don't know how these things happen.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To assure, to affirm, to attest
That officially something is best
(Or is legal or true)
Is to certify—you
Guarantee it's been rightly assessed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
You're looking so sexy and svelte.
That's a beautiful skirt and a belt.
But that pullover's best
Since it shows off your chest.
Is it cashmere or might it be felt?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A brigand who buried some treasure
Thought to come dig it up at his leisure.
Now he sees, with a frown,
That the trees have blown down
Near the X he expected to measure.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The astrodynamicist knows
How a body in outer space slows
Under gravity's force.
It's mechanics, of course,
But applied to those heavenly shows.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
In the band room, the scene left us glum —
There some vandal had smashed every drum.
When the maestro, enraged,
Checked the damage he gauged,
"You will see repercussions to come!"

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When Caucasian Iberia's used,
Understandably, folks are confused.
Here's a hint, to be fair:
Ancient Georgians lived there.
And the Persians nearby? Not amused.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
While most cordovox music is loud,
I like it. It makes me feel proud
When I watch my friend play
(The accordian way)
To a waltzing or polka-ing crowd.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
From viewpoint to viewpoint you're ranging —
Embracing, then coldly estranging.
You can't make your mind up,
And that's why you wind up
Incessantly chopping and changing.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When our soccer team won, it was heaven.
We called them our "Golden Eleven."
Then four players were hurt
And they had to convert.
Water polo's their game, as they're seven.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
As my knighthood began to get stale,
I surveyed for a trade to avail.
So to pass as a farmer
I took off my armor;
To do that I had to dismail.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
To sense your own mind can be fun—
To be conscious of how it can run.
Apperception's the name
Of this interesting game,
Except when you look and find none.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Not long after photos began,
One "type" was a flash in the pan.
Daguerre had a winner,
And tin-types were thinner,
So ambrotype's glass "also-ran."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My chance of survival is low;
This IV is the key to my woe.
Its drip has just died
From an air lock inside.
Seems a bubble's preventing its flow.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
My awareness, the carillon's stealing
With chimes in a tune of great feeling.
The thunderous dongs
Play these wonderous songs.
O! The beautiful bells are appealing!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
There once was a girl from Chennai,
Who would simply ignore when and why
They renamed old Madras.
In her IIT class,
On traditions they strongly rely!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Fellows say that it's good to be he-brained,
Because guys have more smarts than the she-brained,
But the boys in my school
Don't succeed, as a rule,
As they're dull-brained—they're pea-brained; they're flea-brained!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Exceptionalism, voiced by us Yanks:
"We're the greatest!" We always give thanks
To our God we're the best
In the world; all the rest
Of the states march in far lower ranks.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Using dilogy when you converse
May confuse any listener; or worse,
That ambiguous speech
Likely puts out of reach
Any message you wish to disperse.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Since he gave me a job, Mr. Long
Gets a bit of my paycheck. 'Tain't wrong.
He's got double-strong locks
On that big Deduct Box,
Where my bits help the Kingfish stay strong.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Won't you please put an end to this crap!
This new page is superfluous pap.
It adds nil to the essence;
It's but an excrescence,
Like having three hands when you clap.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We build tropical dwellings from scratch,
So I've managed to buy up a batch
Of the grass called cogon
That was locally grown.
On my hut I will use it for thatch.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
In your billycan, boil your Lan-Choo,
And then chuck in a gumleaf or two.
Tap the can with a twig
(Tealeaf sinks), take a swig —
There's no taste like your bushie's brew, true.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Hegel taught dialectical thought.
Then materialism was brought
By Karl Marx. This solution
Sparked Red revolution:
Justice sought; theory wrought; class wars fought.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
You strike a harmonious tone
With the logical flow you condone
In your speech; every section
Supports your direction.
Concinnity — that's what you've shown.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Not a hookah," I said, "Take a look
At the pipe of my new Turkish cook.
Its long stem and clay bowl
Just took over my soul,
So I'll run out and buy a chibouk."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"That guy on the vise line's a clown.
On his foolin' around you should frown.
He takes safety risks — sizeable.
Chiding's advisable!"
"Brad, great ad-vise.  I'll clamp down."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I'm an adult child, well over thirty.
Though I like it at home, I get shirty
When Mum asks me, "Joe,
When the hell will you go?" —
"Oh, shut up! Do my washing! It's dirty!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Brick red is a russety brown
Rarely found in a graduate's gown;
But in Bristol and Leeds,
Educational needs
Can be met in the redbrick in town.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Sure she knows how to dress, but the catch is
Her whole wardrobe's presorted, in batches,
So it's easy to choose
What to wear; she can't lose.
They're coordinates: everything matches.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When a leaf edge displays crenulation,
I ponder its plan and causation:
Is it scalloped by chance,
Or designed in advance?
So ordained, or a mere aberration?

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Shortwave radio? What can you get, Rick?
Who broadcasts in old decametric?
There's just fuzz at 10 metres,
CB, then it peters.
100? Dead. Get a new set, Rick.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Much like meeting your doom at high noon:
A compulsory purchase deed, soon,
Will be pinned to the door
That was yours just before
They planned building this road to the moon.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
The salesman was not very bright.
He'd ignore every lefty in sight.
So they asked of him, "Why
Will you not let us buy?"
"Cuz the customer always is right."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The knave gave his date an anemone
Which helped him exert his hegemony,
Romantically speaking.
Soon bedsprings were creaking
In his out-of-the-way Agapemone.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm rooting for bioconversion
Of grain into beer.  The incursion
Of Einstein's equation
May help with persuasion;
Come join me, in total immersion!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cop a feel? I'd demand that you stop,
Or I'd pop you—a bop on your top—
But now that police
May be Jill or Denise,
I will ask if you might feel a cop.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He manned cannons while on a destroyer;
Now my nephew's a fine canon lawyer.
Once a seaman, now he
Sails a holier see,
As the Vatican's now his employer.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Presbyterian stiffs mustn't stay!
Anabaptists? Hey, cart 'em away!
These are Lutheran plots,
So we're calling the shots.
We have grave reservations. (Let's pray.)

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
You believe that our Bible's not true?
Then I think this is what you should do,
If you're brave enough, friend:
Read it through to the end —
It will frighten the Hell out of you.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Not a Japanese radish, no daikon,
Nor a waterside dike path to bike on,
Is a dykon.  No way!
She is famous and gay,
Just like Ellen, a lesbian icon.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It protects us from seizure or search
That's unlawful and thus would besmirch
Our good name and tranquility.
It offers stability:
Our rights are not left in the lurch.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
The backstays would not be longlasting
If they frayed in the gale to the blasting
Of frustrated tars,
So they're tied off the spars
To the backstay-plates aft of the masting.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's gone rotten; the log's all aglow.
Fox-fire fungi have this to bestow,
Spawning many a tale
Told to turn children pale:
Midnight lights in the forest—oh, no!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Dinornis: no wings to take flight
And too bulky to hide out of sight,
It was hunted galore.
Ain't around any more—
Went extinct, the poor moa bird's plight.

limerick_list.author: Graham Guest
limerick_list.text:
A hooker turned milliner spelt
Out her orders while running full pelt.
Dashing into her store,
She behaved like a whore,
Crying out that she'd come to get felt.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You're dressed up and you're facing a crisis,
One that might take your life. My advice is:
They do not have you yet;
Be aware of the threat
That the well-meaning throwing of rice is.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Said Selim, called "the Lush" (not "the Louche"),
"Where'sh the oil an' the lemon, you gooshe?
If you wan' me to eat a
Big hunk o' shtale pita,
Chunk it up wi' chopped veg as fattoush."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Alvin Toffler, who wrote Future Shock,
Called decisions arrived at ad hoc
(An arrangement that he
Christened adhocracy)
More efficient than punching the clock.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Of experts' opinions a shaper,
He wrote the first relevant paper;
Nusselt's great contribution:
An explicit solution
For the film condensation of vapor.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
When you see it's a duel you face,
Or a fresh chance to win in a race,
If the goal is compelling,
With logic that's telling,
The challenge you'll surely embrace.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
An opera singer named Queenie
Put on Turandot, sung in Chimwini;
"I do what I can to
Enlighten the Bantu,"
Said she, "And they quite like Puccini."

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
A problem in many a nation
Is control of extreme procreation.
I pray that some day
They may think of a way
To promote population deflation.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
She's chatty and cheerful and chirrupy,
Likes ponies and horses all stirrupy,
Thinks lambsies are lovely,
Is gentle and dovely
And sugary, sickly and syrupy.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
You can tell that I'm much like my brother:
We share the same father and mother.
I'm a girl, he's a guy.
Still, we're siblings; that's why
We're correlatively bound to each other.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
As a youngster, I loved to devote
All my time to the books authors wrote.
I was avid! And now
I spout adages. How?
Well, I plagiarize (steal what I quote)!

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
"A  Braunschweiger sandwich again!
My mother must hate me!" cried Ken.
"It's liverwurst, grayish,
Tastes bad, not okayish,
I'll be good, Lord, but stop her. Amen!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
That albatross, bird that you hate —
Is it mollymawk, sooty or great?
Or perhaps (be specific)
A fine North Pacific?
All Diomedeidae, mate.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In Juneau, a seagoing man
Goes out whaling, in spite of the ban.
"We Alaskans don't care
To preserve whale or bear,
As for us it's just catch as Ketchikan."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When we knights tilt for pleasure with lances,
Then my cronel enhances the chances
That you'll live to fight more:
Spread-out points spare your gore,
As they fail to impale in advances.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He is Irish and calls me his boy-o.
It's a word he will often employ-o.
I think it means "lad,"
And that makes me feel bad—
As I'm female, it brings me no joy-o.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For flavicomous gals there's such hype,
So for dating them always I'm ripe.
Your hair's gray, brown, or black?
I'll respond, "Please step back!"
And for redheads? "You're just not my type!"

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
This award, since it's given to me,
Makes me happy and proud as can be.
My competitor's green
With an envious mien:
He'd have loved to be the awardee.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Private Budd trudged the war-torn back road
With his pack on his back: a full load.
Then Budd shouted, "I've found
A dud round on the ground.
Is it true misfired shells can't expl—"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Found a list of kings' tombs in this jar.
It's in code, so we can't go too far
Till we break down the text.
So that's what we'll do next —
Cryptographically learn where they are.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Here there's labor abuse, exploitation.
For that, there's a sad explanation:
Protections are poor.
Fact'ry owners ignore
The few laws; there's no true regulation.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You call me a duck squeezer.  What
You require is a kick in the butt.
DDT, CFCs,
Plastic bags: all of these
We should ban or we'll die.  Who's the nut?

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
You met a compatible mate,
Paired off, and then left it to fate.
You may have to propose
If a cytula grows
And becomes a new baby. (She's late.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your new boarder? From neighbors I've heard
He's a weenie, an anoraky nerd.
Like all boffins and dorks
Come to London from Yorks,
He'll have trouble attracting a bird.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Pastor Michael's revivals can raise
Any roof. The "amens" ring for days.
Pastor Jay? People say,
"Well, I guess he's okay."
His sermons are damned with faint praise.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend Ben, a perennial wencher,
Took a gal for a camping adventure
That he'll never forget.
She said, "Pet, you're all wet.
We'd no tent in that rainstorm—a drencher!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Jimmy Gilmer sang lead with his pack
Called The Fireballs.  The song "Sugar Shack"
Topped the charts.  The top ten
Didn't happen again
Till, with "Bottle of Wine," they came back.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
"What's a clitoris, Dad?" — "Ask your mum."
"What's a clitoris, Mum?" — "Er, Dad come
And explain to him, please."
"Oh, the birds and the bees? —
The birds chirp, but the bees buzz and hum."

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
Atmospherically challenged am I,
For up in the air I won't fly.
But what's even sadder,
I don't trust a ladder.
One rung, and I scream, "It's too high!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Mother Goose, amid all those sad ganders
Proved her mettle while raising their danders.
"No more private insurance!"
Warren showed her endurance,
Moving left of the socialist Sanders.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
I'm enthralling them all with my homilies
On the subject of genus Chaenomeles.
Strangely called flowering quince,
It is not — odder since
Flowering quinces evinces anomalies.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck and limarico
limerick_list.text:
'Neath my bed, dirty socks have grown fragrant.
No socks? At an interview? Flagrant!
Got cold feet, still in bed;
It's this job search I dread.
Enter Mom. Here we go: "You're a vagrant."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Here, resting in peace, lies my buffer.
As dogs go, a bit of a duffer.
He'd greet us, our pooch,
With a big, sloppy smooch.
In a fight, though, no mutt could be tougher.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Disagreement: our lack of accord
Means you fight us; you're never on board
With majority rule.
Though you may think it cruel,
We'll expel you till order's restored.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Gonna ding (i.e. dump) you, you nong;
Throw you out. (Doing dope was dead wrong.)
You are worthless; hence dingable.
(That means you're flingable.)
Time to eject you.  (So long.)

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
Abimelech's three kings or four.
(It's hard to be sure. Maybe more.)
One more Biblical name
Of no noteworthy fame.
And rhyming them all? Quite a chore!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
This base that we chaps call a drome,
With its runways and cross-sectioned dome,
Is the place where we store
Sopwith Camels before
Every dogfight: our aeroplanes' home.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Let's go down to the playhouse where they
Are rehearsing a chronicle play.
Guess its subject's no mystery—
It's straight English history,
As writ in Elizabeth's day.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
• If your brief's organized they can cull it;
• If your idea's concise they can mull it.
• Should a list that is numbered
Seem grossly encumbered,
Then highlight each bit with a bullet.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
See the cows as they chomp and they bite,
And they chud on their cud on the height?
Standing there on the hill,
They will give you a thrill—
They're a farmer's most favorite sight!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Denmark Strait brought an end to the Hood.
Winston Churchill made plans understood.
"Sink the Bismarck!" he cried.
Royal Navy complied;
Soon that battleship sank—gone for good.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Browsing old stuff is how I unwind;
The right trash hides some long-pursued find.
And antiquing is heaven
The length of Route 7.
I collect what the past's left behind.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
I can look things up, sitting in chairs;
On the train; at the foot of the stairs.
I don't need multimedia,
Just a good cyclopædia!
(There's no en, by the way, when it's Pears'.)

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
If his conduct stays mostly inerrant,
To the throne he'll remain heir apparent.
But if out he soon bails,
Then Charles, Prince of Wales,
Will not become Britain's next gerent.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Blue azure stone (lapis) is duly
Sought after by some like yours truly.
Yet it's snubbed and disdained
As "that rock cheaply stained—
How gaudy!" They're judging it cruelly.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Loki boasted, "You giants, don't scoff —
I'll out-gorge your top glutton, right off."
He gawped up all his meat,
But confessed he was beat:
Logi scarfed meat and bones and the trough.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
This morning's commute got me psyched,
Through the trails and the traffic I biked.
Got a flat — don't know where —
Had no pump, and no spare,
So the rest of the way I just hiked.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
When the musical guest babuina
Came on stage with her gold concertina,
The patrons all yelled;
Next, their breaths they all held
As she fought a ferocious hyena.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Amino acids, we're told, are essential
If a creature is not providential
In making its own.
If it eats them, it's prone
To a future with higher potential.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Anatomicomedical lasses
Take comedic anatomy classes.
Cut-up shtick for the brain
In a humerus vein
Requires pratfalls on gluteal masses.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
"I really do think you should join, Ted,"
Said Fred. "In our sect, we're anointed
With Burgundy wine
Every evening at nine.
Don't be late, since that hour is appointed."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Curse of knowledge"? Is that what I've got?
True, of limericks I know quite a lot,
So when somebody claims
That they think Henry James
Wrote the best, then agree I cannot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I'm home from my job I repair
To my beautiful butterfly chair,
Where I rest in its sling,
And I don't do a thing.
Call me lazy? A slug? I don't care!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Your kid bro makes me nervous.  He keeps
Me on edge; from him sliminess seeps.
When he thinks I'm asleep,
I see little Beau peep;
From your brother I've gotten the creeps.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
A pastry base — that's the first part
When preparing a fine Bakewell tart.
Then you need almond cake,
Add some jam, and you'll bake
Your way to an Englishman's heart.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Apocrustic? I'm that, but artistic,
And not even slightly sadistic.
Astringent and tannic …
Repellent — Germanic?
Not that one! (I say, optimistic.)

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Often craftspeople learn skills in schools,
Such as fashioning jewelry from jewels.
Or the masters they serve
Let them grow and observe.
We should credit the brains, not the tools.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The designer's collection's his best.
Now each model will strut with the rest.
Down the catwalk, the shoes
Entertain and amuse
In what's seen as a high-fashion fest.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In Spain, after eating your fill,
If you leave without paying your bill,
The host may object,
And your path intersect
With a constable called alguazil.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Farmer Goodman was proud of his cattle.
He owned fields full of cows near Seattle.
But his herds all went south
When they caught foot-and-mouth;
He was fighting a sad, losing battle.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
There are decticous pupae: they chew
With their newly formed mandibles (two).
But the adecticous kind
Are not that way designed:
Can such pupae then chew? No can do.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I spent lots on a secondhand copier;
Now its copies are coming out sloppier.
Seems its previous owner
Used much too much toner,
So its splotches get wetter and gloppier.

limerick_list.author: Morimando
limerick_list.text:
In the eye — the beholder's — is she:
Azure sky, golden sunshine, green tea.
She's in all things that crowd
Land and sea, mute or loud,
And in birds in the air, soaring free.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
As a cotton box floats down the river
With her hundreds of bales to deliver,
Gliding smooth over bars
And watched over by stars,
She'll need all of the wide berth we give her.

limerick_list.author: Nathan Howe
limerick_list.text:
So your neighbors all call you a loon?
I agree, Granny.  Here, eat this prune.
See, you're raving insane (ya
Might have acromania).
Quit stabbing me, please, with your spoon.

limerick_list.author: Pete G.
limerick_list.text:
Up above, where the stars are all clustered,
Shining forth in the dark, brightly lustred,
They are sprinkled like dust
On a black velvet crust,
Or white pepper adorning black custard.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
There he stands in the headlights, confused,
Kinda baffled and sorely abused.
He sure looks like he'll drown;
Seems he's headed straight down.
Poor puppy, life's left him so bruised.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
May a redolence, chiefly of claries,
For clear eyesight and temper that varies
But little with age,
Lend its scent—nutty, sage—
To the woman my only son marries.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When I'm scared, in a state of alarm,
Or perturbed, when I need to stay calm,
I take Ativan pills.
Though they manage such ills,
They're addictive; they could do me harm.

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
My image of lofty urbaneness
Might morph into one of profaneness
Were I not to decline,
As I do, to define
The hole in one's butt called the anus.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"That's a foot fault; your toe touched the line,"
Barked the line judge (the finicky swine).
Damn the tournament rules,
Made by fussy old fools.
Please inform them this backcourt is mine.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Ms. Streisand appears on the bill
At the Met in an opera—a thrill!
She is driven each night
To the show in a white
Caddy limo called "Barbra's Seville."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Smokey angrily cried, "No one cares!
Feckless usage of lighters and flares
Places woodlands in danger.
As the forest's top ranger,
I will fight for the right to arm bears!"

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
Brand of many a household appliance,
And commune of great self-reliance
That was founded by Germans
With positive sermons:
Amana—both social and science.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bacterioscopy: one of the terms
For the study of microbes and germs.
Through the lenses I peer;
I prefer this career
To a job giving haircuts and perms.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I don't accept Mazda or Zeus,
Or any god, that's no excuse
(Yes, my creed's atheistic,
And I shun all that's mystic)
For subjecting my views to abuse.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
As an adjective, ginchy is "cool";
Not describing some "fashionable" fool.
It's "highly attractive"
(And "sexually active"?),
A treasure, an "excellent" jewel.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
I was dating a lively gal, 'Val'.
I had hoped that she'd boost my morale.
After one gal. of juice, though,
She played fast and loose, though.
No pal, just a real good time gal.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
If your shoulder pain's set to derange,
Or your backache needs serious change,
Then see Doctor Pins,
Whose cupping begins
With a flame in a jar—oh, how strange!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Frost with buttercream—that's what it takes
To enhance those pedestrian cakes.
Sugar, butter, and cream
Are the cakemaker's scheme
To add glitz to the layers he bakes.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
There's a bill I must pay right away.
I'll extinguish the thing in one day.
Liabilities due
Not in three years or two,
Are called current, the CPAs say.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Delacrymation, my problem, appears
As involuntary shedding of tears.
But the juries relent
When they see me "repent" —
I wish you such a problem, my dears.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
All Christians adhere to beseechings
In New Testament sermons and teachings.
Apostolic's the name
That describes these; the same
For the Catholics describes Papal preachings.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
In bridge-building don't you go wrong.
Build foundations; the river is strong.
In this room you will spot 'em:
The men dig the bottom;
The caissons go roiling along.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
"Eat yer chips or I'll lam ye," he said.
"But our Daddy, I'd raither eat bread."
"Ye're no gettin' a bap
Wi' yer haddi. A slap
Is what ye'll be gettin' instead."

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
A blue crab shell's chitin's quite tough,
Except for the days when they slough
It off as they molt.
That's when Marylanders bolt
Soft shell crabs 'til they've eaten enough.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Tempting Eve, I admit, was a crime,
But I've learned, belly down in the grime,
Something truly infernal:
Damnation's eternal,
Which proves to be quite a long time.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Since my garden is sunny and spacious,
I'm looking for trees that are gracious;
But as orange won't rhyme,
Tell the landscaper I'm
Seeking trees that must be aurantiaceous.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A tough dictator: that's what we need
(Not freedom!) to thrive and succeed.
A despotist, I;
For repression I'd die,
For a Stalin I'll fight and I'll bleed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Gaily garmented, garbed for a dance,
Some occasion, an evening's romance,
Light skirt molding her thighs,
She draws every man's eyes
As she passes. What guy stands a chance?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Now I'm lonely and old, and I've found
I am cheered by the carousel's sound,
As the tunes that it plays
Bring me back to the days
When I rode it, around and around.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
I need surgery soon on my bladder.
Its condition could hardly be sadder,
And the cause of my groans?
I have ten bladder stones
(If my doctor's an accurate adder).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In centesis, the needle they use
For the stomach's so long, some refuse
To be stuck in the gut.
An abdominal cut
And a snooze is the option they choose.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
With client-centered therapy, you
Tell your shrink what you think is askew.
He will mirror, not lead,
And each treatment's agreed —
Or at least so he'll plead, if you sue.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Now grown old, at the end of my days,
The error I see of my ways,
So I'll cease being greedy
And cede to the needy
My wealth. (Yes, indeedy, crime pays!)

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
It's been known to make grandmothers faint,
Since it carries a bit of a taint.
It's a four-letter term,
Though that's not why they squirm,
For the strictest of grammar it ain't.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
While the Visigoths catapult boulders,
We rely on advice from our olders:
Metal helmets (not lead)
Keep our heads in good stead;
Epaulieres are protecting our shoulders.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
My T-shirts and blue jeans get thrown
In the dryer, where hot air is blown.
But my sweaters are laid out
With sleeves fluffed and splayed out
To air-dry at room temp alone.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
As my spaceship's got FTL drive
(That is faster than light), I contrive
To travel great distances—
Time inconsistencies
Complicate when I arrive.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The male grosbeak that preens on our fence
Takes his name from a color, intense.
From his tail to his head,
He wears cardinal red—
Hear him cry, "Let the mating commence!"

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
My disquietude, Sir, is immense.
It's no wonder I'm fretful and tense.
May you take me to bed?
What's got into you're head?
I would sooner drop dead! (No offence.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"His snide insults delight me!" says Tonya.
"Maybe so, but I hate that shirt on ya.
Garfield this, Garfield that—
He's a fat, stupid cat
Who cracks jokes and (big deal!) loves lasagna."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At the fresh Balfour cheese I would gawk.
'Bout its sweet nutty flavor, I'd talk.
It's both crumbly and hard,
Held in highest regard
In N.Z. Disagree? Take a walk!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ineffectual? Weak? Yeah, that's Chip.
Eating out, he refuses to tip.
Leaky faucets agree
He's as dull as can be.
Hear them label this guy: "Drip! Drip! Drip!"

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
Two young cousins were felling some trees.
One, alarmed by the stiffening breeze,
Hollered, "RUN! snags could break!"
So they'd one choice to make—
And departed with relative ease.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Since I cut the dog's tongue, Mrs. Young,
Your poor Fido's been acting high-strung."
"Not the tongue of my hound —
I meant weed in the ground!
That's the worst-ever snip of the tongue!"

limerick_list.author: David Bourke
limerick_list.text:
Would an Austrian pine for the schilling
If in Euros to trade he's unwilling?
You what? It's a tree?
Oh well. Pardon me!
(My meaning I found more fulfilling!)

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In a silvery-tinctured facade
On a shield or a piece for your cod,
I'd bet argent's at play;
Even more so, I'd say,
With a moth-eaten Zombie named Rod.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
All the trees in the park show some rot,
And there's nothing but weeds I can spot.
Piles of trash, broken glass;
No more flowers and grass.
What was beautiful's now gone to pot.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
A posterior problem horrific
Developed on flights transpacific:
Due to poor circulation
My butt lost sensation
And suffered from bedsores prolific.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
It's your gallstones; of that I've no doubt.
This procedure is one that I tout:
Cholelithotomy, which
Uses barely a stitch,
And leaves hardly a scar. See, they're out!

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
When you're dead and you've left the last mall,
And your coffin is under its pall,
You're all in, all washed up,
All bets off, drained the cup:
That's the terminal meaning of all.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The encirclement, nearly complete,
Was a portent of looming defeat;
Surrounded by Sioux
All around them, they knew
They'd been doomed by a traitor's deceit.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
"Leaving Cleveland?"  The fans cried, "Absurd!"
When St. Louis was robbed, not a word.
Browns had nary a wing,
Didn't squawk, couldn't sing,
But each Brown's now a Baltimore bird.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
What's been making the head chef so cross?
His assistant's advanced hearing loss.
He just ruined the veal
Adding Bessemer steel
When it should have been Béchamel sauce.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My sweet babe's California striped racer
Is a scream when it's trying to chase her.
Snakey thinks she's a rat
He could swallow like that!
If he did, then I'd have to replace her.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Cheery fireflies twinkle at night,
Glowing on and then off, not too bright.
Call 'em lightning bugs, do —
Maybe "lighting bugs", too;
In my jar are a slew, flashing light!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a portly reporter named Mort,
Gone to court to report on a tort,
Heard the bailiff shout, "Order!"
He'd order a porter,
A stout, or a snort of some Port.

limerick_list.author: Miss Mimi
limerick_list.text:
After-hours clubs, one may observe,
Sell you drinks when it's past time to serve.
I won't go—I'm afraid
I'll get caught in a raid.
And they're so overpriced—what a nerve!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Leif the Viking, in pain and in grief,
Made complaint to old Magnus, his chief;
"I'm just back from the war
And I find the clerk, Thor,
Off his census has just taken Leif."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In tufts and in clumps and in bunches,
These grasses are animals' lunches.
A perennial plant
Like the bunchgrass just can't
Wait for snowfall, when nobody munches.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I received some sad news just today.
Andrew Sachs, I was told, passed away.
As the waiter Manuel,
He made fans laugh like hell
With just one word of dialog: "¿Que?"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Epitomizer: one who abstracts
The essence of volumes or tracts.
Though authors may pout
