At their good stuff left out,
It's just "No sir, no nuance. Just facts."

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Hugh's appraised the huge house so admiringly,
And assessed their fine art most desiringly.
Now he calls fellow thieves
And insures he achieves
One more link in a life lived conspiringly.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Favrile glass is indeed iridescent.
Very often it's truly rubescent.
It's a glass which is stained
With the colours ingrained.
It also can be opalescent.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
You're the stupidest gambler I've met,
So I bet I could get you to bet.
You respond with a rant,
"Well, I betcha you can't!"—
As a wager, your silliest yet.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The shoreline is craggy and steep,
And the waters below dark and deep.
A Cliffie, forlorn,
Has a heart that's been torn,
Keeps her vow, takes a step ... and a leap.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
A man from Milwaukee named Ted
Sought a bubbler in Dallas, then said,
"It was just what you'd think.
I could not find a drink
'Til I asked for a fountain instead."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Four men in subservient roles
Bear a prince in a litter on poles.
In this Indian dandi
You'd never find Gandhi,
The humblest and gentlest of souls.

limerick_list.author: hugh.adler
limerick_list.text:
A musician, he's par excellence, gents,
Rated superbe throughout la belle France, hence
Brassmen everywhere play
All his tunes to this day—
No omissions, no shortcuts, no nonsense.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Way back when, women washed (in a stream)
Pigs' intestines, or chitterlings. Steam
Up some bowels today
For a chitlin soufflé
And I'd say that's cuisine too extreme.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Jerry Seinfeld's apartment was not
In New York on that real West Side spot.
A large place in LA,
Its outside on display,
'S where they filmed each exterior shot.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Cut a cone with a plane. All agree
Where the two intersect one can see
Different curves are defined.
These in maths are assigned
The term conics. Let's look at all three.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I trash reputations for fun,
Leaving victims upset and undone.
Since I suffer from fell
Halitosis, as well,
I can bad-mouth in more ways than one.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
The batsman was going great guns,
But he'd over-indulged on iced buns.
Ninety-nine and not out —
The worst time for a bout;
He was 'bowelled' with the wrong sort of runs.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
As kids we looked forward to autumn;
Falling leaves brushed our sleeves as we caught 'em
To rake in a pile
And jump in for a while,
Giving thanks for this season that brought 'em.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Many times, when I ear-tag a cow,
 She will low, as if asking, "What now?"
"It's ID," I reply,
 "Because heifers seem shy
 About branding irons' sizzle — and how!"

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
Wrongly sentenced to death by beheading,
Execution at dawn's what I'm dreading.
At least when they chop
Off my head it will stop
All the tears of regret I've been shedding.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Add to ambreic acid a base,
And an ambreate's left in its place.
That's a salt—in a niche
Next to ambrein, which
Is a fragrance perfumers embrace.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Near volcanoes, this fine old ciudad,
Where the Aztecs once worshiped their god,
Is both awesome and pretty:
It's Mexico City,
With a modern yet ancient facade.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
With white stamens and petals, these flowers
Glisten brightly and shine after showers.
I gaze in a trance
At my snow-blossomed plants.
"Albiflorous!" I murmur for hours.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Move the cattle gate, let them proceed.
Once they've dunged, they're not likely to feed
Where they've dropped their manure;
They've no need to endure
Such conditions. Fresh pastures they need.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Enqueue your requests and then wait.
Each in turn will be dealt with. I hate
To see work piling higher.
Let's call a ceasefire—
At least till we clear off our plate.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In the 1700s in France,
Some Catholics sought to enhance
The power of the State
In the church, and equate
It with that of the Pope—a strong stance!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
It's unseemly for you, head physician,
To disparage our patient nutrition
Arrangements that way.
And allow me to say,
Doctor, furthermore (yes, in addition)…

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
They're so pleased with their new baby boy
That they call him their bundle of joy.
But, to cut him some slack,
They will christen him Jack.
(The name Bundle, in time, might just cloy.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A mad Russian was once heard to pop off:
"Your head I desire to chop off!
You're our leader, it's true,
But your death's overdue.
Find a cliff, Comrade Yuri, Andropov!"

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
As a carpenter, Alice was dippy,
Making shelves that were slapdash and slippy.
Now her cupboards have crashed,
Leaving crockery smashed.
She's a hopelessly ham-fisted chippy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We'd consider it quite imbecilic
If your alcohol drink was amylic.
Amyl alcohol's poison
That'd kill all you boys 'n'
To love you would be  necrophilic.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Apart from my talent for rhyme,
I know how to wag double-time.
But what I love best,
Besides anapest,
Is rolling around in the grime.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You may elevate workers with praise,
With a compliment—just the right phrase,
And their mood you'll improve,
But much more with a move
That will grant a promotion and raise.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
And S. Mason (ostensively K)
Sobs, "Aw, pants, Alnoy. K's sordid. Say
Alalaya's Di Drossky,
On last nap, was bosky...
Levis net Son o' Sam's DNA!"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
I am going! Don't push. Beating feet!
Get your hands off my neck and my seat!
I'll soon fade out of sight
And just blend into night—
That's me, vanishing there, down your street.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
She's the bravest of birds, Cher Ami.
Gravely wounded, this trusting trustee
Of a life-and-death note
Conveyed words that we wrote:
"Please stop shelling us doughboys. Can't flee."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
It's a knob or protuberance left
By the pipe of a glass-blower deft.
Since hand-blown, you would know it;
The bull's-eye would show it.
For nice pieces, guard against theft.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Laboratory, House, and Assignment:
The Dalton Plan's subtle refinement.
Fit the course to the student!
These schoolteachers, prudent,
Would certainly know what condign meant.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Though Joe's hidden his crimes very well,
There are secrets his girlfriend might sell
To the press. They'll come out
In the wash; and, no doubt,
Both the cops and his wife will raise hell.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Said Dad, "I'm just picking your brain.
What's the Paris-to-Venice fast train?"
I said, "Dad, I would guess
It's the Orient Express.
Now from brain-picking kindly abstain!"

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I will not be demeaned and abused—
My hurt feelings are battered and bruised,
But I still keep my pride
'Cause I won't be denied.
Being dissed, I feel far from amused.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the knives on their own are a steal,
I'm including a carload of veal.
Plus I'll throw in a watch
And a bottle of scotch,
For just twenty-two bucks? What a deal!

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
You once were the looked-down-upon-est
Of crooks, into sleaze the far-gone-est.
All that's past, billionaire.
Buy a peerage from Blair.
You've got on.  Now get honour — then honest.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Their taste is more tangy than sweet,
So these apples aren't ready to eat.
They're for cooking, of course —
Chop 'em up for a sauce
Or a fruit-laden crumbly treat.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
If your ode needs to say understand,
But two syllables need to be canned,
I suggest you use get:
The best synonym yet.
(Hope you get that; I taught you first-hand.)

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
At the plant sale, I chatted up Hope:
"When pronouncing this flower, I grope —
Is it 'doll-ya' or 'dally-a'?
Enlighten me, shall ya?"
Said she, "That's a daisy, you dope."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
The cosmogonist scoffs, "Your defiance
Of the data observed is reliance
On biblical tracts —
Just study the facts;
You'll get a big bang out of science."

limerick_list.author: Jim Macaulay
limerick_list.text:
Avid birders will watch whippoorwills —
Even robins and terns give them thrills.
Their hot breath they must bate
While observing birds mate.
These are people enjoying cheep trills.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Some Beefeaters, guards at the Tower
Of London,  are feeling quite sour:
A bird in their ranks?
Her appointment there's  thanks
To her years in the army. Girl power!

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Gorgonzola and Roquefort are two,
And some Stilton or Maytag might do,
But for my taste buds, please
Make my blue-veined white cheese
The light Danish delight, Danablu.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"You misunderstood."  "I did?"  "Yup.
Golf's no contact game.  Drive your shots up
And repeat till you land
On the green.  Understand
That it's those balls that go in a cup."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A person who's speaking digressively
Will deviate somewhat excessively
From the subject or thread
Being written or said,
A habit that some have impressively.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
While a beast epic tends to be long,
And in verse (like a poem or song),
It's at base allegorical.
Each creature's an oracle,
Showing what's right and what's wrong

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
Richard English
limerick_list.text:
When you speak of a steam-engine's chuff,
That's its sound — it's a kind of loud puff.
As it goes through a tunnel,
That sound from its funnel
Is music to every steam buff!

limerick_list.author: bill ricker
limerick_list.text:
Just as horse thieves are many — galdang 'em! —
So too are the ways to defang 'em.
An adjudicative fight
In the East works alright.
The Old West?  No such test — we just hang 'em.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
For my sandwich, I fixed a new spread.
"Dry mustard," the recipe read.
That stuff's hellishly hot!
Now I'm dripping with snot,
And it's running all over the bread.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Neath his armor, Sir Bernie'd not fail
To be wearing a shirt made of mail,
That was known as a byrnie,
When he went on a journey
In a dangerous quest to prevail.

limerick_list.author: Mr. Parx
limerick_list.text:
Her cocktail, it seemed, was absinthiated,
Her syllables undifferentiated.
She lost mental clarity
And debated a parrot. He
Questioned her verity...and then she ate it.

limerick_list.author: Jayson Lockwood
limerick_list.text:
If your calling is more than okay,
Perhaps you should join ACA.
If it strikes you as odd
To shout "Y'all, promenade!"
Maybe y'all shouldn't call, just obey.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
That agitprop tries to elicit
Support for a cause.  You can't miss it.
Movies, books, plays, and art
Are all doing their part.
I don't think they could be more explicit.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The asp was evicted for pissin'
All over his place.  He said, "Listen,
I'm just a poor snake
Who cannot catch a break—
Not even a small pit to hiss in."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Some plastics, through chemical arts,
Depolymerize back into parts
Christened monomers, which,
Once again, one could stitch
Into new plastics. That's using smarts!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Center stage: "Bill, I love you," Anne sighs.
In the background, Fred's crossing his eyes.
As he scratches his crotch,
It is him people watch.
This rude conduct is called catching flies.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The angel-fish, if you look sharp,
Appears more like a shark than a carp.
Though as fiddle-fish known,
It can't play a chaconne,
Or a hymn on a heavenly harp.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With our EEG running, we stroked
The anesthetized cat, then we poked,
While the probes in its brain
Measured, time and again,
The electric potential evoked.

limerick_list.author: DavidGries
limerick_list.text:
Billy chewed on a dirty old boot.
Bessie said, "You're a crazy galoot!"
Bill said, "That I refute,
But I don't give a hoot,
Because I'm not a man, I'm a goot."

limerick_list.author: Kirk Zurell
limerick_list.text:
A banker's acceptance, a debt,
Is a guaranteed profit, you bet.
If the debtor defaults,
Then the bank and its vaults
Make it good (so let George Bailey fret!).

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I am under that Eagles song's spell:
Damn soft rock California hell.
If I had a CB,
Could I get myself free
Spelling "HELP" (which I'd start with "Hotel")?

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
An afflux of blood makes you flush
As it moves to one place in a rush.
If you tingle or burn,
It's no cause for concern.
(My favorite example?  The blush.)

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Both their résumés say they are hot,
But we really don't know what they've got.
When we're judging their minds,
There are only 10 kinds:
They know binary, or they do not.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
With three meanings, completely discrete.
Blunk perhaps is an old linen sheet,
Or a steed or a horse,
Or to turn from your course —
Though all meanings are now obsolete.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
At each end of a windshield you'll find
(Or a windscreen, if you're so inclined)
The A-pillar.  Most
Of its function's a post
Used for keeping the roof out of mind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The design team of Charles and Ray Eames
Thought up wonderful chairs in their dreams.
Each conception was swell
(One was shaped like a shell),
And they're still selling well—so it seems.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Wicked wind's whipping in off the shore,
As a devil dancer's rattling the door.
Mini-whirlwinds are eerie.
But the fireside is cheery.
Let's cuddle up warm, mi amor.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With my grandsons, I'll often invite 'em
To pick out some toys to delight 'em,
But my Andrew has got
His heart set on a yacht!
Sorry, kid.  That's a big-ticket item.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
She likes skyscrapers, malls, and fast cars.
Raised with street lights, she's seldom seen stars.
She likes streets that are paved,
Tinted hair that is waved.
She's a city girl, hanging 'round bars.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The coquilla nut isn't a fool—
Fools aren't turned on a lathe. How uncool!
It's a palm tree nut, brown
(If you bite it, you'll  frown),
Ornamentally carved, as a rule.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The judge turns you down, and it feels
Like you've gotten the rawest of deals.
If what sticks in your craw
Is an error of law,
Take your case to the court of appeals.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Growing up in the streets was a pain,
Though it taught me a lot in the main.
I've accrued education
With no formal foundation,
But I say that my school was two lane.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Let's beat swords into plowshares.  No more
Will our nations be training for war."
Now we've unforeseen woes,
'Cause we're plowing for those
Who signed peace pacts they chose to ignore.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ramón says Loretta is dishy,
Although he is decidedly swishy.
He's taking to dinner
That lottery winner.
Gal, look out—I'd say something is fishy!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cotyla's shaped like a cup.
It's an organ or cavity. Yup,
There's a lot to be found
On the words that abound
In your Webster's—try looking 'em up.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Both were skilled and refined — their delights
Ran to intellect, art and hot nights.
But a concubine's life
Was subordinate wife,
While a courtesan's lacked legal rights.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
While debating, Kate spoke very graciously,
But stuck to her thesis tenaciously.
It didn't take long
Till we found she was wrong;
She'd expounded her sources fallaciously.

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
A young girl who lived near the equator
Took a swim with her pet alligator.
Some say she was drowned—
'Cause she never was found—
But I'm betting her gator just ate 'er.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When an auxochrome comes with a gift
As a bathochrome, color can shift
From the ghostly UV
To a hue you can see.
Why is mauve always given short shrift?

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Spock to Kirk: Our unbeatable foe
Left the Enterprise no way to go.
So I'm forced to deduct,
We must auto-destruct.
You won't like that; it's logical though.

limerick_list.author: limarico and Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Depressed?" said my shrink. "Feeling blue?"
(Well, duh! Aren't I talking to you?)
"Certain books can be healing —
They'll improve how you're feeling."
(What I feel is you ain't got a clue!)

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
If I were a young single lad,
Out to furnish a bachelor pad,
I'd get cable TV,
A big couch just for me,
And a bed where I'd act like a cad.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Black-eyed Susan? A flower, of course:
A bouquet of them might show remorse.
But your rue must be true,
Or you know what she'll do:
Black-eyed Susan will file for divorce.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
I know the right time in my mind,
But my body's an hour behind.
Although daylight we're saving,
Some slumber I'm craving;
To nap on my chaise I'm inclined.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
As his wife can attest, for she's seen,
In the morning, he's cloddish and mean.
He can't open his eyes
And he's surly to rise
Till he's had his first dose of caffeine.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
skipjordan and Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Read this compend I bought in the store."
"No, a shortcut I really abhor.
I possess in my home
The original tome.
I find digests are terse and a bore."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey and zqms
limerick_list.text:
I'm cisgendered — my body and soul
Have since birth been a feminine whole.
A cissexist would feel
That I'm therefore more "real"
Than a transgender gal. (What a troll!)

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
An old lady starts picking her nose.
A nude fat guy tries touching his toes.
Gotta watch 'em?  And how!
No, deturn your head now.
Watch the floor — watch the sky — don't watch those.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Herb's the unsung young hero among us
Whose crotch itch cure extirpates fungus.
His stern ultimatum?
"Kill eczema marginatum
With tincture of stinky mundungus!"

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
The rich and the mighty, my dear,
And the beauteous, never must fear
Being wrongly neglected.
They're strongly protected:
Celebrity makes it all clear!

limerick_list.author: Harper
limerick_list.text:
Said the doctor, "You don't have the flu,
Although you have aches through and through.
Sad to say, John Calhoun,
You are autoimmune.
The source of your trouble is you!"

limerick_list.author: Brigham Fordham
limerick_list.text:
There's no pardon for screwing up less
Than the others who helped make a mess.
You fulfill cause in fact
If without your bad act
There'd be nothing in need of redress.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
See a goal as a target to set,
Like the rise you've put hours in to get,
Or the kick, flagging your
Prime intention to score,
That then slammed the ball into the net.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
A cornigerous feature of steers,
Placed in pairs on their heads near the ears,
Are horns of a sort
(Perhaps long, maybe short)
Which may figure in some Texas cheers.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Fancy instruments aid in detection
Of air as it moves in advection.
Anemometers know
Just how fast it'll blow.
(Moistened fingers can help with direction.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Bozo's bygone as Farmer Grey's mule.
I'd decitizenize him; he's not cool.
Disenfranchise the dunce,
Then deport him at once.
Make him instantly nobody's fool.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
I needed to find something's mass
For a project in chemistry class,
But someone just took
My new scale—what a crook!
So now I've lost my balance, alas!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Che Guevara was always a thorn
To governments held in his scorn.
From La Paz to BA
They all chased him away,
But in Cuba, Che said "I'm reborn!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Wearing aprons while cooking is swell:
Ask a crab, and a turkey as well.
On a turkey it's skin
That keeps stuffing within;
On a crab it's a part of the shell.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Don't extimulate quarrels, you fool!
Stirring trouble up's truly not cool.
Try to calm folks instead;
Keep a clear, level head.
When things start to heat up, don't add fuel.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Nature gave us two eyes that can see
In the round, and we call it 3-D.
When you needle me, jocularly,
That you like me binocularly,
I blush at the roundness of me.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The priest's fatherliness made him attractive,
Like a dad, but he would have been sacked if
The Church had found out
That that pedophile lout
Had been more than paternally active.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cosset's a little pet lamb
That has recently come from its dam.
You should cosset yours while
It is small.  What a trial
When you pamper a fully grown ram!

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Do you con how to pull off a con?
Here's a plan that I'll gladly pass on:
Strip the cash off a fool
Using flim-flam, then you'll
Appear harmless the moment you're gone.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Though I don't have a car or a van,
I follow the ways of my clan:
I sell freshly spun wool
From the handcart I pull,
Its strong wheels quite as old as my gran.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This project, developed with brilliance,
Multidisciplined, augurs resilience.
If the chemists sign on,
It will not be withdrawn.
All we need is our colleagues' consilience.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
In your fiction, a creable land
Must be strictly and carefully planned.
You have to take care
That your sea, land, and air
Are just right, lest your novel be panned.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What do I know of suffixes? Plenty!
Take the one that ends -B-I-O-N-T.
These five letters suggest
Where a creature lives best,
Something known to all word cognoscenti.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Here's a tool that will help you to dust,"
Said her husband. "You'll love it, I trust.
But although it's a mop,
It is not used for slop."
"Then it's useless, you dimwit!" she cussed.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
The life of Gesualdo: dramatic!
Like his colourful music, erratic.
Accidentals abound;
His unusual sound
Is amazingly, wildly chromatic.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
When our fishery folks so astute
Catch some female fresh fish they compute
The total amount
Of eggs in the count
This fecundity's called absolute.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
One of Florida's beaches—hard-packed—
Allowed NASCAR-type sports to be backed.
Part of this state's persona:
The town of Daytona
Beach—magnet to tourists, fast-tracked.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Badwater's a point far below
Sea level, a place most won't go.
The hottest and baddest,
Its runners the maddest:
Don't race it if you're not a pro.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
Biloxi is coastal in Miss.,
The home of casinos — but hiss!
Katrina has ravaged,
And looters have savaged,
This city the sun likes to kiss.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Richard Nixon's is eight-ninety-five.
Gerald Ford's is worth less (he's alive).
I collect and I traffic
In things autographic.
"John Hancocks" I sell to survive.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
We divide the world's people in two:
There are us, and of course all of you.
Oh, we might call them goys,
Those uncircumcised boys.
You're a gentile if you're not a Jew.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
By day he marked time with a scrawl;
By night he abraded the wall.
His primary goal
Was to scratch out a hole
And then through it, to freedom, he'd crawl.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Coagulopathy (problems with clotting)
Causes bleeding — a lot, not just spotting.
Haemophiliacs rue it,
And snake bites can do it
(The morgue then is where you'll be slotting).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Every weekend—my daughter suspects—
Her new boyfriend cuts up (he dissects)
Human bodies. Her fear:
When he stares at her rear,
He's observing her figure's defects.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
These emperors tower over all
Where the blizzards relentlessly squall.
In the bleak August night,
Male penguins sit tight
On their eggs, heeding fatherhood's call.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To a tollkeeper, two old men spoke,
A priest and a rabbi, both broke:
"Our iguana just died—"
But the other replied,
"Sorry, fellas. You're in the wrong joke."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
We were women, now famous, all five.
We had vision, and courage, and drive.
We all questioned the law:
We were persons! What's more,
We encouraged all women to strive.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
All our seniors are learning en masse
That adult education's a gas.
That middle-aged dowdy
Is summa cum laude.
So's the geezer who snoozes in class.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The conditioned response! There it was!
The saliva ran down from the muz-
zles of dogs with no food
To be smelled or be chewed,
At the bell (or he might use a buzz).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As long as you're male, and alive, it's
A tenet you'll need to survive.  It's
Not polite to go bare,
So at least you must wear
A breechcloth to cover your privates.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
"Would you stomp on a Rubens like that?"
The calcographer yelled as he sat
With his opus in chalk
On the pavement. "Don't walk
On my art—throw a coin in my hat!"

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Mix potatoes with flaked, salted cod,
And roll up into balls—but how odd
That the name of this dish
Could mean "dances for fish"
If they'd been so enabled by God.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Prohibition's the worst!"  "Though we're dry
As a nation, we still can get high.
You're naive, overlooking
This fuel for cooking:
Canned heat."  "But I don't wanna die!"

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
A client is someone who pays you,
For tasks that don't normally faze you.
But once in a while,
They smile and with guile
Will lay down requirements that daze you.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At my end, when my spirit ascends,
I intend to do well by my friends.
My intention is strong:
If I've done them some wrong,
In my will I'll be making amends.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When you're out very early, it's true,
You'll see dawn. To stay dry, here's a clue:
Wear your boots (don't complain)—
Though there hasn't been rain,
All the grass will be covered in dew.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
It's the crappiest sound for a word —
Etymology's rooted in "turd."
That intestinal rumbling
Or political grumbling? —
Cacophony's what you just heard.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
"A cheerful, agreeable mood,
That's good temper," asserted the dude,
"And good-humoured I am
When I have a large dram,
And my girlfriend ends up in the nude."

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
My little boat came alongshore.
I hopped out, perhaps to explore.
I do love the beach
Whene'er it's in reach,
Though I truly love sailing still more.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a worm gets enraged, it can wriggle:
Apoplectically wiggle and jiggle.
But in dreams, it flies higher,
And screeches in ire.
It aspires to get sore like an iggle.

limerick_list.author: Nick Szymanski
limerick_list.text:
What will make your stiff style more elastic?
The word order that's known as chiastic.
Just, whatever you say,
Make it a b b a:
"Dull is Wordsworth, while Keats is fantastic!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Of no royal was Jane a descendant.
On her looks and her bearing dependent,
She would preen like a queen
In a posh magazine:
Epiphanous, i.e., resplendent.

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
We see the whole world in large masses
And divide them all up in three classes—
Those that we're rotten to,
Those that we cotton to,
And the rest—just a bunch of dumb asses.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The projector came on, and I cursed.
What I'd edited, culled, and rehearsed
With the slide carousel
Was a circle of hell:
Every picture was flipped and reversed!

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
When you find that a burr is occurring,
Just remove it: perform a deburring.
Make your workpiece pristine
With a tool or machine.
Time to get your deburring tool whirring.

limerick_list.author: buttonbright
limerick_list.text:
You'll pray for the patience of Job
If you've married an agoraphobe.
It pains him to face
The mobbed marketplace,
So he sits round the house in his robe.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I remember the Cold War quite well.
With its four-minute warning of hell
If unleashed, M.A.D.
Held out horrors for me;
And on them I preferred not to dwell.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
For a pump stock we need water quick,
And a blast hole will best do the trick.
For a tunnel or mine
Where a blast we'd confine,
Drill a hole for a dynamite stick.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
"Well, I  cannot get through to my Callie,"
Said Cal to Camellia. "She'll dally
And not come when I call—
There's a great Chinese wall
That's between us. I'm up a blind alley."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Mixed martial arts fans find exciting
This blood sport they know as cage fighting.
Would that feeling abide
If they were inside
With a bruiser they found uninviting?

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Buenos Aires, a city so clean; a
Great game in the Boca arena;
Asados and wine:
My vacation was fine.
So don't cry for me, Argentina.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
"A blind date? Well, why not?  I'm elated."
Upon meeting, her spirits deflated.
"I don't mean to be cold,
But you look very old
And perhaps you should be carbon-dated."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
So, cognitive therapy? Please
Let me benefit first from this wheeze.
If it gets me the hell
Out of this padded cell
— Why does telling you this make me sneeze?

limerick_list.author: olioil
limerick_list.text:
If some riches will put you in rapture
And gambling's your method of capture,
Being avid is wrong
'Cause you'll linger so long
Folks at home will then think you're a sap, sure.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I'm the boss here, as everyone knows.
If you cross me, we'll soon come to blows!"
This the captain declared
(As if anyone cared).
"Whatever I say," he snarled, "goes!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A judge who's dishonest and venal
May find himself doing time penal,
A fact unrelated
To glands situated
Near the kidneys and known as adrenal.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Did fulmars (that foul, oily stink!),
Of extinction, get brought to the brink
By St Kildans, who killed
'Em en masse, and then filled
Lamps with "petrol" from petrels (wink, wink)?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cadastre's a register showing
How sales in the county are going
On parcels of land,
Where the boundaries stand,
And what taxes the owners are owing.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The tears are beginning to well
In her eyes, and how quickly the spell
Of the beautiful miss
(And that promise of bliss)
Has turned into the bawl of the belle!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
She'd examined her heart about men;
Asked herself how she felt, and again
And again, she had found
Both her feet on the ground,
Until Ben. He scored ten out of ten.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
On my colour wheel, hues are displayed,
Both in shade and in sequence arrayed;
Yellows blend into red,
Then to blue I am led
In a circular rainbow parade.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Chondrogenesis: cartilage grows.
It produces your ears and your nose
(Where it channels each sneeze),
Cushions joints such as knees,
And some stuff that you'd never suppose.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Her worn face told a punishing tale:
An absumed look, eroded and pale.
She'd held troubles inside,
First consumed then denied,
But her eyes showed her hopelessly frail.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Some aspects the power plant lacked
Comprised offsets and LAER using BACT.
But the ministry said,
"It's OK, go ahead."
Now the minister ought to be sacked.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The word debitor?  Once it meant "debtor,"
In the old days, when many a fetter
Graced the ankles of guys
Who had been so unwise
As to wager and lose as a bettor.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For some folks the law has attraction,
And they're likely to take civil action.
At the smallest offense
They will seek recompense;
Your expense will provide satisfaction.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
With our cammocks we strike and advance,
Passing swiftly with nary a glance
At defenders whose tricks
Involve slashing their sticks.
With these antics, they don't stand a chance.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
This badger, of  mean  reputation,
Made the beekeepers fight its predation
In Africa, killing
On sight. Now they're willing
To help, 'cause it needs conservation.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
Our King is a regal fanatic
Who has never removed his dalmatic
Or his crown since the day
He was crowned; makes me pray
For the day that our land's democratic.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Boss, our wool shop's run short of a yarn —
It's called Gone-With-The-Wind Southern Barn."
"For colors strange-named,
I care less," he exclaimed.
"My dear, frankly, I don't give a darn."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Once one's cheer (whether one was a fool
Or a king) could be affable, cruel,
Evil, angry or glad,
Sane as Plato or mad.
It meant "facial expression." (Mine's cool.)

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Bisecting a girl? That's delusion.
And then render her whole in conclusion?
But he gave it a try,
Then failed badly...Oh, my!
Now he ponders his sad disillusion.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Man's fantasy: All must adore
God above or he'll pout, and what's more
He is swayed by our prayers!
Clergy lives off these wares —
Dreams and figments — today as before.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The wax on his car was his pride.
The street's shiniest? Never denied.
Till I gave him the whammy
And stole his best chamois —
"Got your goat now!" was all that I cried.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Our dynamite expert inspects
Every job 'cause we're risking our necks.
Want your building to fall?
We're the outfit to call:
Demolition by Edifice Wrecks.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
If you're driving and suddenly find
That the snowfall is making you blind,
Of the front car, keep track
And stay really far back.
Keep the four-second rule in your mind.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To win captainship's every girl's dream.
Here's the head of the cheerleading team,
Who holds pom-poms up high
While she calculates pi.
She's a mathlete—a bright academe.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We're over and done.  We have drawn
To a close.  What we had is now gone.
Love, once new and inviting
And truly exciting,
Has come to an end with a yawn.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
If I call you my Boswell, this means
That you're there when I make all the scenes,
Writing down what I say
(To be published some day
By magnificent printing machines).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
First you double the Celsius degrees.
Then you add 32, if you please.
The result is around
The right temperature found
On the Fahrenheit scale—it's a breeze!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Christian Gottlob Gmelin proclaimed
A new mineral, then it was named
As gmelinite. Graced
With his name it's now placed
In the zeolite family—famed.

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
The rise of a counter-insurgency
Will trigger a state of emergency
For any insurgents
Who view the emergence
Of counter-insurgents with urgency.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
As a rooster who used to have clout,
He's about to be beat in a bout.
Once the cock of the walk,
Now his squawk is all talk.
In the rout, he'll be chickening out.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The East India Company's Spice Trade:
A Colonial British Device? Trade
With India started
Benignly, but parted
Thereafter from being a nice trade...

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said the teacher, with blatant hostility,
"Your daughter lacks corrigibility.
She's disruptive; she'll shout;
I can't straighten her out.
She's disturbing the classroom's tranquility."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Murder hornets! Pandemic! Bad hair!
Aussie bushfires! Protests! Despair!
But enough of the whining—
There's one silver lining:
You can Zoom with your colleagues half bare.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
You're oppressed by the Russians. You're Chechen.
Your response involves more than just kvetchin'.
Your revenge is not tame,
And your bombs kill and maim
Many innocent people; I'm retchin'.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In your sculpture, Nude Woman, the section
From shoulder to hip needs correction.
We've a model, so please
Observe carefully—she's
Beau ideal; she's Nature's perfection.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
For a decade, no sex with my mate,
But tonight I'm aroused for our date.
All our mating's long-planned,
So I don't understand
Why our kids are 6, 7, and 8.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
While in class I was happily napping,
The prof described chromosome mapping:
"Finding each gene's location
Is a fine occupation..."
I awoke to the sound of his yapping.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A closh, you may learn with a shock,
On a boat is a spiked upright block.
Here a hard-hearted sailor
On the deck of a whaler
Cuts blubber, despite the boat's rock.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
His religious devotion was deep,
So the Scopes trial was hardly a leap.
Evolution? It lost.
Then again, at what cost?
Five days hence, Bryan died in his sleep.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cudgels some pirates will choose,
And will use to bruise enemy crews,
Can convince the king's guards
That defeat's in the cards—
With an offer they cannot refuse.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In three months on the job as park ranger,
You've left twenty-six people in danger,
So a switch has been made.
In the kiddie arcade,
From now on you're a dollar bill changer.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
He's behaviorally challenged, my son,
And he won't rue the actions he's done.
When he slapped me one night,
He explained, with delight,
"I've just high-fived your face, Mom! Such fun!"

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The OEDILF often gets an addition
From writers who share Chris's mission.
They add poems online,
Tell their friends, "Look at mine!
Doncha think I got great erudition?"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My barber is also a seer,
Doing readings of wax, so his dear
And ceruminous whims
Oft accompany trims
Of the hair growing out of my ear.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Long time since I've seen you: a coon's age!"
Much longer than that? I'd say loon's age.
(Three years live raccoons;
Ten times longer for loons.
For gazillions of years, it's a moon's age!)

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
Husband Paul cried in agony, "Jane!
I've acromiohumeral pain!"
Then when neighbour Eileen
Queried, "What does he mean?"
Jane explained, "It's his shoulder again."

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Happitis, Happitis. Drillatis,
Readitis, Dreaditis, Stillatis!
Buildatis, Spikeatis,
Armatis, Strikeatis,
Abatis, Stabatis, Killatis!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If your vision's becoming quite blurred,
It is likely your case should be heard
By a doctor of eyes.
He may tell you it's wise
To act now. Don't let help be deferred!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
With just minimal flirting, this chap
Had an angel fall into his lap.
He was caught by surprise
At that bar when her eyes
Said, "I want you."  Sweet love was on tap.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
We were off to Jerusalem — yea! —
In the first month of spring, the twelfth day:
Ahavah, the river,
We left with a shiver
Of joy, as God's hand paved the way.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
Pity wee Cabassous unicinctus,
As he cries out in pain for some linctus.
"My tongue hurts," he pants.
"It's this diet of ants."
Heaven knows what it does to his sphincters.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
In the seventh month, next to a tarn,
I put all my corn's ears in a barn.
The name Abib fits two
Of these things, it is true:
It's an earlier name for Nisan.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the '50s, we had a flirtation
With beatniks (a "coolness" fixation).
They favored a drum
Called the bongo—to some,
Just a method of beat generation.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My acid dyspepsia's flared
To the point where digestion's impaired.
Gastric acid is burning;
My stomach is churning.
In my gut, World War Three's been declared.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our teacher is truly a bum —
We must give up our gum, so we're glum.
Her strange wording confused us,
Then later amused us:
"Henceforward you must eschew gum!"

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Though the Elder's great talent was vaster,
The Younger could copy much faster.
For each work of his father,
The Younger made rather
More copies that mimicked the master.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
The natural gas CO2
Is formed  when a beer's in the brew.
But industrial gas
Will never, alas,
Make a beer that keen drinkers pursue.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My shapeless gray glob spins around.
I'll breathe life into sticky cold ground.
Its fate means a lot for me —
Clay, be a pot for me!
Pottery's pretty profound.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
What doofus decided to fix
A verb that was adequate: mix?
What brought them to blend
A before with that end
To create the admixture admix?

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Seven Webers, two Carters, three, four...
Sixteen Holleys, and two Carters more."
"Want some burgers for lunch?"
He said, "No need to munch."
"Counting carbs," I observed from the door.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Abdominothoracic applies
To the bodily region that lies
From the chest (and the heart)
To the stomach—the part
On my torso that's greatest in size.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
The planet we live on, called Earth,
Is a gem of incredible worth
Because it is wetter
And greener and better
Than it was on the day of its birth.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
You cattails and rushes love muds
Where the earth periodically floods.
You're emergent; why care
If a pond is down there,
When your stalk's high and dry with your buds?

limerick_list.author: The IRON(ing) Knight
limerick_list.text:
Picard was unlucky to meet
An aggressive Cardassian fleet.
So he polished his phasers
And fired his lasers,
'Til those reptiles admitted, "We're beat."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
As a model for artists I'm clothesless.
I am shirtless and pantless and hoseless.
Of my body I'm proud
(Though I'm not well endowed,
So I hope that their paintings expose less).

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Our firm's headquarters here in Rangoon
Markets wetsuits throughout the monsoon.
Our new field office though,
Out in London, I know,
Will sell more in the first week of June.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dissociative fugue is the kind
Where the patient runs off, tries to find
A fresh life—something new.
When you ask: "Who are you?"
Where's his memory? Left it behind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Seems that ethanal's found in your bread.
Massive doses can render you dead.
You've been drinking some booze?
From your liver 'twill ooze,
Then breed hangovers, make your face red.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Dad, you're drunk. Go on home, I insist.
Please! Your dad dancing will not be missed.
Plus your dance is so wrong
For this modern-day song."
"No, it's classic. It's ageless—the Twist!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When that myth about Jack got some traction,
His ridiculous overreaction
Was wild, unrestrained.
He declaimed until drained,
But that freak-out gave no satisfaction.

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
Checkered whiptail lizards reside
In the dry, rocky landscape outside.
They eat bugs and are wary
Of anything scary,
Darting off to the shadows to hide.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Colour circles can help you suffuse
Reds and oranges, yellows and blues.
Complementary? Clash?
From Titian to Nash,
Artists use them to choose the right hues.

limerick_list.author: Jenn Phillips
limerick_list.text:
Tired of toothpaste? Smile big and then slosh
To see yellowing teeth become posh
Without powders or gel;
Banish plaque with a spell
Of bright dentilave: mouth-sparkling wash.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Arcimboldo (Giuseppe) got looks
For his art, but I'd say that it cooks.
Every portrait's a hoot,
Made of veggies or fruit.
His Librarian's made out of books.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
His opponent he wanted to bludgeon,
But instead, he stalked off in high dudgeon.
He was angered, aggrieved,
Upset and plain peeved,
Just because he'd been called a curmudgeon.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Here's a dandyfunk made by my niece,
Of molasses, crushed biscuit and grease.
A no-nonsense ship's cook,
She prepares by the book.
If you're tempted to gripe, keep your peace.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
The word ace, for a pilot, conveys
He's made forty-two kills on soirées.
Wait: soirées? I meant sorties;
And not in the forties,
But five. Oy, it's one of those days.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
British English, the language of Britain,
Is loved by the Yanks who are smitten
By accents whose style
Makes a change with each mile —
But they don't understand how it's written.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
The cross-sectional study's sublime:
It's a survey at one point in time
That asks people to say
What their choice is today.
Here is mine—margaritas with lime!

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
Re: Harvey. "A smash—guarantee it!"
I greenlit the project, albeit
Reluctantly. Who'll
Want to act like a fool
And befriend a huge rabbit? Can't see it.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
The street gang's a chorus of noise and
Of swagger, testosterone-poisoned.
Their turf's one city block:
Just four streets trap this flock
Where the powers of these sullen boys end.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
It's your farm you don't want to destroy —
There are methods you need to employ.
You can azotize land
If rotation is planned,
With such plantings as clover and soy.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
If I failed to point out, by contrivancy,
That colleagues had not said that -ivancy
Can also take E
In connivency, gee,
I'd be guilty myself of connivancy.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Does the Bilderberg Group control all?
Is the whole world held tight in its thrall?
A conspiracy plot?
I would say that it's not,
But it could be. Who knows; it's your call.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The thing with containerized cargo:
Stuff inside might elude an embargo.
Just to check every box
On its blocks at the docks
Is a task that would bankrupt Wells Fargo.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
It's entirely aleatory,
Winning big when you don't know the story.
It's the luck of beginners
That always makes winners;
Quite easy to see, a priori.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
There was once a young man from Capri
Who was stung on the face by a bee.
When they asked, "Does it sting?"
He said only one thing:
"Friends, I'm dying! Please call my GP!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
McClellan had Lee on the run
At Antietam when fighting was done.
But he failed to pursue.
That's a tactic he'd rue.
In the end, no side lost, no side won.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
From the library, Stan got a book
Titled How to Become a Book Crook.
With the mentoring in it,
He did not waste a minute.
That guide was the first book he took.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I'll explain in the simplest of ways
With an easily understood phrase
So you'll know you've been taught right.
Remember, a fortnight
Is fourteen consecutive days.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The Aristarch brooked not a snag;
At each typo, he'd hoist a red flag.
His critical shrewdness
Struck others as rudeness:
His slagging, they thought, was a drag.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Did Shakespeare, when on a blind date,
Ever think, "This is fated!" and rate
Her a lass of fine feather?
I'm wondering whether
He'd state, "Kate, you're great as co-mate."

limerick_list.author: Nosmo King
limerick_list.text:
On the bandstand, the cats are all jammin'.
You doubt they are cats? Please examine:
Their tunes really swing,
But post-concert their thing
Is to play the buffet for the salmon.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
In the French class, he took his last test.
To be first in the class was his quest.
But an accent mark placed
On the wrong word disgraced
The poor boy.  He came out second best.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At the casting call, guys get depressed
To discover we're gender-obsessed,
But when monologues speak
Of vaginas, we seek
Authenticity: broad-casting's best.

limerick_list.author: Harper
limerick_list.text:
Here I submit a short verse,
Defining in manner quite terse.
Though it isn't sublime,
It does rhyme and keep time.
To aggravate means "to make worse."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
'57: They last made the scene
As the NFL's best.  Many lean
Years would follow — just one
Playoff win; now they stun
With ineptness — they lose all 16.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
High achievement's not yours for the touch,
And you won't be accomplishing much
If you give in to doubt.
It, for sure, will win out.
Accepting such fate is a crutch.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Why anastrophe often he chose
In plain speech, he himself only knows.
It was most disconcerting
This order inverting,
And his friends confused more than his foes.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
My handwriting's just a tad iffy—
This code can't be cracked in a jiffy.
At times it's so runic
You might tear your tunic
Deciphering my scrawl, it's so glyphy.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
His talent is truly emerging
In the art of depuring: expurging —
The reverse of defiling.
So right now he's smiling:
Got his cleansing degree, at my urging.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
A long series of numbers can bring
A shrewd guess of the one in the wing.
One, one, two, three, then five,
Eight, thirteen, now derive:
What's the next that continues this string?

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Compound sentences have two or more
Independent components, and for
Their connection, it's true
A conjunction will do;
Some examples are and, but, and or.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
The question, it seems, is just what
You prefer to drink hot from your pot.
Some need caf, some want de-,
And yet others like tea.
I'd say beer, nicely chilled, beats the lot.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For Dubya, it's "¡Hola!" in Plano.
In Miami it's todo muy bueno.
But from Bush in Oswego
You won't hear "amigo."
His Spanish will vanish like Drano.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
So! You found my last message confusing?
And it didn't make sense, on perusing,
To compare what I said
With one earlier read?
Alter egos are seldom amusing.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
You are lazy and thick, I deduce,
From your feeblest-ever excuse.
Did you think I'd accept
Any claim so inept
As 'The dog ate my homework'? Obtuse!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Thrice fourteen generations Rev. Blatts
Reads from Matthew. I think they're all prats,
So I started to snooze
When he droned the Good News
And began with the boring begats.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Cubic functions, I'm learning, would be
Polynomials where three's the degree.
My study confirms
They're the sum of four terms:
ax³, bx², cx, d.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"It's a fine climbing vine," said the boss.
"Trumpet flowers and leaves with high gloss.
It's called cross vine, but I
Cannot understand why."
"Cut the stem and you'll see it—a cross."

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I do caregiver's work, so I tend
To some folks who can no longer fend
For themselves. I feel use-
ful when serving them juice
And their meals, perhaps helping them mend.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Allegiance, my teachers allege,
Requires reciting a pledge.
Our loyalty oath
Is something I'm loath
To utter; it's lacking in edge.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
Earless lizards aren't  earless, you know.
It's a myth that has managed to grow.
But in truth 'twould appear
An interior ear
Works for audio. (Just goes to show.)

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
When so brightly the day is now dawning,
And your mouth opens wide from your yawning,
What can save both your eyes
From the sunlight's surprise
Is your window's full sunshade, its awning.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
Morimando
limerick_list.text:
See, I know this one cyclop, a guy
Who came into this world with one eye.
But he hasn't a need
For a second, indeed,
And one sun glass is cheaper — he's sly!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's the minimum number of tons
They can ship at a freight rate that runs
Somewhat more than the charge
If they send 'em by barge.
So let's order a carload of guns.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Sailing south, the Antarctic Convergence
Is a front marking surface submergence,
Like our spirits, downwelling
To Davy Jones' dwelling,
That long for a warming resurgence.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Some say "bless-ed" and others say "blest."
When our bishop grew old and distressed,
He said, "Dress-ed art those
Who are wearing God's clothes,"
When I guess what he meant was just "dressed."

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
The technique ECG-gated SPECT
(Image-test heart consultants select)
Shows contraction, perfusion,
Both with rest and infusion;
Helps decide if your heart muscle's wrecked.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
John Young
limerick_list.text:
If you suffer from Duhring's disease,
You will scratch like a dog plagued by fleas.
A gluten free diet
And dapsone—just try it—
Will lessen your rash by degrees.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When our fenders were bent, as a claim form,
Both drivers were given the same form.
Though I'd guess the form's aim
Was establishing blame,
What a shame that they used such a lame form!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This "old earthenware pharmacists' jar"
Must be bogus. See: "Made in Qatar."
Albarello or not,
A maiolica pot
Seems a steal at a single dinar.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A nice time was the billiards club's fun day:
It was eating and drinking all Sunday,
But I had not a clue
Why a guy used a cue
On my head (did he think it was "Stun day"?).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
No more bat days! The management plans
To give out something better: sedans!
Come and root for your team—
Win or lose, it's a dream!
This will surely go down well with fans.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Clues regarding this deadly attack
Were thin on the ground, tough to track;
But a fibre (a filament)
Traced to the killer meant
This was a case they would crack.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
A song which you sing and which then
You decantate again and again,
Can be either a hit
Or so lousy that it
Bores your public till heaven knows when.

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Poor critter: he'd not seen it coming,
As he happily hopped along humming.
A truck on the road
Blindsided the toad,
Exposing some squishy red plumbing.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I hear that you're sick. I won't tease ya,
'Cause I'm told that your trouble's dyschezia.
Things have gotten so bad,
All the BMs you've had
Needed general, deep anesthesia.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the army (or jail) you have got,
Realistically, not a whole lot.
Three warm meals they provide,
And a bed is supplied.
This is known as three hots and a cot.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The skin has just started to rip
By the nail on my finger (the tip).
It's an agnail that's needing
A Band-Aid—it's bleeding,
So redbirds are all I can flip.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Macbeth, while observing the witches stir
Their cauldron, felt longing for riches stir
Him to murder most fell.
We were under his spell
In the Festival Theatre at Chichester.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
In Great Britain Obama was staying,
And his protocol skills seemed dismaying.
He continued a toast
To his dignified host
While her national anthem was playing.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
The explorer-priest's humour was not
Much aroused by the place card he got,
For he felt savage sinners,
When giving priests dinners,
Should not make them sit in the pot.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
The Victorians noted with clarity,
In the Lower Class, moral disparity.
The deserving they knew,
And the criminal too;
Only one was thought worthy of charity.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Americans eat 'round the clock.
We're fat and we're sick—what a shock!
If we don't take the car,
We can't get very far.
Thank God for two Subways per block!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Do you dig all that Internet jive?
Without shorthand how could we survive?
If you're really quite proud
To be LOL,
Well then text me a cyber ^5.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Our elephant's foot in the hall,
Is a place to put sticks when folk call.
Such umbrella stands may
Seem offensive today,
And on eBay?  They don't sell at all.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I believed that some lecherous linking
With Lynn could begin with some winking.
At my very best wink,
She responded, "You stink!"
What a backfire! What was I thinking?

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Zeno's paradox — can it be true?
Catching up with a honey like you
Should be easy, and yet,
When you play hard to get,
Gaining ground isn't easy to do.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
What gives ice cubes their signature clink,
And allows them to cool off your drink?
It's a process called freezing
(Gelation), thus easing
The in-laws arrival (wink, wink).

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
The doc's microscope clearly displayed
Tiny critters, unseen without aid:
Animalculous creatures
With hideous features
Got into my blood, I'm afraid.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a beam, in the web of a truss,
Engineers all consider a plus.
The counterbrace takes
Extra tension, which makes,
In a bridge, for more strength and less fuss.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A young folksinger, awfully eager,
Worked hard, but his earnings were meagre.
When his "Wimoweh" tanked
And his "Greensleeves" was yanked,
He gave up singing songs like Pete Seeger.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Nay, velvet or silk I'll eschew
For my codpiece. This wood ought to do:
From the part of a tree
Where a branch made a V,
Crotch veneer's smart and durable, too.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Archegonium shields its egg's space:
Through its fluid, the antherozoids race;
The one who gets in
Will certainly win
This year's trophy for liverwort ace.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
We cried "Nerd!", and he thought us absurd.
We yelled "Birdbrain!" and scarcely he stirred.
Then we tried "Red Delicious!" —
He quickly turned vicious!
It's the worst appellation he's heard.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
At the madam's new upscale bordello,
She served aspics and quivering jello.
But the bedsprings kept creaking
And patrons leapt, shrieking,
While she tuned up her violoncello.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
What we've learned we can colligate well.
This was planned by the OPEC cartel:
Wells shut down "for inspection"
Just before our election—
Price correction; incumbent, farewell.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Tried to cram all the work, but it wouldn't.
Asked my sister for help (learned I shouldn't).
Then my pencils all broke,
And my dog had a stroke.
Cut a long story short? I just couldn't.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Brothers Four jumped on the scene
With a song about fields that, once green,
Became parched by the sun —
Almost made number one.
Then they sang for the big and small screen.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
There goes Mavis, figged out for a date:
Gowned and gloved, and she's not even late.
Freddie's just seen it on her;
Poor boy is a goner.
Like a bluegill, he'll rise to the bait.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Life's too brief to be dull and uptight.
Sweet diversions deliver delight:
Entertainment's a treat
That makes life more complete,
So let me entertain you… tonight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In this joining-with-others reaction
Do atoms find real satisfaction?
I suspect it's (in dating)
The impulse toward mating
That's truly a chemical attraction.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
True, the suspect's a jerk and a goof,
And when questioned he's strangely aloof,
But to bust him for pot,
That's not helpful a lot.
What we need is definitive proof.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
"Bifoliolate? Say again?"
"Said of leaflets just numbering twain.
With but one leaf to view,
We observe leaflets, two.
You looked stunned, so I had to explain."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Legs parted, our model is dozing.
Look! Her sexual parts she's exposing.
Bring a wrap for this chick—
Some envelopment—quick,
'Cause her privates could stand some enclosing.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Two eyeballs converse, chum to chum.
In a whispery tone, one says, "Umm...
How to say this? Let's see...
Just between you and me,
There's something that smells. Now keep mum."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Bible declares that the meek
Shall inherit the Earth, while the clique
That's comprised of the brash
And the haughty will cash
In their chips down in Hell—up the creek.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An urbane washer-dryer installer,
Paul from Georgia proclaimed: "I'm no drawler,
But I had a close call
When I bawled: 'Bye-bye y'all!'
I felt small, like a worm (a night crawler)."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There is no way her doc can assure a
Happy outcome. He's trying to cure a
Case of poisoning from
This odd plant. She'll succumb
To the thorn apple (known as datura).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In printing, a break is a space
Between paragraphs. Such is the case
In the following note
Where it says, and I quote:
"Check it out! There's a space in that place."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
These isles in the southern Atlantic
(The Falklands) made two nations frantic.
The Argentines, skittish,
Sought to throw out the British
But lost, and the blow was gigantic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mom says Tommy's a dab hand, and his
Formal garden's the best that there is,
But that puzzles Ms. Liz—
"Is this kind of a quiz?"
"No, a dab hand in Britain's a whiz!"

limerick_list.author: metallel
limerick_list.text:
When the man came with liquor, he'd quiver.
When the beer truck arrived, he would shiver.
While it's nice you can choose
How you're getting your booze,
It can sure take a toll on deliver.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
As an aftershave, don't use a spray
Of diphenylchlorarsine (DA)
Or (C6H5)2
AsCl — Achoo! —
For you'll cough, spew and scare them away!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The bright morning sun sets alight
Floating suns, set in starbursts of white.
This is alligator bonnet.
But, leave it or don it,
These suns will set long before night.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
If a constative claim is not true,
Then it's false (e.g., "Apples are blue.").
It's one or the other—
I'm telling you, brother,
It ain't very hard to construe.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Our running coach? Mad as a hatter!
We run to lose weight." "What's the matter?"
"When we race, he'll advise
That the last seven guys
Are all gaining. They're all getting fatter?"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Our Party will give up the ghost
If the hard-liners bolt.  Then we're toast.
Stick a fork in; we're done.
Any third-party run
Will ensure the demise of its host.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Through frustration that will not abate,
I am in an expostulatory state —
I argue the toss,
Reason well with my boss,
To let me take control of my fate.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
After Hoffa stops paying his dues,
The mob ships his body in shoes
Of all-purpose cement
To a Meadowlands gent.
It's a Hoffa this guy can't refuse.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Entheastic, by God's grace inspired,
Seven wives Clive with haste had acquired.
Once just a bigamist,
This piggy polygamist —
Shortly, at forty, expired.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
In Lahore and Land's End and Lucerne,
You will notice the arsis astern.
But in Chusan and Chester
And Lisbon and Leicester
The arsis afore, you'll discern.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Corticifugal axons begin
At the cerebral cortex, within.
Then like tendrils that sprout,
They extend to without,
Where their counterpart nerve fibers spin.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Through the trial the defendant smiled coolly.
But when sentenced, he looked about bluely.
Sacre bleu! This sad Frenchman
Found out that his henchman
Had ratted — that pissoir-tête stoolie!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Let's denazify"—that's what you preach—
"Let's get rid of those bullies who teach
So much hatred!" But how
Can we manage it now
Without losing our freedom of speech?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Anonymice frequently say
That the world's in the toilet today.
They talk tough and demand
That we all make a stand,
But in signed manifestos?  No way!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Electronystagmography: a test
Of the eye as it moves, not at rest.
When electrodes are placed,
And eye movements traced,
Diagnoses are fact-based, not guessed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A bully who suffered no fool
Liked to brawl every day after school.
A belligerent smoker,
He'd taunt any joker
By blowing his Kools and his cool.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the sand, find a clamshell with edging
That's sharp, and a shape good for wedging,
On the isle of Nantucket—
It looks like the bucket
Called  clamshell that's useful for dredging.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
I'm bespectacled, sneaky and sly,
For suspended in front of each eye,
There's a lens held in place
By a frame on my face
Which assists me to see (and to spy).

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
The mid-term elections delighted
The Democrats. Gosh, they're excited!
As for Bush, I must say
(The UK view today),
He presides over States dis-United.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
No sugar tonight in my tea
Or my coffee—it's saccharine-free!
Save your cream and your milk
And lactiferous ilk
For the British, since black is for me.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
You're abnegative, dismal, denying
Of anything good. You keep sighing.
Your life's all awry.
You've a tear in your eye.
Though you're healthy, you act like you're dying.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We've been watching her temperature climb;
This next hour's a critical time.
Sal's been fevering gravely.
She's weathered it bravely,
But she's years past the average mule's prime.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
On myself all my troubles I bring.
I got irked and yelled, "Off with this thing!"
With a furious fling,
I tossed high my gold bling;
Now I seek what I lost, my flung ring.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cagney's acting came straight from the heart.
He was master of cinema's art;
And all calls he would answer,
For gangster or dancer.
George Cohan? Perhaps his best part.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Buying hair dye I seek Clairol's name.
I like changelessness (things stay the same),
Lest my lovely brown tresses
End up as green messes.
Now I strut down the street without shame.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer and mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Have some water to lift, what to do?
I would augur an auger for you.
Slide it into a tube
And then turn it, you boob!
Archimedes sure knew how to screw.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Put in water to make a suspension?
Its makers might have that intention,
But it clumps into stuff
That a whisk's not enough
To deflocculate, please let me mention.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
I've extracted, from mould in my basin,
A metabolite, cytochalasin.
Cell structure's attacked in
Its latching to actin.
Now what should I wash hands and face in?

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
The neighbors are all in a buzz
Since police have arrested my cuz.
While she does have short hair,
It's not right to declare
That my cuz has been snatched by the fuzz.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
In our sacrosanct government halls
Politicians' vile attitude galls.
They rejoice in the kill;
You can hear the cheer still,
"Now I got you, you dog, by the balls."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Al Jazeera bought Current TV,
Which was led by our former V.P.
From a mindset progressive
To anti-U.S.-ive —
No difference as far as I see.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
'Break a leg,' someone hissed from the wings
As I swooped across stage, held by strings.
But my trident slipped free,
Broke a Valkyrie's knee;
Now I know why the fat lady sings.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Norwegian, the tongue, is a fiction:
In Norway, the grammar and diction
Is Bokmaal for most,
But where fjords cut the coast
Nynorsk is pronounced with conviction.

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
"To compare," argued Rob with Stavisky,
"Your Russia with Scotland is risky.
To measure a nation,
Let's rate distillation:
Your vodka could never beat whisky."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Here are fewmets of bongo and gnu — do
You know their connection to kudu?"
"I deduce from these feces
They're antelope species."
"It's true, Lou — you do know your doo-doo!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You say you're too fearful to stand,
Or to walk without holding my hand?
And that these morbid fears
Have a name?  I'm all ears!
Basophobia—ain't English grand?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Strict pedantry bores many stiff,
Although I've started many a tiff
Over diphthong. Get hip:
It does not start with "dip",
Since that "thong" is preceded by "diff".

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Though diseases are clearly the reason
That you're sneezin' and wheezin' this season,
At below three degrees,
You're in snow to your knees
In your sheerest chemise, so you're freezin'.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Casinos, in legalese bramble,
Seek lawyers in hopes to unscramble
Prohibited prose.
So the lawyers propose,
"Come to Reno, a nice place to gambol!"

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Once a popular touristy spot,
Acapulco's become just "too hot".
Fear and killings are laid
To the heavy drug trade.
The cruel gangs show no heart, not a jot.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
As a badger who looks like a ferret,
I can match either creature for merit.
Plus, should either die out,
Thanks to famine or drought,
I'm the cousin who stands to inherit.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Established for good on that day
Was the fame of the Frenchman, Auger.
Through a path indirect,
He could claim an effect
On electrons that wandered away.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
She stood garbed in what looked like a sack.
So I said, "Sense of style, dear, you lack.
Your appearance is wacky
And tawdry and tacky.
Of dressing, you're lacking the knack."

limerick_list.author: Meps Schulte
limerick_list.text:
"She's adrift!" said the captain, aghast.
The anchor that held his boat fast
Had failed, to his shock.
Now he stood on the dock
And he searched, quite in vain, for his mast.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Bihari procedure I owe
For the inches I gained down below.
With a ligament cut,
Further out I now jut,
And my girlfriend is simply aglow.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
From our duck-hunting, home via Daniel's.
He said, "Bring some deodorant granules
Next time out, for that fug —
Rotting rug — makes me chug."
That's the trouble with wet cocker spaniels.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've a terrible cough, and I hope
The bronchoscopist sees in his scope
Nothing dire, like TB,
Or a cancer. If he
Finds a cause that's benign, I can cope.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Herman Melville professed his connection
To an author who urged his reflection
On his seafaring days,
Giving Hawthorne much praise.
Dedication: a sign of affection.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
His muscles could even make muscles,
The bloodless, cold strongman of Brussels.
Yet I'm sorry to say
That he faded away —
His corpuscles could not make corpuscles.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Some think alleys mean garbage and fleas,
But in parks, they have bushes and trees.
Spend delectable days
In these flower-lined ways,
Amid birdsong and soft, fragrant breeze.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
He has shag from his crown to the floor
And he wears just a baldric, no more,
Or a big bandolier.
We revile or revere:
This Chewbacca guy's hard to ignore.
