limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Abetalipoproteinemia:
A disorder of blood (not leukemia).
Malabsorption of fats,
Muscle weakness, and that's
Just a start. There's a link to uremia.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is time for a grand celebration!
I will broadcast the news to the nation
That I passed my exam!
Yes, it's true that I am
On the list for board certification!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Stamp-sized gum, candy-coated and white,
Tiny Chiclets: a chewer's delight.
Not as common today,
The result? One less way
For some thug to elicit a fight.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
At the Spy School to which I once goed,
They were lousy at grammar, but showed
Me the use of Berettas
And writing code letters,
Tp opx J lopx ipx up fodpef.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Due considerance, Sir's what we ask:
A few shillings, some mutton, a cask.
Ain't it comin' our way
After drudgin' all day?
Think it over; we're done wit' your task.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
"I can't fathom," said George with a sigh,
"How those birdies stay up in the sky,
Why at night it gets dark,
Why cows moo and don't bark,
Or the knot in this wretched bow tie."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Now the school board's banned music! Those fools
Have afflicted us all with their rules.
The decision was made
'Cause the school board's afraid
Of some violins and sax in our schools.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Claimed a murderer, found to kill serially,
"I hate germs; I work anti-bacterially.
With a sterilized knife
I will cut short your life,
As your blood spurts and gushes arterially."

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
In my grandmother's garden, they grow
As a border, a bright fragrant row.
They look lovely in June
In the late afternoon
As an un-common four-o'clock show!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Yonder maiden I spy is a belle. A
Bold feller I am, so I'll tell 'er.
(Love to loosen thy corset —
Gadzooks, lad, don't force it.)
"Thy donzel salutes damosella."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
When I put a committee together
To help in determining whether
To seek nomination,
It led to frustration.
Support was as light as a feather.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Bremer
limerick_list.text:
If acidophilic, you're prone
To prefer a less alkaline zone.
But your secret desire
Is something much higher:
To be Timothy Leary's first clone.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A beauty consultant named Grace
Thought that acid would perk up her face.
This was quite incorrect
(She'd have known had she checked),
And she's now disappeared without trace.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A family-man is a crim,
And a family-woman's like him.
They will rob poor old grans,
And for grand crimes make plans
(But commit petty thefts on a whim).

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Chronic endometritis may be
The reason your womb cannot see
A pregnancy through
Till the day you'd be due.
Inflammation reduction's the key.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
Having checked on the birth situation,
The midwife's in some consternation:
The baby, to wound her
Fine feelings, just mooned her! —
You see, it's a breech presentation.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
There's a menacing threat you can make:
Make my day! It's a route you can take,
And the tipping-point grows
To the face-off, he knows,
Situation-wise, means: make or break!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"It's Christmas disease that he's got!"
Cried the mohel.  "His blood doesn't clot!"
I excessively bled,
And I could've been dead
If not given a factor IX shot.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Any fan who's been watching the trends
Of the Oscars, this year comprehends
That a comedy won't
Win Best Picture, but don't
Count them out. Who will win? That depends.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Nick the Nicker's a damned lucky chap,
Who's had chance or good fortune or hap.
He's lost blood from the knife
In his tum, not his life.
Will he learn from this mishap, poor sap?

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A thing that's perceived auditorily,
With attention or just desultorily,
Is anything heard
From a work to a word —
Or a sermon that warns purgatorily.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
A lab Project code-named Manhattan
Sparked fission (atomic) so that in
The U of Chicago
Down went the embargo
On weapons with power to flatten.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
The clavichord, strings lightly strung,
Has expressiveness greatest among
All the keyboards, resembling,
Through aftertouch, trembling
Soft voices, as though notes were sung.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Today, my dear cat I interred,
But her death should have never occurred.
Neighbors caused me this grief;
Fed her tainted raw beef.
Later, "tongue got your cat"'s what I heard.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
All-American boy, squeaky-clean,
That was Fabian, fresh on the scene
In the '50s. He sought
More control so he bought
Out his contract at only 18.

limerick_list.author: Fleur De Lim
limerick_list.text:
Our dry-cleaner, Peter, would tout:
"There's no stain that I cannot get out!"
If the chemicals failed,
Good old scissors prevailed...
Pete's a man of his word, there's no doubt!

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
First, open your toothbrushing kit.
Use some toothpaste and rub on that grit.
Then gargle (that's slosh
Antiseptic) to wash
Out your mouth and your tonsils. Now spit.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
When our city was under attack,
We built walls and installed heavy flak.
All this fortifying went
Just as well as we'd meant,
And the enemy never came back.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
I've been sinful—but that's all reversed.
In the Decalogue now I'm immersed.
I'll be pure as the snow!...
"No adultery?" Whoa.
Let's address "graven images" first.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
My friend Bud had a girlfriend quite dear,
But with poor taste in drinking, I fear.
I said, "Bud, it is wiser
For you to advise her
To change to a more worthwhile beer."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Can you synchronize tempos with no
Interruptions?  We need a smooth flow
Between songs."  "Watch me cue up
A track—line the two up
So they're beat-matched.  Voila!  I'm a pro."

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
In the hammer event, a guy's throw
Gave the fans a fine aerial show.
His wild screams rent the air
As it howled through his hair —
But the tosser just wouldn't let go.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
"My life," said the bug, "is bucolic,
Because I am ametabolic.
I'm not rearranged,
My form is unchanged.
Metamorphosis? No!  I just frolic."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Dar al-Islam "where Moslems may gaily
Make obeisance to God five times daily"
Is a wolf in sheep's garb:
All the world's Dar al-Harb
Sans Sharia — ask any Israeli.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Cunningness, slyness, duplicity—
These are traits I despise!" cries Felicity.
"I've found falsehood uncouth
Since the days of my youth.
I prize honesty, truth, authenticity."

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
It's a fiddly and finicky job
To be filleting woodcock or squab,
So I've baked a male swan
With some maize meal put on —
Back to basics, it's corn on the cob.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm dizzy, I'm sore and uneasy.
I'm feverish, headachy, queasy,
With cramps in my gut,
And a pain in my butt.
Guess I'm feeling a little diseasy.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
The Absolute: what do we feel
From the Absolute? Not a great deal.
Our emotional scenes
Are directed by genes,
And such things are not theirs to reveal.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
I'm advancing a term to behold
For the state of things said to be old.
Join archaic and -ity
And then my committee
To get this archaity told.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I once saw a cliff in a park
Of obsidian, glassy and dark.
Its Apache-shed tears
Were the best souvenirs.
"Don't take them!" the rangers would bark.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An albatross killing occurred,
And the mariner's penance? Absurd!
But his great-great-great-great-
great-great-grandaughter's fate?
Her name's Björk and she too wore a bird.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Why a drop-down list? What a damn pain,
And its use here is clearly inane.
Still it's scroll down I must
(Though the effort's unjust)
To locate and select the state Maine.

limerick_list.author: Gumby and Sella Turcica
limerick_list.text:
On the stage, ballerinas chassé;
They plié, pirouette, and jeté.
But they'll never go far
Without time at the barre.
(It's for practice, not drinks, in ballet.)

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
It dries on the beach, soft and smelly,
But boils up to an odourless jelly.
Seaweed seems an ironic
Aphrodisiac tonic,
Sold flaccid, in tins at the deli.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
I'm disinterested — that is to say
There's no impact on me either way.
I won't feel any pain
Or receive any gain.
It's no skin off my nose if you're gay.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I am seventy-nine," declared Katie,
"But my age doesn't seem at all weighty.
You ask why I feel youthful?
Because, to be truthful,
My beau's a year older: he's eighty!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"What house coal will do for a price
That is usual": this cryptic clue's nice!
And who would pay more
Than the going rate for
Their fuel to 'go in grate' — twice?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is right to feel fear as one nears
The school where they train bombardiers.
One might hear a loud plop
From the bombs that they drop
After drinking a couple of beers.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Their top 40 hits? 36!
They sang about surf, cars, and chicks.
The Beach Boys I play
On my iPod each day,
'Cause I must get my fun music fix.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Some Hebrews considered defections
From Moses and voiced their objections:
"The Red Sea's in the way."
"So divide it, and yea,
Then we won't have to stop for directions."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My Aunt Martha attempted to mug me.
So, OK, she just wanted to hug me.
But her breasts (bales of cotton),
And her breath (rank and rotten),
Made me wish she would nevermore bug me.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
The concept of extraterritoriality
Implied 'outside the host State's locality';
It was thought that, by right,
An embassy's site
Was a part of the State of nationality.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cosmeticized lady is "painted,"
An adjective hinting of "tainted."
I dated one looker:
My mother mistook her
For being a hooker and fainted.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
With a grip on their cash that's draconian,
And tighter than any chelonian,
They will count every bean
Up in old Aberdeen —
A Scots byword for "mean": Aberdonian.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When the mirror above us first cracked,
All the demons of darkness attacked.
They've absorbed all the light
With an orb black as night,
Leaving naught to reflect nor refract.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
When my dad filched the treats from my basket,
My mom came nigh blowing a gasket.
Jelly beans, chocolate eggs?
Why, they somehow got legs.
Had he gobbled them all? Please don't ask it.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
What's an equinox? Think about light;
When the length of time taken for night
Equals that of the day.
Twice a year this holds sway.
In the spring and the autumn? That's right!

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
I dreamed that I heard the Lord mumble,
"I'll not make their edifice crumble.
But ten to one-twenty,
I think that that's plenty
To keep those cosmologists humble."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I hear you'll be leaving us soon, Yun,
Thrown out of our Catholic union.
Henceforth shall you be
Excommunicate, see,
Never more to take holy communion.

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Renée Fleming: the beauty and grace
Of her acting, her figure and face,
And her flexible voice
Make this diva my choice.
Among singers, she merits first place.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
A backbreaker's not for the weak,
But for wrestlers with manly physique,
 Like when Hulk Hogan's spine
 Is bent back to align
With the knee of the great Iron Sheik.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
This animal here's a g-nu,
The g-nicest of all in the zoo!
The staff named him Ben;
He is happiest when
A-g-nother one comes into view.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Once considered a measure to quell a
World famine, the tiny chlorella—
An alga to feed
Populations in need—
Can't escape, as it's lacking flagella.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Max's mum gives advice in a maxim,
So her counsel will usually tax him.
Saying "Don't spill the beans,"
She explains that it means
"Keeping mum". Then she silently whacks him.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Do his limericks fill you with glee?
Do you giggle, guffaw, and tee-hee?
Is he tops in your eyes?
Does he win your first prize?
Well, his verses do nothing for me!

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A command line is something you type
To control your computer — the hype
Is it lets you do tasks,
Like selection with masks,
And concatenate steps with a pipe.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When your symptoms (psychotic) abound,
Medication can bring you around.
If no other drug works,
Then (in spite of its quirks)
Try some clozapine—best drug that's found.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Tony's earphones were new and exotic.
When I spurned them, he thought me neurotic,
But I'm deaf in one ear.
Half the sound I won't hear
Because stereo's always diotic.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm the head of the board of trustees
At a dairy.  My main expertise
Is production of this:
Whopping great wheels of Swiss.
It's no wonder I'm called "The Big Cheese."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That's no diamond; they scammed you—that's rough;
California has loads of the stuff.
It's colemanite, moron,
A prime source of boron.
Take my word; I'm a Death Valley buff.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Dining tables can aid hospitality,
Seating parties with fitting formality.
But the leaf that extends
Has a case of the bends…
Golden arches have more commonality.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
"We are sticks meant to beat you at will
And an axe with the power to kill;
We're a symbol of might,
Be it wrong, be it right,"
Said the fasces back then, and now still.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I use basswood, and wield a sharp knife;
I carve rustic-style, based on real life.
As I cut, chip, and pare,
This one gives me a scare —
It begins to resemble my wife.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Name a bloom to which bumblebees flock,
That is purple or red," challenged Doc,
"And will open quite soon
(In the late afternoon)."
"California," I said, "four o'clock!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Among my most cherished pursuits
Is examining juvenile newts.
They are swift, so be deft
Should you snatch a wet eft,
As "slipp'ry when wet" none disputes!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was caught one hot day unawares:
Debilitation so sudden it scares.
I was weak, all worn out,
The result of, no doubt,
Hauling anvils up ten flights of stairs.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Oh, we come from so many a place.
See the website's world map. On its face:
The whole world, pinned with flags,
Which we use there as tags,
Shows where each of us comes from, our base.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Many camcorders capture DV,
On a hard disk or cards like SD.
Your recordings of Bridget'll
Linger on Digital
Video; no-one'll see.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Reentry from space might get hot.
Are the governing laws—I forgot—
Aerothermodynamic?
Will the tiles, all ceramic,
Do what they're designed for or not?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You found oil; now you're drilling a well,
And the drill rig you're using is swell.
Though the rig's not too big,
Man, that drill bit can dig;
It can drill down to China—or Hell!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've had many a peak and a trough;
Now the critics all cavil and scoff
At the sculptures I make
(The male sex organs break).
My new statue? It doesn't come off.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Dental calculus formed on the teeth
Of my non-brushing roommate, named Keith.
Now he "integrates" food
That's already been chewed;
To the Tooth Fairy Keith did bequeath.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I am so hot and bothered, it's true,
And you blindly ask, "What's eating you?"
That big pot has me stressed.
At this feast, I'm the "guest,"
So the question's not what, rather who.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Excruciating: here is the goss —
"In the Gospel's the pain of our Boss.
Beyond words His affliction,
So this Crucifixion
Gave rise to this word." Makes me cross.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
"The core of the problem's the apple,"
Mused Adam to Eve. "Let's get Snapple
To juice it and sell it.
If Eden's gone, hell!  It
Beats blaming that serpent in chapel."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Though his name might suggest it, I trust
That the coal tit's not covered in dust.
Like his cousin the blue tit,
This much-paler-hue tit,
Though tiny, is still upper crust.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What's four-footed? Well, first I'd say lambs,
Plus that cane (built for balance) of Gram's.
Add your average chair,
Then there's Sonny and Cher.
Last but least, there's one-third dozen clams.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
John set out to end Benjamin's life
Having learned that Ben slept with his wife.
Though it clearly sounds odd,
It's the truth, swear to God:
John went gunning for Ben with a knife.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A squirrel's chiropodous—see?
Hand-like paws help him cling to a tree.
But his scaling demands
Overreach human hands,
Which are all that the Lord's given me.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the First World War, Germans, by gosh,
Were called by their enemies "boche."
And the painter, Hieronymus,
Wasn't anonymous—
Bosh! That's a rumor I'd quash!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The garden's a special place where
Folks receive neurosurgical care.
The name's somewhat unkind;
It was coined, you will find,
To reflect all the "vegetables" there.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A sperm cell is coming to greet
Lady egg cell (a female gamete).
Reproduction in mind?
Yes, they must be combined;
By herself, she's a tad incomplete.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
In the southwest of France, there it sits:
The exquisite resort Biarritz.
By the Bay of Biscay
Women languidly lay
In the sand, showing off their great tans.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a site in this travel brochure:
Ovum City. Some entrepreneur
Has stacked eggs to the sky
In a pile a mile high.
That's an eggs aggeration, I'm sure.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
A beltway's a very fast road—
Except when the traffic has slowed.
(Ay, there's the rub.)
It encircles the hub
In a loop, where each exit's a node.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Rain came down in a forceful cascade,
And it ruined the plans we had made.
I discovered—make note—
Why they call this a float
When the rainstorm assailed our parade.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Centre parting: the look for my hair —
I divide down the middle with care;
Then I comb to each side.
An old movie's my guide:
It's the style Groucho Marx used to wear.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
That rodent, the chubby agouti,
Thinks painting her face is a duty.
She's sure she is lusher
With lippy and blusher—
She obsesses somewhat about beauty.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Your boatmanship's great! You'll go far.
Under you, that sweet ketch handled yare.
But a barque, at your hand,
Ran ashore on the strand.
Guess your shipmanship's—well—below par.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Aetites can ease childbirth pain.
To ensure you don't labour in vain,
Strap it onto your arm:
It will work like a charm.
It's best taken with salt (just a grain).

limerick_list.author: surrealmonk
limerick_list.text:
An astomous man thought a while
To come up with a way he could smile.
Since the man had no mouth,
His plans all went south,
So he thought he'd give handshakes a trial.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
Not a vase in good shape could be found.
Children crase things; they're rash; they astound.
Fragile objects can break,
Splinter, crack, by mistake—
Just get broken—when kids are around.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Roger, my uncle who boxed,
Now has skin that is blemished—it's foxed.
And I wonder if it's
Due to all those hard hits
Or the times that from gin he detoxed.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I'm brunching on brisket (or breast):
Not the part of the cow I like best,
But some meat-stealin' thief
Made me yell, "Where's the beef?"
By absconding with all of the rest.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm so happy that life is forever,
That the end will come long after never.
There's no finiteness — joke!
I am not gonna croak.
Oh, I will? Well, okay then, whatever.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Each currency stands for its nation,
And each nation has some expectation
That it be not defaced
Mutilated, debased,
Or disgraced by cocainization.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
The absence of water won't trammel
The "ship of the desert", the camel.
Its food turns to fat
Turns to water — like that!
It's a truly remarkable mammal.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
To polish the cogs for a clock,
I have moulded some emery rock.
Some grit and a binder
Will form a nice grinder
To make a reminder. Don't mock!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Some backfriends might stand at your back
And defend you from dastards' attack,
But far more would pretend
To be sweet — a true friend,
While betrayal is really their knack.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Party leadership's known for excelling—
Their procedures long-proven, compelling:
Aligning all factions
With back room transactions,
But the Texas contingent's rebelling.

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
The dowagerism of Mary—
Rich widow of Herbert, then Harry—
Commands our respect,
And you'd be quite correct
If you found the old broad a bit scary.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Grrl Power: The Show is a hit—
It sparkles with drama and wit!
So I cried out, "Bravo!"
But the star said, "No, no—
It's brava, you misogynist git!"

limerick_list.author: democritus_3
limerick_list.text:
It is clear, and it makes me euphoric;
It is clear that to be anaphoric
A phrase's condition
Must include repetition.
It is clear this rhyme's not metaphoric.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Chicot is our very next word.
It's a name in a title, I've heard,
Of a famed Dumas story.
Chicot hasn't glory—
He's the jester to Henry the Third.

limerick_list.author: geekwraith
limerick_list.text:
In stock market trading you dabble,
And treat all your clients like rabble.
When they find out your ruse
And the shouting ensues,
It will not sound like words, but just babble.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"You're a link in the chain.  It's been shown
That, although it's not your fault alone,
Your contributory hitch
Is a 'cause but for which'
He'd be fine: causa sine qua non."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Gross-out humor elicits disgust
In most people who view it.  It's just
So repulsive.  My son
And his friends find it fun.
For the films geared toward them, it's a must.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
You're conversant enough to critique,
And to speak with a certain technique.
When conversance is yours,
Then your confidence soars —
But shun topics on which you are weak.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
A chemistry student at Bristol
Grew a perfect, symmetrical crystal;
But his prism was struck
By a hammer — tough luck!
So he shot himself dead with a pistol.

limerick_list.author: John Weigel
limerick_list.text:
Any New World amphibian key
Includes ambystomatidae.
O, great salamand-
er, horizons expand,
In your swamp, perish not, but live free!

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
I have eau de toilette on my wrists.
I don't like it, but wifey insists.
When I'm left on my own,
I don't wear light cologne,
But with her I'm assaulted with mists.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My cortical rhythm behaves,
With its basal electrical waves,
Like a cortex that's firing
With musical wiring
Acquired in the '80s—at raves.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Brenda Sue is now pregnant, alas,
And I feel like a dummy, first class.
"When you're having your fun,
Use a condom, my son,"
Said my dad. "Always cover your ass!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
After sawing the logs into balks,
We'll be cutting the planks to the chalks.
There's a heavy demand
For this wood at the strand,
Where they've planned to build oceanside walks.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In a cancer the changes are drastic;
The cells have become anaplastic.
They display anaplasia,
A lethal dyscrasia,
Making primitive forms, quite fantastic.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In England, the shrubbery's brushed,
But this trimming should never be rushed.
Gardeners snipping the edges
Of bushes and hedges
Must mind that the blooms not get crushed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
This apple was nice as Mutsu.
Yet, for westerners, that wouldn't do.
Chose a name less inscrutable;
Crispin's more suitable?
(That name I'll firmly eschew.)

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Sustainable, is it? And that's
A good reason to eat it? You're bats.
It's brownish, and odd,
And nothing like cod.
It's coley — you feed it to cats.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Hello," they say pertly, although
Each one of them loathes him, their foe.
Looks can't kill, just as well.
Lest you blurt "go to hell",
Our advice: stay alert; say "Hello."

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
What an arrogant, bigheaded pain!
So pretentious, immodest, and vain!
Your presumptuous show
Is absurd; you should know
That on top is where I shall remain!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
In our living room, right over there,
Stood a British antique drunkard's chair.
Deep and wide, this chair came
From Queen Anne's time.  A shame
The thing broke from my fat derriere.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Our ambitious young district attorney
Set out on a crime-busting journey;
Alas! it was crime
Did the busting, this time:
That's him over there on the gurney.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
The flow rate, in soil, or filtration
Is found from a simple equation:
Darcy's linear law—
There's  a single small flaw;
It must fail for increased permeation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For her gingerbread house we had itched;
Then the sorceress made us bewitched.
Now with Hans in a cage,
I get minimum wage
Till inside her own oven she's pitched.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
I'm afraid of my mother's reproach;
Lost her pin (it's a decorative broach).
I have failed, though I tried,
To confess and confide.
But I can't find a broach broaching coach.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Splintered glass, burnt-out wrecks still alight!
Cratered roads, shell-pocked houses indict
Mankind's hostile intent.
We should really lament
That this debris is sadly our plight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Could daffodil garlic taste good
In a pasta sauce? Maybe it would,
As it's garlic from Naples,
And one of their staples
Is pasta—it hasta—it should!

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
For my birthday, they pimped my old ride;
This customized van is my pride.
Its bordelloish theme
And ornate colour scheme
Leads to lots of hot-rodding inside.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
My old lady, last night, raised a din.
She said what I ate was a sin.
I dined on a salad—
Even that wasn't valid!
So what if the dressing was gin?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
This "jive talk" is just a device,
But a word to the wise should suffice:
No one's buying your blaccent,
This "hip" ghetto accent.
Why should they? You're whiter than rice!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a round anatomical part
At the end of a bone (or its start).
One capitulum sits
On your humerus. It's
Not that funny when hit—it can smart!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Eastern cottontails sport bobbin' funny tails,
But here's one of my not-quite-so sunny tales:
See that hawk in the sky?
He maintains a sharp eye,
And then aims for their hoppin' white bunny tails.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Coleslaw is cabbage that's shredded;
In mayonnaise sauce it's imbedded.
I'll make up a batch
For the archery match
Or when out to a picnic I'm headed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I recall Stu McGrue's prosecution
For a criminal act (prostitution).
He was guilty, but he,
Thanks to me, copped a plea.
Restitution—my brilliant solution."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A flare on our sun? Quite routine.
There's a brightness increase on my screen
From the visible light
And UV. It is quite
A small part of the sun in this scene.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My new physics text's hard, barely readable.
It says here there's a speed not exceedable.
Amazingly so,
It seems nothing can go
Any faster than light; it's unbeatable!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The curriers worked dressing leather
Near the tanners, all sheltered from weather.
But the tannery drench
Made one helluva stench
In the curriery; too close together.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
To play physical sports is my bane;
An observer is what I'll remain.
No bad leg cramps for me—
I'll watch games on TV
And make eye-strain the way that I strain.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
You are playful today, my señora:
When you pounced, you knocked off my fedora.
Now your fingers, I see,
Are almost touching me . . .
Hey, quit it! You're tickling my aura!

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
Crossing Niagara Falls with a brolly
Is an action of consummate folly.
Yet Blondin succeeded,
By fear unimpeded,
And thought the experience jolly.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Once, in Rio, and flaunting bravado,
Swapping coins for a local cruzado,
I then entered a store
That sold fresh fruit galore
Where I purchased a HUGE avocado.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
I said "would"? I meant "wouldn't". My bad.
I'm correcting my words. I'm so glad
That my peeps will stay strong.
They all know right from wrong.
I just had to amend. Wink, wink, Vlad.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Seeking justice, I started a dharna
On a street in Bulgaria (Varna),
But the Roman who'd canned me
Did not understand me—
He thought I was praying to Carna.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"He's filthy and stinks; where's he been?"
"That's our drag man, the last to ride in,
After hours trailing steers.
By the time he appears,
There's a thick crust of dust on his skin."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
To denuclearize is my goal.
Love of nukes robs a man of his soul.
Yes, disarm — have no qualms!
Let's get rid of the bombs!
When they're gone, we'll stay safe and be whole.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
There once was a frog in a bog
Who was handy with wood and a cog.
He said, "Digital clock?
LCD I just mock;
All I need is a watch, analog."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Around me, a playing card swirled,
A frolicksome grin then unfurled.
It's an Alice-in-Wonderland,
Life-rent-asunder and
Topsyish-turvyish world!

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A dockyard is where they build ships
Or repair them whilst up on the slips.
There was once nothing finer
Than a great ocean liner,
But since aircraft they've been in eclipse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
From the New World it came, not from Tonga,
And it's neither the rumba nor conga.
With flute and not tuba,
This music's from Cuba—
The sound that is called the charanga.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
I believe that it's time I anoint
A mechanic who won't disappoint,
For my current's a pain
Who has failed to maintain
My car's constant velocity joint.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What is dowral? The wealth in your dowry.
Don't expend it on gowns, gilt and flowery,
As its aim is best served
When the cash is reserved
For a day that is rainy or showery.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Shrieking gale, squeaking snail, howling owl?
Nay! The sounds from the jail, all that growl,
Screech, and scream: gallows' noose,
Creaks and squeaks, swinging loose—
It's an eerily frightening howl.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
When a team needs a score, first of all,
A dropkick would not be the call,
As that play's now unsound
Since the ball isn't round,
In my country's  great game of the fall.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The auger can bore a neat hole,
Which I've proven on plank and on pole.
But to moles, proudly showing
This tool, is like going
To Newcastle carrying coal.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
Such great heat! But one never sees light
As the acolytes loyally fight
For their gurus. Their foes
Are despicable schmoes
Who are sinful but sad in their spite.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
They walked an Irregular beat;
Slipped through London on urchinate feet.
Though Sherlock is gone,
Their image lives on,
In Baker (they're named for the) Street.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Again you pronounce as a-GAIN.
You mind gaps when you're boarding a train.
You keep tyres in your boot,
And at my words you hoot.
Yeesh, your Englishness drives me insane!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I study the bigfoot, and yes,
Search for yetis, I'll have to confess;
Yet I make no apology
For cryptozoology
As I search for the beast in Loch Ness.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
He tells lighting he sees a reflection
Backstage, from the scenic projection.
His actors can't act
But he fancies as fact
He's on track for awards in direction.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In planning our wedding, Joe's idle,
Thinking all the expense should be bridal.
But I fear with a chill
If my dad foots the bill,
Then the banquet will be barmecidal.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
See how slowly the stretch limo drags
With its cargo of drunk, dolled-up hags.
They are out on a hen night
(A leer-at-the-men night)
In a pink-painted "bucket-o-slags".

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
When poor Einstein could not get to sleep,
He would try to count relative sheep,
But they wouldn't stand still
In his visions until
He taught them his new quantum leap.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dalmatians are white with black dots—
Dogs that live in unusual spots.
In the firehouse, they're pets;
It's as good as it gets.
They get love, food, and exercise—lots!

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
He swaggers, the brash cockalorum,
A braggart bereft of decorum.
Though in size he's not much,
His opinion is such
That alone he's enough for a quorum.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Expressed by the verb "to embrace",
It's a meaning that leaves little trace
In the writings of men.
Should we use it again
Or leave complex alone in its place?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When your car requires bulletproof glass,
You expect to be pushing up grass.
Soon enough they'll get in
When defenses grow thin,
And you don't have a bulletproof ass.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Copywriter? I am, but implore
You, I'm not just a hack, I'll be more.
I am keeping this gig
Till I hit it real big:
There's a screenplay inside my top drawer.

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
An amphibium's strictly passé.
But the animal's not gone away:
It still does what it oughter
On land or in water.
It's just that the word's démodé.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
If your eyelashes, dear, get too fluttery,
That's not wise.  It can signify sluttery.
If your flutter's not brief,
You may come to some grief,
As male thoughts become tawdry and guttery.

limerick_list.author: matthewg
limerick_list.text:
Amicus is Latin for "friend."
In a courtroom, its meaning will bend.
It's a brief by some smarty
Who's not the suit's party
But cares how the trial will end.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My Karl was a real kinky creep
Who would dry-beat me, making me weep.
Well, the last time he tried it
I couldn't abide it.
Tonight, with the fishes, he'll sleep.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
My eyesight is dimmish (that's dim).
The prognosis is guarded (that's grim).
It's depressing  (that's sad).
I feel hopeless (that's bad).
It has robbed me of vigor (that's vim).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A calculable number is one
You determine, when reckoning's done,
By enlisting the aid
Of a boy in third grade
Who's a math whiz—your eight-year-old son.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The beams of a ship, made of wood,
Stretch from starboard to port, understood?
I once built me a ship.
It was yar—a real pip!
They supported the decks for me good.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Need a doctor? Just try one of these.
Some are real, some are fake, all will please:
Welby, Dre (He's a doc?),
Watson, No, Seuss, and Spock.
Pick the one that best treats your disease.

limerick_list.author: Comicoffee
limerick_list.text:
After cocktails, my friend and his floozy
Got rather obnoxiously boozy.
They started to dance
On our couch (with no pants!)
And then, naked, defiled our jacuzzi!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
How the hell can a pelican fill
All that space that he finds in his bill?
Gobbling fish by the bucket,
Does he ever say, "Forget it,
I'm just tired and too over-the-hill?"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Master P, all the homies and cronies
Think it's wack that you fox-trot with phonies.
But your dancin' is hot,
And it's takin' a lot
Of that ballroom to hold your co . . . urage.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The word drevil means "nincompoop, fool,"
And means "drivel" as well.  As a rule,
Writing language that's civil,
I use  nonsense for drivel,
Since drivel can also mean "drool."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Viewed by some as a reason for mirth,
It is felt by each nation on Earth;
A power hypnotic
Breeds love patriotic
For the fatherland: land of your birth.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
If there's one thing old leaders enjoy,
It's to send out, position, deploy
Their young soldiers at night
Who are ready to fight
And engage in a seek and destroy.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In late autumn the galacking starts
For those folks 'round these parts with the smarts.
They've learned florists demand
Shiny galax at hand
For the contrast its leafage imparts.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
This corn syrup's glucose, I'm sure,
Which is almost entirely pure.
And because it costs less,
We'll use HFCS
While the tariffs on sugar endure.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We use countercathexis to block
Weird desires that would otherwise shock:
If my uncontrolled id
Craves a squid, God forbid,
It's rebuffed with no need to take stock.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Our window box blossoms are pink.
That geranium color, we think,
Comes from blushing, you see.
Tipsy gals might agree.
Let's toast cranesbill and ladies that drink!

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
It's a worry for Jonahs like me,
But the sub offers no guarantee
That a deep-plunging dive
Lets the crew stay alive —
So I'll just have to weight and then sea.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Without weapons, ol' Bob will  pursue
A raving mad rhino or  two.
But sweet Sue, with a sob,
Discombobulates Bob —
He's all flustered — "So what do I do?"

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
Save room for the entree; don't fill
Up on food from the salad bar. Still,
Since your listening's nil,
I expect that you will,
And dessert's sure to leave you quite ill.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
This bistro is famous and fabled,
But our dining plans have to be tabled:
Its food is divine,
And I don't mean to whine—
I just called and its phone is disabled.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
I had been in a heated discussion,
Which was rapidly bringing a blush on,
When my friend yelled, "Chill out,
What's this fuss all about?
Just be cool, man, and chill—put the shush on!"

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
It turned out that my girlfriend was fecund;
When her father found out, marriage beckoned.
Since then, for my sins,
We've had eight pairs of twins—
That's a dozen more kids than I'd reckoned.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
With extreme peaks of volume resounding
From a sound system endlessly pounding,
Its hearers won't panic
If headroom (dynamic)
Improves its full output. Astounding!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Lord, the lengths to which parents have gone!
For their two-year-old daughter, named Dawn,
Tom and Tess, to impress,
Bought a babyhouse! Yes!
What I wonder is, who mows the lawn?

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Digesting a rump roast or two
Or swallowing grilled bacon stew
For those who are acholous?
Truly mirackelous!
Bile makes it easy to do.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I love singing, but can't take the drone
Of our priest, who's monotony-prone,
Cantillating each Sunday.
I'm hoping that one day
He'll get us a cantor, on loan.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Calorescence occurs when you shine
Only infrared light on the tine
Of a fork and it glows.
This experiment shows
We made long wavelengths short by design.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Is a bean caper crime using beans?
Not a bit of it; here's what it means:
It's an Eastern Med. tree,
And its flowers can be
Used for capers—they've similar genes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Want to study with brand new computers,
Close to home?" ask the smiling recruiters,
"Then you ought to acknowledge
Your community college
That caters to needs of commuters."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
They were backing up files when it went.
He'd a hunch just a third had been sent.
Said Richard to Rose,
"The hard drive just froze.
Now's the winter of our disk content."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Boy, that last guy got plenty of yuks.
Now I watch as my act self-destructs.
Picking up the baton,
I was next to go on.
Damn that heckler: "Your comedy sucks!"

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
If I'd go exploring for ore, I'd
Choose cryolite. Years past I swore I'd
Exploit it as flux,
And cart off in big trucks
My aluminum sodium fluoride.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
"A capital H stands for heat?"
"Not heat, but a term we'll now treat:
Its name came upon us
Through Kamerlingh Onnes;
Enthalpy's no heat, I repeat!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
He's an untethered hound on the loose.
"We've a mission!" "Too bad. No excuse."
He's planning a takeover,
Forcing a makeover —
Co-opting our troops for his use.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The shadow he left is long-cast.
His societal impact was vast.
He belongs to the ages,
On history's pages,
Indelibly part of the past.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What I witnessed," Ms Browning said, frowning,
"Was drownage—I saw someone drowning.
Thought that kid in the pool
Was just acting the fool,
And not choking—just joking,  just clowning."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
There's an old term returning today:
Cryptogamous. What plants are they?
Ones that don't produce seed,
So they've clearly no need
For conspicuous floral display.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
California. Mid-May. Humid day.
It's so foggy, you're driving astray.
Coat  your car right away
With some antifog spray.
In a jiff you'll find UCLA.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Down an endoscope doctors can peer
While the end through your body they steer.
For culdoscopy, you'll
Need the culdoscope tool,
Redesigned by a fine engineer.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
From a lifetime as foole, he rebels:
"I don't want to be funny!" he yells.
"He's a jester," said Pat,
As she noticed his hat.
"You can tell by the ol' cap and bells."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Diarrhoeic infirmity hits!
And again! He has feverish fits
Which are energy-draining
And underwear staining.
His caboose? Fast and loose. It's the pits.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Distinguishable wording is readable;
On this gravestone, the message is heedable:
"Balanced diet's the key!
Live till ninety, like me
(Though past eighty, you may not be breedable)."

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
We've had to re-route the N3
Through a farm where the cattle run free.
The bull was sedated,
His field excavated—
The bull dozed. We bulldozed his tree.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
He's audacious, his bold derring-do's
A big hit with the ladies who choose
Him as #1 stud,
While they chew on their cud,
And signal approval with moos.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"The decidua—nature's designing
As pregnancy's uterine lining—
After birth leaves the womb
In a bloody red plume."
"Please curtail this discussion; I'm dining!"

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
In a room at the end of the hall,
Bluebeard's wife (number seven) found all
Of the previous six
Highly moribund chicks.
She herself had a very close call.

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
My limerick has me distraught.
Line four's where I start to get caught
In a paradox vile:
Line five is true, while
Line four, above-mentioned, is not.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Fare thee well ["bene vale" means that in
My old abbey's habitual Latin],
Blessed Virgin [they here go
"Beata" then "Virgo"];
I have sung you my very last matin.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Say, what could be herein amiss?
I offered to give you a kiss.
Princely form you decline?
Well, you're no love of mine.
A frog I will gladly dismiss.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Either madam or pimp they are not,
Or a guy punching tickets a lot.
Diplomatically though
When ambassadors blow,
Then the chargé d'affaires takes the spot.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
A homeopath takes the view
Ten dilutions are stronger than two.
Does he think I'm a mug?
There'll be less of the drug
Than there will of the jugs it's been through.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Any complementizer like that
In "I know that your wife's an old bat"
Introduces a clause
Without comma or pause.
Now you know, keep it under your hat.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Near Sumatra, a bright  lad named Tommy
Called out, in great angst, to his mommy:
"Quick, Mom! Let's leave Aceh!
Don't pack your Versace.
We're going to get a tsunami!"

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
She considers bad manners a sin,
And is stern about whisky and gin.
One can swiftly appease
Her, though—smile and say please,
And she'll biddably let you come in.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Poor driver! He's feeling abashed
'Bout the fenders he's dented and smashed.
Now he dials 9-1-1;
It's so easily done
With the phone that he held when he crashed.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Young Goldilocks, 'bout whom you've read,
Had lain down, when she jumped up and said:
"It's set me to giggling,
My mattress is wriggling,
Some bawdy's been jiggling my bed!"

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
A damsel I met (fair to see)
Confessed, in distress, "I must flee!"
Bending knee to her need,
I offered my steed.
Then she galloped away without me.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A joke I would never expect
To disturb all my fans, to deject
Them (to make them feel sad),
Made them cry. Now I'm mad—
My career as a comic is wrecked!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
When you air seal your house it's essential:
A blower door checks residential
Air changes per hour
By noting fan power
At fifty pascals differential.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Gene frequency basically means
How often particular genes
Show up in a group.
It's not really pea soup—
Just a subject in science-type zines.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
A slur is a double-edged sword
And many a sad mouse has roared
When cut with that blade.
Ancipital trade
In insults brings zero reward.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
On the Champs-Élysées, and it's silly,
The air's algid—that means kind of chilly.
Are the goosebumps I get
From the wind and the wet,
Or from sweet nothings whispered by Guilly?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In the rag trade, garmentos abound,
Toting yard goods and schmattas around.
The old District's declining,
Farming out, realigning:
Anxious vets keep an ear to the ground.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My husband's employment is gainful.
I'd never be rude or disdainful,
But he earns his rewards
By swallowing swords—
That's algesiogenic; it's painful!

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
From Byblos came spatulas, plates
With intriguing linguistical traits.
Byblic babble defies
All decipherment tries:
To hieratic, it maybe relates?

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
At the office, the air, no sweet breeze
But a dust-laden mess, made me wheeze
Till I got emphysema.
But Aglaonema
Leaves cleaned it:  I now breathe with ease.

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
"Et tu, Brute?" said Caesar, the day
That his friend threw his honor away
And destroyed Caesar's life
At the point of a knife.
A true quote?  Well, it works in the play.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
"Cost-of-living allowance? You joke!"
I replied to my son when he spoke
Of a cash-flow review:
"Three squares daily, that's true,
But I'm twelve!"—"Well, I'm forty and broke."

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
If a turbulent flight makes you gag,
Flight attendants might give you this tag:
You're an "airsickness guy."
They'd prefer you not fly,
But at least they provide you a bag.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
Welcome, ma'am. (Don't get ink on your dress.)
Here's our new-fangled cylinder press.
This inked type plate lies flat.
Here's the cylinder that
Rolls the paper across it—no mess.

limerick_list.author: Jim Macaulay
limerick_list.text:
Auto critics are ruthless as graders
Of the automobiles sold by traders.
For their words so unkind
On the models maligned,
They are labeled as "bad car beraters."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"In my other job, I'm a recorder
Of things as they happened: a sorter
Of facts from the past
From the first to the last,"
Said the waitress who wrote down my order.

limerick_list.author: The IRON(ing) Knight
limerick_list.text:
My cottaging friends often meet
In locations they hope are discreet,
Like a loo after dark
Or an underlit park,
While avoiding police on the beat.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
The appeal felt by most, I would say,
As they celebrate Presidents' Day,
Isn't national pride
For the leaders they've tried,
But a day of vacation, with pay.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
A fan of great sculptures I'm not.
They're overblown, stuffy old rot.
I'll paint silly faces
On Canova's Three Graces
To face them — I've got just one shot.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Former Celtics coach Red had just died.
"A relation?" friends asked. "Why dry-eyed?"
"Though my brother once claimed
He's our uncle (both famed
For their sports skill and red hair)—he lied."

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
The seconds, the minutes, the hours
Build a terror that over me towers.
Chronophobia's curse
Leaves me panicked and worse
As each moment my lifetime devours.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
This Adair is a very small place.
As uh-DARE, it's the name they embrace.
But a Jerry named AY-dare
In Boston held sway there:
At Fenway, he played second base.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
My old friend and I thought we'd reach fame,
So we stored, in a case, what became
Just some capsulated junk.
Ha! Today it's worth bunk.
I don't even remember her name.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Eschew mention of death, son — of ends;
Affirmation our faith recommends.
He's been gathered, this day,
To his fathers, we say."
"And to glory?" "Well, son, that depends…"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
At the service an orthodox man —
The liturgical singer — began
To believe he no longer
Could chant any stronger.
We countered: "You cantor you can!"

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
The untimely demise of our Murray:
Was that due to his bride's 'special curry'?
Just last Thursday they married;
Near this church he'll be buried.
His insurance came through, so no worry.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
As a born-again Christian explored
What his schooling had largely ignored,
He was born again; wow!
He's an atheist now,
Since he cut the, um — biblical cord.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Raymond chastised his wife, with a frown:
"Dear, these rumors are getting me down.
It's depressing to hear
That you've spent this last year
Making love to a rodeo clown."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This land's vastness is raising alarms.
We should canton it out into farms:
Scope alone is oppressive,
Overwhelming, excessive.
Divide it; they'll feast on its charms.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At Thanksgiving Mom shouted, "Dig in!
Let November's food orgy begin!"
But she's like this year 'round—
Meal for meal, pound for pound—
And insulted as hell if you're thin.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
As a fault-finder, Head takes the cake.
My seismologist job is at stake.
He both censures and scolds,
As my paycheck he holds.
Day by day I just tremble and quake!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A fly-by-night business is one
That will take all your money and run.
When you go to claim flybuys,
They're gone (said their bye-byes).
Rewards for your loyalty?  None.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Gracie purchased some rouge for her face
In a fancy and elegant place.
Here's the bill she must pay;
She's not ready today,
So she's asking for three days of grace.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The extravagantness of our spending
Is seemingly, dear, never-ending.
To me it is clear,
Thanks to lavishness, we're
On the Staircase to Poorhouse, descending.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Just in case you have harbored the notion
There's no life on the floor of the ocean —
Deep divers find squads
Of small amphipods
Entrenched in perpetual motion.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A bone that is deep in the ear
Never gets much attention, I hear.
Very small (second fiddle),
It sits in the middle,
Like New between Happy and Year.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
When disaster and shame seemed to blend,
I got help from my posh British friend:
"It looks bad, but this tosh
Will come out in the wash —
Things will sort themselves out in the end."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick and limarico
limerick_list.text:
I darted a look, to convey
To a loud-mouth, "Enough! Please don't say
Any more—you will shatter
Their dreams; doesn't matter
You think there's no magical sleigh."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Belladonna's a poison one buys;
Deadly nightshade makes sure someone dies.
Its medicinal duty
Helped a Napoli beauty:
Bella Donna, who kills with her eyes.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
For our era, disporting with speed,
Sure, dispeed is a word we should need.
But we move much too fast
To weave words from our past.
It's a pity, but how we proceed.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A plumber (and poet) was flirtin'
With censorship (very uncertain).
So he flushed the foul word
(In this case, it was turd)
To avoid being blocked by the "Curtain."

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
As a morpheme, the letters "-E-D"
Have a difference you'll hear but won't see.
Hunted, fixed, and esteemed
Are linguistically deemed
Allomorphic, in past tense, all three!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dirk's as drunk as a dog, no dispute,
Or a broom or a poet (that's cute),
As a lord or a bat,
A boiled owl, and that's that.
Nigel's British. He's pissed as a newt.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It isn't a plain adenoma,
Or benign, like my dad's angioma.
It is found in small ducts,
Which it therefore obstructs,
And it's cancerous too—cylindroma!

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Epanadiplosis can claim
To mean "first and last words are the same",
As in: Aim to tell friends
'Bout the duplicate ends
Of this sentence; again I say, aim.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Carl Philipp Emanuel Bach
Came from excellent musical stock.
His father and grampa
Did nothing to hampa
His joining the tuneful Bach flock.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Is oil in water immersant?
No, it floats. But a douche of dispersant
Turns the slick, over days,
Into sauce mayonnaise,
With which many gourmets are conversant.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
There are "bad" carbohydrates, and "good."
New potatoes, it's now understood,
Have safe amylose flow
For digestion that's slow.
I'd eat new spuds all year, if I could.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Last week, I found work as a barback,
Hauling beer and supplies from so far back
In the storeroom that day
That I heard the valet
Say, "I'm so never giving this car back."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It expresses frustration quite well; it
Reflects the pet peeves you can't quell; it
Is heard everywhere
As a sign of despair.
So then aargh! Why can't anyone spell it?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My lover conveyed this assignment:
To spring her ol' man from confinement.
When I crashed through a wall,
Pop said, "Thanks," I recall,
But my front end's now out of alignment.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
She's a funny girl havin' some fun,
With a rifle she bought for her son.
But watch out for your fanny.
Save your ass— I heard "Annie,
Get your gun, thar's a skunk on the run!"

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
I shake as I climb up the stairs.
Then my knees knock, but nobody cares.
Fear of going to bed
Is the 'pain' in my head —
Clinophobia's my fear, not theirs.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Had a spat with your sweetie? A buss
On the cheek might not end all the fuss.
Kiss her well—in your arms—
She'll succumb to your charms
And there'll be nothing more to discuss.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
While you fished with the nets you had sewed,
Ferried wares with the sea as your road,
Good behavior you saw
Was from inter-net law:
The informal Amalphitan Code.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Shearers long to cry out, "Go to hell, sheep!
I've had it now, mate! Darn, they smell, sheep!"
They await, though, the peal
Of the bell to reveal
That their shift ends with this sheep — the bell sheep.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Muscle in when your rival carouses,
Run after prohibited spouses—
Just count me out, Romeo,
I've gotta go. Me oh
My, plague on both of your houses!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
My husband cajoles me and eggs
Me to change my appearance; he begs
And blandanders each day.
Dear Ann Landers, please say
It's okay to have hair on my legs!

limerick_list.author: CherylinNJ
limerick_list.text:
I had a strong yearning to make
My grandmother's angel food cake.
Just add lots of love
Sent from Heaven above
Plus some flour and egg whites, then bake!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
My neighbor's son, two-year-old Steve,
Played Christ in our creche Christmas Eve.
Young Stevie went toddling
And peed in his swaddling.
Our Mary chewed gum, I believe.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You insist that you speak with the dead?
And my aura's a luminous red?
You were Sitting Bull's wife
In a previous life?
Aw, baloney! It's all in your head.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Bright blue azulene pigment in oil
(Not the mineral hid 'neath the soil)
Is from chamomile bowers,
And distilled from the flowers:
With its help, your skin's beauty won't spoil.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The old rite that's called  auto-da-fé
Was the heretics' grim judgment day.
Death by burning ensued.
It's now everywhere viewed
As a sign of a church gone astray.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Swim close to anemones, clown fish,
Then you stay just as safe as a brown fish.
The warm sea is made bright
By your orange and white,
And no big fish will gobble you down, fish.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He thinks that he'll study bryology,
A moss-centered branch of biology:
But by rolling some grass,
He gets stoned before class,
So he gathers no moss terminology.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
Who needs glory? The battle forsakin',
I ran all a-fearin' and quakin'—
A hero I'm not:
All the others were shot.
It's a fool who ain't savin' his bacon.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"It's now time for some simple reviews.
Whether made up of pistons or screws,
A standard compressor,"
Held forth our professor,
"Is sized by the term 'BTUs'".

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
This occurs when our government tries
To dress facts in deceptive disguise:
A credibility gap
Means they're feeding us crap,
And the truth is, we're sick of those lies.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Though the Prince found himself in the mood, he
Had to go well beyond call of duty:
He refused to critique
The morning-breath reek
He inhaled when he kissed Sleeping Beauty.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A late-blooming student named Erica
Made a typo. She wrote: "Just hysterica
Is the way that I  felt
When I learned what was dealt
The Confederate States of America."

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Old astronomers thought it was clear —
Crystal globe, the celestial sphere.
Stars in perfect rotation
Reflect God's creation,
With wandering planets quite near.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
A penillion poet of Clwyd
Wrote verses both formless and fluid.
He wanted so hard
To become the next bard,
But he blew it, that hapless old druid.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I'd grab'd that old ring, but was nabbed,
As someone obligingly blabbed.
I suppose we all know
That we reap what we sow,
So the grabber, in my case, got grab'd.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Do your cows become ill and abort,
So you fear that your herd will be short?
The vet's diagnosis:
Acute brucellosis,
Or Bang's disease, says his report.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The long-legged daddy espied her
And wondered if he could excite her.
The black widow frowned,
"Don't be hanging around.
You'll regret that I'm just a one-nighter."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A sober young shortstop, named Grieg,
Moved from minor up to a big league.
But he found that to play
For a top team each day
Made him drink to relieve the fatigue.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This highly priced table was built
With a top that is gilt and can tilt;
It's for drafting. Expensive—
I feel apprehensive,
Defensive, and sickened by guilt!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Dermabrasion is fine, I suppose,
Sanding skin from your head to your toes.
My wife Jane saw a quack
(Through the fence, round the back);
Now she's missing one ear and her nose.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our new flat is so cozily nidulated
That my wife made me jump when she stridulated.
She is normally placid,
But she screeched, "Too much acid!
My gravy's destroyed—too acidulated!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
But Ptolemy's hand-winning ace
Was, to Kepler, a kludgey disgrace:
From the equant, a place
In the middle of space,
Planets move at a uniform pace.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Electric organs in fish or in eels
Can stun prey. Hammond's versions brought squeals
From fans of legato
With wobbly vibrato
And tones spun from rotating wheels.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm in love with Lucinda's left earlobe.
It's so soft—not at all an austere lobe.
I find it endearing;
There she wears a gold earring,
So it's punctured. I feel for this dear lobe.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Said the atheist Democrat, "Geez!
The U.S. sure is feeling a squeeze
From that darn Bible Belt—
We would all be more svelte
If we just could get up off our knees!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The chinook took a look, as it swam;
"I'm a schnook! It's the Bonneville Dam!
All its monstrous concrete
Will mean certain defeat!
I'm a sorrowful salmon, I am!"

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
With the euro there's no need to frown:
It's an aid to tear borderlines down.
We've demonetized what
Was once money; the lot
Now is worthless, mark, lira or crown.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This anatomy book shows a stag
With a sac near the tail that he'll wag.
There his dowcets reside,
Neatly packed, side-by-side—
Two fine testes ensconced in a bag.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Choreographer Paula Abdul
Had the moves that made Lakers fans drool.
Now American Idol
And stardom worldwide'll
Confirm that she's nobody's fool.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
While a blinkard's a person who's slow-
Witted, stupid, obtuse, so you know—
I no longer will use
Rusty nails, pins or glues
For my hat on the days the winds blow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There's a gadget—I swear it is true—
That can actually measure the dew.
No, it's not a hygrometer,
It is called a drosometer.
How to use it? I haven't a clue!

limerick_list.author: OxfordVictor
limerick_list.text:
An agent who's general is not
Like Bond; he's no excellent shot.
He's an Aussie away
From his country; he'll say
What his state thinks of us. (Not a lot...)

limerick_list.author: Amergin and Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
Irish chieftains swore fealty as earls,
But to Bess they would always be churls.
The intent of this Tudor:
Assent that accrued her
Their lands, where her flag she unfurls.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The call "Bernie, the bolt!" used to be
Heard each week on the UK's TV.
There an on-the-spot shot
Might have got you a lot
Though an accurate aim was the key.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
The docs drilled a hole in my head.
The aperture hurt and it bled;
Then it drained and it oozed.
And suppose I'd refused?
Not to worry, they said, I'd be dead.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Don't give hairstyle advice to your boss;
It can make her incredibly cross.
"Would a 'Rachel cut' make
Me a ten?" My mistake:
"No, it wouldn't. You look more like Ross."

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
At our chic ladies' college, the foundress
Had decreed that each girl wear this brown dress;
Since the college was blessed
With her massive bequest,
We are stuck with what we call our 'clown dress'.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Many hobbyist growers are keen
On the Chinese hibiscus. First seen
In the tropics, widespread,
It has flowers bright red,
And most beautiful leaves, glossy green.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On my skin, bumps were always papillous,
Red and angry, not gray and fibrillous.
The cause of my rashes?
Exposure to ashes—
My eruptions, I found, were favillous.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
"It's abnormal, this profit we've made,
So a dividend now will be paid."
And did any applaud
This report of the board?
Not a one. To a man, they hurrayed.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You have only two choices, effectively,
Not three. You can choose one electively.
I myself would suggest
The annuity's best;
It assures a fixed income, protectively.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's a gimmick some will misconstrue,
Ted; the parody might not come through.
The most tolerant cat
Isn't ready for that,
Man. The blacking of skin is taboo.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
A blowout preventer (not "bop";
B-O-P) is a valve that's on top
Of a well full of oil,
So the oil doesn't soil
All the soil. If it fails, bring a mop.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The Brassica genus includes
Cruciferous veggies; such foods
Might help to fight cancer
(Fresh broccoli's one answer),
But cabbage in my house starts feuds.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My uncle was known for his proneness
To dress with a grubby windblown-ness.
He had little to say,
And preferred to crochet —
It's no wonder he suffered aloneness.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The cowl of an old fashioned oast
Is the feature I'm missing the most.
Almost nobody sees
Hoods that turn with the breeze,
Now a thing of the past — just a ghost.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
When it's hot, he removes all his clothes,
Which is not so bizarre, I suppose.
Then he'll oil his bod,
Which is still not too odd,
But he does the same thing when it snows.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A bum is some jerk who won't work,
An incompetent, drunkard, or shirk.
It's a vagrant, a leech,
One who lives for the beach,
Or that thing that you shake when you twerk.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I, a taphophile, trumpet my ravings
Of engravings for which I have cravings.
Those engravements?  Sublime!
I shall spend every dime
Taking rubbings; I'll use my life savings.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On my way to admire a mimosa,
I bumped an Aralia spinosa
(Devil's walking stick). Spiny,
It tore up my heinie;
It scratched both my skin and mucosa.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The young chicken, a hen, had red eyes.
And what's more, they were double the size
Of the rest in the brood.
A debate soon ensued
As to what caused this pullet surprise.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Let my stem in your fingers recline.
From a bottle of, say, Shiraz wine
Fill my bowl to the brim.
Let your gob pinch my rim.
Say santé. Taste the fruit of the vine.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
In Italy once lived a lord
With the virtuous wife he adored.
But his cold statesman's mind
Was determined to find
Subtle proof her affection was flawed.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You are wrong — that rock's not epidotic!
How dumb can you be — idiotic!
Most epidote's green —
That dumb rock's tangerine;
Are you high, on some kind of narcotic?

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Lovely Chrissie, aloof and so chaste,
Has no hurry or inkling of haste.
Of a very shy bent,
All her modesty's meant
That her loverly bloom goes to waste.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
The meek and the righteous are blessed,
They who mourn, who are pure, and oppressed,
They who seek to make peace:
May your joy never cease.
Like the salt of the earth, you're the best.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Damascus-bound Pharisee Saul
Was struck blind upon hearing the call
Of the Christ, whose instruction
Led Saul to induction
And Christian conversion to Paul.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"A term like God botherer's odd,"
I explained.  "Door to door comes your squad,
But I'm not so enticed
With you talking up Christ.
As the term implies, go bother God."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
From flexible comes the word flex
For electrical cable. The specs
Say its current stays low;
If the wire starts to glow
Then the overload flow will cause wrecks.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Gearhart
limerick_list.text:
A woman named Abigail Park,
Whose knowledge tree's missing some bark,
Thinks a flambeau's a mate
Who deceives on a date.
(It's a torch, but she's still in the dark.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bases loaded, one gone, things look grim
For the pitcher. I don't envy him.
With eight runs just this inning,
And they're only beginning,
His chances for winning look slim.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
As the time-honored Beaufort scale reads,
A fresh breeze blows at well-defined speeds,
To wit, eighteen or more,
Not above twenty-four
MPH. That'll scatter some seeds.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Now, contristate's considered passé —
A word of just slight use today.
It still means "to make sad,"
Oft for reasons so bad
Consolation won't take woe away.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Jan and Jane and Jeannette—the three Babbitts—
Have cosmetically altered their habits.
Creams and powders must be
Truly cruelty-free:
Never tested on mice or on rabbits.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Cacophonous sounds jar the ear;
They're not pleasant for people to hear.
Mix teenagers' yells,
Clanging pots, ringing bells—
Cacophony? Well, pretty near!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Kids see violence and sex more today
In the video games that they play.
Morbid images—killing
And gore—have been filling
Their minds: it's a carno buffet!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Poppa vows to teach Junior humility,
But to me it's an act of futility.
Junior's ego display
Will just get in the way.
It's beyond, I would say, conceivability.

limerick_list.author: equinox
limerick_list.text:
The czarevich (son of czar; Russian)
Got embroiled in a heated discussion
With his sis Anastasia
And might have aphasia
From czarevna-occasioned concussion.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
That couple's bemoaning their luck,
Having trouble becoming unstuck.
Though uncommonly supple,
They cannot uncouple
(His cab from the back of her truck).

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
I returned from the cheese shop in town.
"What's this gjetost?" he asked with a frown.
"It's from Norway, they say.
Made with goat's milk (the whey)."
"Oh, is that why it's startlingly brown?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Shoppers searching for alcohol find
Some that's labeled denatured—the kind
That, along with the ethanol,
Has poisons like methanol.
Those who drink it get sick or go blind.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
As I twanged on my big banjo bass
And sang (with a drawl) "Midnight Lace,"
Kip said, "Alla these vowels
Will drive me to howls.
Get your assonance outta my face."

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Although catboats have only one sail
On one forward set mast, they prevail:
So while tempests may blow,
They boldly will go
Over waves with the gale on their tail.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
An inspection by Captain McEwen
Found some traces of firebugs' doin'.
Stored weapons were burned
To a crisp, the man learned
While surveying the arsenal ruin.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With the help of my neighbor's firm ducture,
