They hang, like the ears hang from Snoopy.
I pluck off these trumpets
And give them to strumpets
Before making moves to make whoopee.

limerick_list.author: zqms and Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We learned solid and liquid and gas
Are our planet's three aspects of mass.
Also, plasma is got
When a gas gets real hot:
It's the latest to join in this class.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
No more stalls, Dad — let's put this to rest.
Who's the daughter that you loved the best
Of all six of us girls?
Was it June, with those curls —
About time you came clean and confessed!

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
She loves me, she loves me... or not.
I'm plucking this daisy a lot.
O horrors: somehow
It's apetalous now
And which was the last?  I forgot....

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
"Is it Tuesday? All day, 'less it rains."
I'm perplexed, and he almost explains:
"Just like rhyming slang's funny,
On Sunday, it's sunny.
I cant." My confusion remains.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Dublin they cherish the cherry;
The date is the darling of Derry.
They're proud of the pear
In the county of Clare,
But in Dingle they're bummed by the berry.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
You are likely to find cousin Jack
Out back by the old garden shack,
Where he locks up his bike
(While he goes for a hike)
At the sturdy grey bicycle rack.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Adding up is a good thing to ken.
Five plus five, that is ten ("BoJo's den").
Four plus three, that is seven.
1+1's not 11.
Four plus six, that will also give X.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Carneiro developed a theory:
Circumscription. His thesis (I'm leery),
Cites farming and war,
Population, and more—
Such as state evolution. Quite eerie.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
A battery in water may show
Rust on one of its poles — why's this so?
Electrodeposits
Have formed there because it's
Turned water to H2 and O.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Colonel Chovoff toured sundry locations,
From parade sites to small celebrations.
And he once gave a speech
Minus shirt at a beach,
With his chest pierced by odd decorations.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"We eat everything!" bragged Tom and Flo.
Their hostess served blackbird —go know!
Flo gulped, "Thanks for havin' us."
Tom gagged, less than ravenous,
"Well, I guess we'll just have to eat crow."

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
In a sheikdom dwells cyber-girl Jane.
Both our lives are in  fictive domain—
And the chatting is swell,
But the sexting  is hell—
So I'm catching the plane to Bahrain.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Use the bark that they call angostura
For bitters: there's no bark that's purer.
Mix with lemon and lime
For a drink quite sublime;
For the sick, it's a world-famous curer.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Discordianism: it's great.
As confusion's our state (and our fate),
We say, "All pray for chaos".
No way? Then oy vay us.
"Life is strife" — since around '58.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Fair punishment's always a show
When our classroom behavior goes low.
The teacher says candidly,
"I'll evenhandedly
Slap all your butts in a row."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The centerpiece sits on the table.
A flowered arrangement, it's able
To garner attention
And positive mention—
Till football begins on the cable.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Our great fete will be fun—also daffy,"
Laughed our affable teacher Ms Jaffe.
"It's a grand candy pulling.
Of course I'm not bulling;
We'll love making heavenly taffy."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Interbreeding occurs, as a rule,
Within species, where genes tend to pool.
But when donkey and horse
(Congeneric, of course)
Get it on and bear young, it's a mule.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I resolved my old image I'd scotch
With a makeover, carve a new notch.
So silk Y-fronts I wore
But I got rather sore:
The elastic was chafing my crotch.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
All good writers will use their own voices;
The tempo is one of their choices.
So, for better or worse,
They're controlling the verse—
It's a freedom they share—art rejoices!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"You need ground cover; here's what I mean:
Plants that spread and will keep the ground green.
My choice," said Ms Trilby,
"Is this—dwarf astilbe.
Plant plenty along the latrine."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She was earringed with no room to spare,
As was clear once she'd pulled back her hair.
Had she drained all the shops
Of their hoops, studs and drops
For this aural assortment of glare?

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
When Cockneys say "cobblers" to you,
It's nothing to do with a shoe.
Short for cobblers' awls
(Rhyming slang meaning "b*lls"),
It's an insult, you'll surely construe.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Reaching out for extended control,
We've now broadened our corporate goal,
Staffing outposts in Lhasa,
La Paz and Mombasa.
We intend to grow grander than Dole.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
"You punk kids, you are nothing but trouble,"
Said Gramps as he rubbed his gray stubble.
"What with worrying my hogs,
Throwing stones at my dogs,
Get along now — make that on the double!"

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Repetition, repeatedly, cute?
Repeatably no, not a hoot.
I'd repeat it again,
But repeating stops then
'Cause repeaters are guns.  Please don't shoot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said my agent, "Please give it your all.
This is big time, so focus.  Stand tall.
You have practiced so much,
You've got sureness of touch.
Now you've made it to Carnegie Hall!"

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
World wide web: it's a virtual ball,
And we're all of us caught in its thrall.
"Like", make "friends", shop online,
Download porn. Trolls (the swine!)
Rule the cybersphere. Click, one and all.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Jack shows grace under pressure.  He's tough;
He stays calm when the going gets rough.
One day he, when his pants split
While doing a dance split,
Kept dancing, his butt in the buff.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Where do Simon and Meshack and Dick
Fit in trios well known? Answer quick!
In the middle they enter.
They all sit in the center
Just like Larry and Melchior. Nice trick.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Alopecurus:  Foxtails, most grown
Ornamentally; some, though, are known
As vile bothersome weeds
Sprung from plentiful seeds.
These grasses' duality's shown.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Audibility doesn't belong
To a word or a noise or a song:
It depends on the ear
Lately straining to hear,
So the sense of this property's wrong.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At the toymaker's gate we'd conspired
To picket against being fired,
But they sent us a note
To disperse (and I quote):
"Sorry, some disassembly required."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
From a bulb in a pot by the wall
Sprouts a stalk, but no leaves, big or small.
Why is Bowiea reared?
Short answer? It's weird —
Green stems in a tangle. That's all.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our august enterparlance befell
A sad fate, though the venue was swell.
The topic was Farting;
Conferees were departing
Because of the…no need to tell.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
I was lost in the desert. I fretted—
Would I see you again? How I sweated.
Your sweet face is now pressed
To my strong, manly chest,
And you gasp, "God, your armpit is foetid!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
That boutefeu is fired up and delighted
At the riot he's lately incited,
Because fanning the flame
Is the name of his game,
Where the passions of crowds are ignited.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Please don't audit too closely; I swear
These accounts are true, honest, and fair.
You can sign them off here
The arithmetic's clear;
And there's nothing below the line there.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Now he's active, prepared for attack;
He's a combatant, out in Iraq.
Though he's ready for battle,
His heart's in Seattle,
With Jacqui. He longs to go back.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
What's the gist of dynamic viscosity?
It's a property—not a monstrosity—
That's nowadays reckoned
In pascal times second.
It limits a liquid's velocity.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The cyber security's lacking,
So the site is a magnet for hacking.
Yes,  healthcare.gov
Gets the wrong kind of love—
We should send its  developers packing.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My derby's a place where my cat
Likes to sit, and it's now a bit flat.
So I'll take it on down
To a man in our town
Who's an expert at blocking a hat.

limerick_list.author: HANG player
limerick_list.text:
A careless young hippie named Fred
Took his girlfriend, while stoned, to his bed.
When he rose in the morning
The wench, without warning,
Had taken his drugs and then fled.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The donatary snickered with glee,
Saying, "I am the only donee —
Cheating got the whole wad!
Bend your knees now, thank God
He applauded my fraud, as you see!"

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
He was once an accomplished commander,
And his unit could not have been grander
Till he said that his troops
All were morons and dupes,
Thus accomplishing nothing but slander.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
The Chinese say that energy flow
Matters much in the places you go.
Well, your stuff's in the way —
You've screwed up the feng shui
In your otherwise lovely chateau.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Granny answered me, "Dear, very few stockings
Thrill me at all. David, do stockings
Look, when they're blue,
Like a great-Granny hue?
They mean me when they talk, dear, of bluestockings!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Before Christ, on the Bosporus shore,
Old Byzantium grew, and knew war.
'Twas a bustling place
For the people of Thrace.
Later on, it was quite a bit more.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I should warn you, I'm solid, a rock.
Forget soft, I'm of obdurate stock.
Hard, unyielding, so please,
If you're tempted to squeeze
Me, my firmness may give you a shock!

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The duchess was in her caroche
When she screamed, "Get me out! There's a roach!"
Then she fainted away
And came to the next day.
That caroche is no longer her coach.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A pessimist sadly conceded
His hairline had sharply receded.
His wife is more bullish:
"What's left is quite fullish!"
To me, his head's bigger than needed.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Now what's next—pay for God-given air?
Just to pump up my tires? How dare...!
Then a charge just for water
Makes me get even hotter!
Do you have fifty cents you can spare?

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The ex-dividend date is the day
When my oil stock pays off. Let me say
That damn stock'd be soaring
If Dems would stop roaring.
You tree huggers? Out of the way!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Draff (or draugh, if you will) is some stuff
For your calf (it is swill). Now, the bluff:
"Draugh's a 't' short of draught."
That is duff, and it's daft.
Get my drift? It just isn't enoug!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Did a clathrate, stored methane in ice,
Form a weapon of Nature's device?
Has this gun been reloaded?
Because it exploded,
Did life pay a terrible price?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
Eighty men on the battlefield fell
And far more would soon die, you could tell.
What was gained with their blood?
A few acres of mud
And more proof of the phrase "War is hell."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
The minister's happy to marry 'em,
To send 'em wherever fates carry 'em.
They're starting to sup;
Someone poisoned their cup!
They're ingesting Ba; soon we'll barium.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I'll be throwing my hat in the muck
As your lorry replaces my truck,
And your boot holds the junk
I don't want in my trunk.
Your damn Englishness bothers me, duck!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In maternity wards women died
Because doctors infrequently tried
To keep everything clean;
Thus infections were seen.
Childbed fever was spread far and wide.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Like a dope, on occasion I go
And write tomes about things I don't know.
Then some errors are found,
And I feel that I'm bound
To retract them, and so I eat crow.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A dignified death is the key,
So my lawyer's prepared a decree.
This legal directive
Ensures my objective:
Don't dare to resuscitate me!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cloudlet's a little white puff
Made of droplets—that fluffy white stuff.
View it quickly; I fear
It will soon disappear.
For a moment it's here—that's enough.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
My alogical world-view's a winner.
There's no logic to faze the beginner.
If I throw in enough
Vague untestable stuff,
It'll eat your dull science for dinner.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
"There ain't no man can double-cross me
And then live," ranted One-Eye McGee.
"We just shook on this deal,
So if ever you squeal,
You'll be taking a dirt nap," said he.

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
What do you think you would do
With a cockapoo given to you?
Would you walk it and feed it?
Would you care for and heed it?
Would you wonder just who mated who?

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"Drop the roses and kiss me, you coward!"
She exclaimed. "Make me yield, overpowered!
Pin me down and explore!
Make me maiden no more!"
So I kissed her, hands free and deflowered.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Throughout history, common folk suffer
When a boorish cantankerous bluffer
Grabs the reins, starts a dynasty,
Reigns as a high-nasty.
When he's gruffer, that makes their lot tougher.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
From his coffin does Dracula climb.
He's arisen — it's blood-sucking time.
Metamorphosis done
Till return of the sun,
He's a bat about town in his prime.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
Chardonnay with hors d'oeuvres is just fine.
I prefer pinot noir when I dine.
But a raspberry torte
Needs a sweet tawny port;
This dessert wine's a favorite of mine.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A tornado in town represents
An unfortunate turn of events.
Newly homeless: "We're sad.
Under canvas, life's bad!"
(How ironic that term means "intense.")

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Any goal that you feel needs achieving
Takes patience and will interweaving,
As when waiting in line
Having had too much wine…
Achievement can be quite relieving.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Carnivorous folks, take a taste:
Beetles, monkey brains, octopus paste,
Fried ants with pastrami,
Fresh maggot salami,
With tapeworm pâté interlaced.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Broadway musical ticket?  You'll get a
Lovely evening of music, I'll bet—a
Chance to visit The Wiz
Or perhaps see Les Miz.
Try a modern New York operetta!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Wayne Gretsky, who played for the Kings,
Was a center beloved by his wings.
Now a humble (not cocky)
Ex-All-Star from hockey,
He's wearing four Stanley Cup rings.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In a lab under scientists' gaze
Sits a rat who's not eaten for days.
He's bewildered and lost
And will pay quite a cost
If he doesn't start wending his maze.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Be they creatures with two or four feet,
All the carnivores love to eat meat,
Whether caught on the run
Or sautéed on a bun.
At the top of the food chain's their seat.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Double eagles are made out of gold
And were worth twenty bucks, so we're told.
Since it's no longer legal
To spend such an eagle,
The price hits the roof when it's sold.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Once on Superman, hunky George Reeves
(That was George's show, mind you, not Steve's)
Found a clue and said, "This
Is adenophyllous, Miss.
You can see it has glands on its leaves."

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Mentioned Ernie while eating dessert,
"I just noticed these rather overt
Small arbuscules that grow
From our heads. Did you know
That means 'tufts of hair', Ol' Buddy Bert?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
They said I was not all that smart.
Living downstream was dumb, for a start.
But what washed down today?
More gold nuggets!  I say:
"Oh, alluvia with all of my heart!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jack Jones owns the store where I work
As an overstressed, underpaid clerk.
"Look alive!" he will shout,
Leaving minimal doubt
The abovesaid Jack Jones is a jerk!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For one corduroy wearer, a glitch is
The rustling it makes, so he pitches
His pants in a pile,
Strikes a match with a smile,
And rejoices at burning his britches.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I'm telling you AIDS does not kill!
It just signifies you are too ill
To repel the infections
That, based on projections,
Are ones that undoubtedly will.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I don't care which politicos quote it;
It's bogus, we'd never promote it.
Though you try to assure
Us the source is obscure—
It's still copied. You can't claim you wrote it.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We were rowing that night on the pond
When you called me a dishwater blond.
I'm not golden enough?
So I dumped your ass — tough!
Well, how else was a girl to respond?

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Arminius, Roman by birth,
Felt his roots in Hercynian earth.
In the North, rebel Hermann,
As warlord and German,
Fought Rome, showed his folk their great worth.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Aging spirits and wine makes 'em good,
But distillers have long understood
Some is lost. We're aware
Of dispersal to air
(Angel's share). Devil's cut's lost to wood.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
A nicely turned ankle — a pose
In a pretty, trimmed hat — it was those
That would turn a man on
In those days now long gone:
As they say, "autres temps, autres choses."

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
This cool, moving air is a treat
After stagnant and harrowing heat:
The breath that will kiss you;
That feeling of bliss you
Have missed for so long — fresh and sweet.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Coulee crickets can devastate crops,
As they hop across fields, making stops:
Climb a stalk, have a chew.
There's not much you can do,
Except hope that the temperature drops.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Sammy Davis was walking the streets
As a candyman, vendor of sweets.
"Got some nose candy, Sam?"
Asked a drug addict.  "Scram!"
Sammy yelled.  "I don't deal in those treats!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An action game may feature fighting,
Or the stealing of cars (how exciting!),
Or war scenes chaotic,
Or monsters psychotic.
I don't find this B.S. inviting.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
A small sponge left a skeletal trace
That predates any eyes. (What's a face?)
In the deeps, all unseen, a
Coronacollina
acula used spines as a brace.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
What's an aperture?  A hole in the wall?
Or a space through which insects can crawl?
A crack letting in light?
(That's in everything, right?)
Or any damn opening at all?

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
As I coughed, his expression turned weighty.
"Your lungs are a basket case, matey.
To best decongest them,
I suggest that you rest them.
Stop breathing and count up to eighty."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
See my windshield? It's made from stained glass.
In this car I hold Monday night Mass.
If such churchliness moves you,
It clearly behooves you
To give thanks in the plate that I pass.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
To make my small software biz grow,
I solve, to find where fluids flow,
Differential equations
On many occasions.
Expensive experiments? No!

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
Two forms—the same stuff: allotropical.
To say "diamond and coal" would be topical.
But "water and ice"
Or "rice pudding and rice"
Would be uses I'd call malapropical.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With this handful of abbotts (they're cheap),
I'll drift off to a permanent sleep.
Each barbiturate friend
Will assist me to end
My contemptible life, so don't weep.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Define galley slave (multiple meanings)—
First two facts culled from film and book gleanings:
(A) Old silent movie,
(B) Sci-fi tale (groovy!),
(C) Oarsman with galley oar leanings.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
From my works you may cite a small part,
Says the statute, but know from the start:
Follow rules of fair use
(Which are, sadly, abstruse),
Or my lawyers will tear out your heart.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It weighs seventy-five billion tons,
And it flies and it walks and it runs,
And it swims in the sea,
And contains you and me;
The sheer volume of biomass stuns.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here's a riddle most folks cannot get;
If you don't, no big deal. Please don't fret.
Just what kind of strange thing
Has eight legs and can sing?
It's a barbershop (fooled ya!) quartet.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
If your weeds like to soak up the sun,
Using atrazine frustrates their fun.
It was sprayed on the farms,
But it caused greater harms
To the farmers; today it's on none.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I once knew a woman named Gail
Whose alopecoid mystique I'll unveil:
Nimble quickness combined
With a devious mind,
A sharp nose and a long bushy tail.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your screenplay's so dull, I've a notion
To add scenes of despair and devotion.
I'll add lows—also highs—
I'll emotionalize,
Causing audience tears and commotion.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cyber Cyranos—what do they do?
They write sharp online profiles for you.
For a fee, they'll compose
The most eye-catching prose.
Find a mate pitching secondhand woo.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
He's a bobachee, bobarchee, bobajee,
So even a word-stealing slob ajee
Would have to work hard
If he tried to discard
All the names of this cook at a hob ajee.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
SI's swimsuits cast stars in my eyes.
Each beauty evokes lustful sighs.
To the gal from Brazil
(Ay, she gave me a thrill),
I'm awarding the nubile piece prize.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
A deep gill forms a path for a stream.
It's a cleft, rocky channel or seam.
The sun shines in between
To the lower ravine,
And its rays cause the water to gleam.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You bring word that my ex was in tears,
Bound and gagged on a flight to Tangiers?
And you say she was nude
And completely tattooed?
Do I care?  Tell me more!  I'm all ears!

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
If you hear people singin' and jiggin'
And notice that pints are a-swiggin'
(But no cotton in view),
Then it's probably true
You're tied up in a pub in Balbriggan.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The gray rubber boa's a snake
That I saw way out west, near a lake.
It was smallah and slowah
Than others termed boa,
But its rubbery skin made me quake!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Damp the soil when you're first planting seeds
To give moisture that every seed needs.
Be like me: just a sprinkle
And patience I think'll
Reward you with strong healthy weeds.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
As a kid I collected these things—
The scrawls of celebrity kings.
To join my collection,
It's now my reflection,
You were one of those Frankies or Bings.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
American drivers are bad,
And their lack of civility's sad.
Most should stay out of cars
Lest we all end with scars.
What they're good at is driving me mad.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Of the bonobo, simian imp,
You can say it's like no other chimp.
If its playmates will vex,
It placates them with sex.
That little ape's surely no simp!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A bright young professor named Shana,
Who's specialized in the arcana
Of music, has found
In old manuscripts, sound
She considers God's own cantilena.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Arizona is shocking the nation
With new laws to control immigration.
If your skin is light brown,
Don't be roaming around
Without adequate documentation.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
That my girlfriend's a doll's undebatable.
She's a ten (if you think that she's rate-able).
She's a babe and a beaut
Who's bodaciously cute;
It's just sad that my love is inflatable.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
This word is no flimflam or fiction,
Nor a term for a sexual affliction.
No, a bishopric's place
Is a bishop's home base —
His diocese, turf, jurisdiction.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Hackers' golf games are seldom that strong,
As our ball flights are roughly all wrong.
Thus, we're steadfast believers
In golf ball retrievers
That telescope fifty feet long.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A chemistry student named Linus
Would mix things at random sans shyness.
A radical twist
Formed an amylate mist
Of C5H11O-.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
If reincarnation is fated,
I'd lobby to be reinstated
As what I am now
And not, say, a cow—
The bovine life's much overrated.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Azimuthal equidistant projection
Plots a route, which on closer inspection,
Will render straight shots
Between two earthly spots
In a course with the shortest connection.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
This device is so moody and bitchy.
It is jittery, juddery, twitchy.
Like a twerp, like a jerk,
Like an ass that won't work.
Not secure or reliable. Glitchy.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
What me grandmother put on me plate
Wasn't really that terribly great:
Those boats of cold gravy
Could drown a whole navy.
It'd choke a brown dog, it would, mate.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan M. Guberman
limerick_list.text:
In bed, on the floor, in a chair,
Be it nude or in nice underwear,
Try erotism allo
(Alone is so callow),
'Cause sex is more fun in a pair.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Carbon trading exacts quite a toll
On the infamous West, and its soul,
While the indigent East
Gets the meat from the feast:
We pay diamonds; they're still burning coal.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The judicial award that I fought
For was modest, or that's what I thought,
But the court wasn't swayed.
The adjudgment it made
Came up short of the money I'd sought.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
When you play allargando it means
That you pace with the grandness of queens.
But the literal term
Means your belly's not firm
And you no longer fit in your jeans.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Berlin Wall falls: speak Gorbachev's name
If you're playing the liberal game.
Credit Reagan?  No way!
9/11: just say
It's not Clinton's fault — Bush is to blame.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The passports you're making are flawed,
And you have the intent to defraud.
By committing this crime
(Counterfeisance), there's time
That you'll serve and no friends who'll applaud.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The circular saw, I have found,
Has uses that truly abound.
It cuts timbers with tangles
And miters at angles—
I'd say, as a tool, it's all-round.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
It would only be proper and fittin'
To pay tribute to Benjamin Britten
With winds, strings and brass
Grandioso en masse.
Instead, there's this limerick I've written.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I surmised it was non-controversial,
Anti-AIDS; have you seen the commercial?
In a dignified tone
Several condoms were shown —
That sufficed to arouse the inertial.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Bewick's swans will stay mated for life,
Just a cob and his trouble and strife:
Unrepentant romantics,
Swans eschew kinky antics
(Back in Sparta, though, rumors were rife).

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
The old class teacher taught our whole class—
What a fool who just loved the odd glass.
Still, he never got caught
For the nonsense he taught,
And by noon he'd lie drunk in the grass.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
"That's my Boardwalk you've hit!" Leon roared.
Sandra answered, in all sweet accord,
"You're mistaken and I'm
Staying put, since this time
Both the dice did not land on the board."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When they stormed the Bastille, the ecstatic
Canaille were ferocious, fanatic,
But the French Revolution
Made a great contribution:
Its theme, antiaristocratic.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Most writers would rather have less
Disconcertion—discomfort and stress.
But we editors know,
As our efforts here show,
That exacting demands breed success.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Apece has three syllables, so:
ABC. Why a p I don't know.
Abce, abcie
A-bee-cee ... Seems to me
Readers then needed ale or merlot.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
There's a word that refers to the frays
Of what branches discretely in splays
Or a hand's animation.
You'll enjoy digitation
If you like being fingered both ways.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Tom said, "Leaves without ribs?  They're erostrate."
"That means 'beakless', you jerk! They're ecostate."
I was smug, I was right,
So Tom started a fight
And he punched out my lights.  I lay prostrate.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Once an old chestnut mare carried Lee
To the shade of the horse chestnut tree.
As she stood with sad grace
He asked, "Why the long face?"
"That old chestnut!" she whinnied with glee.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Baccivorous birds biting berries
Could cheerfully choke chewing cherries,
But detest the idea
Of "Cherry Garcia",
That deadly ice cream (Ben and Jerry's).

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
If it's aphyllopodic, you care:
Lower stems lacking leaves; almost bare.
Checking further details
Of this sedge: are there scales?
On inspection—indeed, they are there!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Knowing cancer's returned, and encumbered
With the knowledge his days are now numbered,
He's not told his brother,
His sisters, or mother.
With sadness he won't have them lumbered.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This topology concept's obscure.
Many math geeks don't know it, I'm sure.
But with surfaces, Riemann,
And crosscuts, I seem on
The way now to grasping coupure.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I shall first do as asked, define grunt:
A low, loud, snorting sound.  Now the stunt:
Folks, since I have a mind
Of the scabrous, foul kind,
I'd love ending this ode with… but wun't.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If your skin is affected with boils,
And you're minded to treat it with oils,
Use cytophylactic
Examples. This tactic
Is one from which no-one recoils.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
Michelangelo's David, we're told,
Is a fabulous form to behold.
I'll admit to this crowd
That he's poorly endowed,
But come on, that museum is cold!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Momma's poodle shows no inhibition.
Ringing bells prompt a predisposition
To dribble and drool,
In a reflex—uncool—
So her dog we must now decondition.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
So I'm inking my dabber one day,
And the litho's progressing okay,
When the artist blows in
And exclaims, with chagrin,
"Back to work—I don't pay you to play!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
In list after list, you can learn
It means "guest becomes family." Spurn
That spurious host!
Agenhina's a ghost
Word — a lexical pratfall (from Byrne).

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A sexy French soldier, Monique,
Has a bangin' blonde-bombshell physique,
And upon her impressment
A damage assessment
Found enemy knees had gone weak.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bible scholars may be realistic
When they say that a pen Elohistic
Wrote part of the text.
That leaves others perplexed;
They consider this thinking simplistic.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A disciform thing's like a disc,
I believe I can say without risk.
It is roundish and flat,
There's no doubt about that,
Like a wafer you whisk in your bisque.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In Cairo, we found an inscription
That defied our attempts at decryption.
Though that capital city
Is nice, it's a pity
That no one spoke Ancient Egyptian.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Diel period: one day and night—
Every twenty-four hours—that's right.
It's the same as diurnal,
Once a day, like my journal:
Each evening an entry I write.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
When people are reckoned cartoonish
Their appearance is clownish or loonish,
Or their manner is odd
And proportions of bod
Are ridiculous, weird or buffoonish.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A casern is the barracks in town
Where the soldiers are garrisoned—down
In the hookers' domain.
Since the good folks complain,
It has raised a concern for the Crown.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Facinorous, aren't you, my dear?
You're more wicked than anyone here.
You're a dirty old stick,
And it sure makes me sick
When you sneak baby's pee in my beer.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When Grandma would bake us some date
Breads—aroma so great we can't wait
Breads—they never would last.
We would eat them so fast,
She would have to make seven or eight.

limerick_list.author: Gtmac
limerick_list.text:
A grapheme enthusiast, Marge
Loved units of writing. Beau Sarge
Thus cabled his beauty,
"O u r a q-t!"
And saved on the per letter charge.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
We have freedom of choice, good to know—
Wise decisions will help us to grow,
While a dumb one can make
For a horrid mistake,
Making life a real tough row to hoe.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The man on third base? Yeah, he scored.
And the pitcher? He's out of his gourd!
He just issued (the ass!)
An intentional pass
With three runners already aboard!

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
We've been caught in the teeth of a gale,
And were tardy in reefing our sail.
Now we're swamped by the drink,
And I think we might sink—
Just get down to the bilges and bail!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Encephalic gray stuff in one's cranium
Is treasured like gold or uranium.
Humans made gains
From incredible brains.
Try to buy 'em? They're plain "unobtainium"!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
On a trip to a region of Ghana,
I collected some new Africana.
One document took
An unusual look
At liana that grows in Botswana.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Had a mule and she had what it takes
To haul goods up-canal to great lakes.
My good mule (her name's Sal)
Trod the Erie Canal
And died pulling. I guess that's the breaks.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
When faced with the vertical smile,
Some choose to ignore it, but I'll
Take a whole 'nother tack.
I'll make some nasty crack:
"When did 'plumber chic' come back in style?"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I can not make the tiniest dent
In his conspiratorialist bent.
Leery Don never wearies
Of secret-scheme theories;
For conspiracists, Don's heaven-sent.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
In my lifetime I've had two epiphanies:
The day I priced gold rings at Tiffany's,
And the very first time
That I heard Bach's sublime
Interweavings of fugal polyphonies.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I achieved what I set out to do.
All my schooling is finally through.
With my Liberal Arts major,
However, I wager
That good-paying prospects are few.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Proper seafood should never have legs;
All these actinal kinds are the dregs.
Little squiddies and starfish
Can make me feel barfish.
I'll just have the bacon and eggs.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Hump was deafened by wind — didn't hear
What the jumpmaster yelled in his ear:
"Please, don't jump, Hump, you chump,
Or you'll wind up a lump,
'Cause your chute's over there, on your chair."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If you utter first super- and cali-
fragilistic- and then expiali-,
And finish with docious,
You'll sound quite precocious!
Say it quickly now, don't dilly dally!

limerick_list.author: petersbuck
limerick_list.text:
Not all presidents act this intense,
Offer wisdom and have common sense.
Yes, Jed Bartlet is keen,
Shines with Martin's best sheen—
To West Wing fans, his shadow's immense.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
To decentralise criminal life:
Shut the prisons where gang rule runs rife,
Disperse 'hoods, close the courts,
End probation reports.
Let's deconcentrate trouble and strife!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
San Francisco's where George left his heart,
His love having torn it apart.
In time, his aorta
(The left part—well, sorta)
Decided to make a new start.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm edentulous (lost all my teeth),
So I "chew" with the gums underneath
Where my choppers once thrived.
Once your new set's arrived,
Your old dentures, to me, please bequeath.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
When you're near to cicuta, best curb
Any urge for a taste of the herb.
It has roots that are vile,
And in a short while
Your health it will badly disturb!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An entrepreneur named Herb Jervis
Runs a drive-in that features curb service.
Though folks eat in their car,
His cuisine is four-star.
Now the price-rise in fuel makes Herb nervous.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I can face an extraction; I'm young,"
I had thought. First, the novocaine stung.
Then the dentist, confused,
The wrong instrument used
And mistakenly took out my tongue.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Beaufort claims that a croker sack's used
When you're out catching frogs. He's confused.
"It's not 'croaker' at all,"
Says his grandfather. "Y'all
Don't know squat," he advises, amused.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You can get there with passion or not.
Doesn't matter.  I'm horny and hot,
So come take me.  All roads
Lead to Rome; different modes
Will achieve the same goal.  That's the spot!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To play flapdragon, one must be brazen,
Bravin' liquor that's actually blazin',
To pluck from that brandy,
And gobble like candy
A hot, floating plum or a raisin.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the cleanup that followed the flood,
We became well acquainted with mud,
But what came through the door
And was caked on the floor?
I would have to describe it as crud.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I avoid any over-reliance,
As to me it is just an appliance,
While to you it's a buddy
And subject of study—
Computers, for you, are a science."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On one phrase I'm about to expound:
If you wake from a sleep that is sound,
Or you change your direction,
Or mind, or complexion,
Or pay us a call, you've come round.

limerick_list.author: Jayson Lockwood
limerick_list.text:
Abrachiocephalia's dire.
If you've got it, you're sure to expire.
You're naught but a stump —
Legs, torso, and rump;
A casket you soon will require.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Moses lowered his arms: Israel quailed.
Then he raised them: his people prevailed.
Like the arms of a chair
Hur stood here, Aaron there.
In the end, the Amalekites failed.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
The economy's looking quite boomy,
With scope for investment that's roomy.
But I chose to sell short
When I ought to have bought,
And that's why I'm looking so gloomy.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Move the loot if you have any sense
To a pawn shop or, better, a fence.
When conditions turn prickly,
A fence will pay quickly.
His cut's just a business expense.

limerick_list.author: Doug Harris
limerick_list.text:
The bloodstream has cells red and white,
With serum to keep them in flight.
Carries food, gives protection,
And when there's infection,
It puts up a bloody good fight!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Calopogon: this orchid is cheered,
Though its name to my ear's a bit weird.
It sounds odd when I speak it;
Derived from the Greek, it
Appears to mean "beautiful beard."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"Furnished room to let," as the ad said,
Meant not only a chair and a bed,
But a table, I thought.
It had none, so I bought
An antique office desk in its stead.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
The limerick's too often viewed
As a verse that's capriciously lewd.
It is righteous to vex,
With both satire and sex,
Oily posers and perverts caught nude.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
Said the painter, "It seems like extortion
Insisting my art use distortion."
His manager said,
"This technique buys your bread."
So to eat, he used altered proportion.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The ruler of Egypt (khedive),
Quite a doubter, once said, "Disbelieve
What your neighbors propose.
Some are dumb, heaven knows,
And the rest do their best to deceive."

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
Sometimes tinnitus comes on in spurts—
Little audio-frequency squirts.
It's normally reckoned
In cycles per second;
In other words—how much it hertz.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
John was climbing along the cliff, ledgewise,
And he inched through an opening, edgewise.
Then we saw poor John slip
As his feet lost their grip.
Now he's trapped between rocks, compressed wedgewise.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"Awake is a state that I'm not,
When I lie, fast asleep, in my cot,"
Thought the innocent baby,
"I wonder if, maybe,
I should wake, 2 a.m., on the dot?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When it's autumn, what chore makes me smile?
To coacervate leaves in a pile.
I jump in when I'm done,
Which is not as much fun
When they're placed on the ground single file.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
If it's warthogs you wish to detusk,
I advise that you try it at dusk.
They don't fight in dim light,
So you might do alright—
If you think you can handle the musk.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"You don't know of Falco?" I frown.
"An Austrian star of renown.
Here, allow me to play us
His 'Rock Me Amadeus'...
Sad der Kommissar isn't in town."

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
A nuclear chemist named Ray
Changed his job; he's a deejay today.
And what's even stranger,
He's not in less danger;
He's radioactive each way.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
While in London (last summer's vacation),
I went to Victoria Station.
There I dug a depression
As a form of expression—
Was it holey?  No, just concavation.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A poetess formed an alliance
With a writer for Popular Science.
The unravish'd bride
Praised a toaster with pride
In her "Ode on a Kitchen Appliance."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Before uttering viewpoints incisive
That you know may be seen as derisive
(And provocative, too),
Be aware you may rue
Causing splits through your comments divisive.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When I sculpted a bust Belle adored,
A French dip was my tasty reward.
That's a sandwich of meat
On a bun, white or wheat,
On which seasoned pan juices are poured.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The old tricycle tractor's designed
To work row-crops, and jobs of that kind:
Configuration's ideal,
With its single front wheel
And adjustable drive-wheels behind.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
GPSs are great for dictation
Of directions to any location,
Like this morgue up ahead.
Nearly died when it said:
"You've arrived at your last destination."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A collegeman labored all day
On a college to garner his pay.
Since that term, by and large,
Meant "a flat-bottomed barge,"
No degree was required, I'd say.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"That's a death spiral; that's what it's called?
I won't have it; I'm simply appalled!
Your young man might let go.
You'll be splintered, you know,"
Cried old Gran, "Still, the crowd was enthralled."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
From a Stefan and Boltzmann perspective,
Stars' brightness is far from subjective:
It's the same you'd observe
From a black-body curve
With the temperature known as effective.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The farewells of one atheist guy
Eschew bye-bye. "That's pie-in-the-sky
Old religion, you know.
Oh, you don't? Long ago,
God be with ye turned into good-bye."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Speak Chaga to order a beer
From a Bantu in North Tanzania.
It's Kichaga (or Chaga)
That's used to buy lager:
That's the language they speak around here.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A dyslexic artiste from Chi-lung
Had a mishap and severed his tongue.
So with reading a chore
And performing no more,
He has mastered the art of Fu Kung.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It was brutal: their words should have hurt.
He hurled "birdbrain!" She countered "stuffed shirt!"
In a bitter exchange.
So their conduct seemed strange
When she slid his hand under her skirt.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Call me Ahab; let Ishmael turn pale
That I'm the one telling his tale.
But the captain (that's me)
Is in charge, you'll agree—
And 'twas I who obsessed on the whale.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
With anagrams, fun is in store.
They disclose what is hidden—and more.
"George Bush" is a name
Where the letters seem tame,
But they also can spell "He bugs Gore."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lord McVeer, who was one of the peerage,
Lost his fortune, and after the clearage
Of cash said, "In Maine
I'll start over again—
But of course I will have to go steerage."

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
In the mosque said Imam Ibrahim:
"Bismillahi rahmani rahim:
Lest we go astray,
To Allah we must pray,
Seeking only His will most supreme!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Our butler was just a tad starchy.
When we asked him to chop down the larch, he
Responded: "Good sirs,
I don't do conifers!"
And his eyebrows grew terribly archy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A break's what I'm planning to take,
After breaking each promise I make;
But I promise I'll do
What I've promised to you.
Hey, quit laughing, and give me a break!

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
To mask the foul odor of sweat,
Perfumed powder can sometimes offset
Any smells that might waft
(And it's cooling and soft).
Such empasms avert B.O.'s threat.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
It eased changing a channel. Take note:
The Flash-Matic, first TV remote,
Just a point-and-shoot squeeze
Put the viewer at ease—
It got many a sofa-slug's vote.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
As an auctioneer's gee-man, his shill
In the mob, I've got chores to fulfill.
So when bids just ain't coming,
My barks start 'em humming.
When to stop is a gee's greatest skill.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
In Scotland, where castles were built,
And they speak with a brogue and a lilt,
Put a man in a dress
And you'll hear him confess,
"Laddie, och, I would sooner be kilt."

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
This limerick neatly describes
Alemanni, a grouping of tribes.
They fought with the Romans,
But heeded the omens
And came to the cross (say the scribes).

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
My six-year-old often will balk
At eating a celery stalk.
He'll get cranky and mutter
Till I spread peanut butter
On his snack...then he'll swoop like a hawk.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
If you're checking your check, then be sure
Not to ask what an item is for.
If you say it's too much
When the reckoning's Dutch,
They will add something more to your score.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A notched parapet built on a wall,
With its merlons the highest of all,
And with crenels between,
Where you risk being seen:
An embattlement — safe, strong and tall.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Golden flutes on the green chalice vine
Bloom fragrant and fair by design.
Beware nectar that drips
From their sweet honeyed lips—
For this chalice bears poison, not wine.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A bullbat eats insects that fly;
Like a namesake, it sups while on high.
Though a nighthawk's no bat
(Or a bull, come to that),
It booms as it zooms through the sky.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I'm certainly sure I like candy,
And I'm certain silk stockings are dandy.
I am  certainly tall—
I am not small at all.
I'm sure certain's a word that is handy!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
It's an Asian arboreal civet;
Binturong's the name that we give it.
Its tail is prehensile
For holding a pencil,
Fondue fork, or glass of Glenlivet.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
I list carp, cod, and crappie with ease,
And both catfish and coho will please.
Add in chub and chinook,
Also cobia.  Look,
There are plenty of fish in the C's.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My babe's pedagogical treasure;
I use her to teach cubic measure.
Three-dimensional size
Is her lesson for guys —
To determine her volume's a pleasure.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
This morning I woke at first light,
With the dawn, feeling prospects were bright.
I made plans for my day,
But I'm sorry to say,
That I dozed off again—now it's night.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We're cahooting and scheming to shoot
At a bird who's a little too cute,
Giving tabby a fright
With his calls in the night.
He's an owl who's just not worth a hoot.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Circularly soaring around,
A hawk eyes its prey on the ground;
But the grey hare is bounding
With timid heart pounding
Through tussock till cover is found.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
"My test results, Doc, what's the answer?"
Looking grim, he replied to the man, "Sir,
You've got cancer; it's true…
And you've Alzheimer's, too."
Said the patient, "Thank God it's not cancer."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On my trips to the north, I have been
Quite impressed by the road-safety scene.
"I'll turn left!" I am thinking,
And notice a blinking
Green light. Then it's safe—advanced green!

limerick_list.author: FunkyTuba
limerick_list.text:
My valence is one. That will do.
A radical ring, well, who knew?
Should this still not suffice,
Then to be more precise:
I am C6H5CH2.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Now that purges don't take up their time,
The reformers are turning to crime.
So the people are storming
For counterreforming—
Restoring a peaceable clime.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
While performing my first curettage,
I unleashed an unfunny barrage.
As I scraped out the womb
In that white, sterile room,
I unnerved the O.R. entourage.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Al's an anchorite, lives like a moose
In the woods, a religious recluse.
As a hermit, he'll spend
Days in prayer without end,
But for me, I would say, "What's the use?"

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Canon Phelps cried out loud to the maid:
"Can you bring me some cold lemonade?
A can please, or two—
I will wait in the loo."
(Insanity's allowed and can aid.)

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Rory really has pulled out a plum,
Such a true comeback kid! It was dumb
When he first blew the Masters
With driving disasters,
But he then won the Open—no bum!

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
His attention span short as can be,
He fought while he earned his degree.
Gaining impulse control,
Staying mindful, his goal,
He succeeded despite ADD.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
If your mind is possessed, we'll attest
That an exorcist's cure is the best.
But if flu wracks your body,
What isn't too shoddy?
Hot buttered rum toddy, plus rest.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
An ode that I wrote to a Grecian
Earned a word from my prof, on completion.
Was it excellent?  No.
It was excernent, so
My long ode, he thinks, bears on excretion.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
I was ill-prepared, but I thought, "Damn!
Let's go in for this ruddy exam!"
I was lucky, however,
(And, luckily, clever),
So, now, an accountant I am.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A man by the name of Ralph Wood
Built a bridge that he feared was no good,
So he jumped from its height
To his death one sad night,
Though he'd built it as best as he could.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Lots of people would pay you for that.
Would you please keep it under your hat?
If you don't breathe a word
About what you've just heard,
It's for certain they won't smell a rat.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
To give your next limerick a twist,
Use an assonant rhyme, just like this:
"With some honey, my tummy
Will feel warm and funny."
The vowels rhyme—the rest?  Not a bit!

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
You've got gliders, planes, choppers with rotors,
Kites, drones, balloons, blimps (flyers, floaters);
Parachute — paraglider.
Fly higher and wider
In aircraft with jet-powered motors.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Although it's a fact you ignore,
There are points angling up on your jaw.
It's gonions, they're called,
And by them I'm enthralled.
Things craniometric don't bore!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Abyssinians lived on the Nile,
A people of substance and style.
Where their kingdom was grand
Ethiopians stand—
In a land where survival takes guile.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It's the ultimate bash of the year;
If you're clay and absorbent, you're here!
Wipe that smudge from your collar —
Your wife's sure to holler,
"Just where have you bentonite, dear?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What the hell's an affinity card?
To find out doesn't take Scotland Yard.
A part of each charge,
Whether little or large,
Goes to charity—quite avant-garde.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
The word of is informally a:
So if some kind a gangster should say,
"Get rid a the rats!"
Then a couple a cats
Sorta blow his accusers away.

limerick_list.author: buttonbright
limerick_list.text:
A Greek shield, these days, seems egregious,
But not so the word for it:  aegis.
Metaphoric connection
Suggests the protection
Of someone or something prestigious.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Here's a secret I keep under wraps:
Through the daytime I sneak little naps.
Then I get home to life
With my partying wife —
I'll make midnight before I collapse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The judge has agreed to estop
The landlord who rents Pop his shop,
So her rent bill will topple.
The court used estoppel
To block a fraud foisted on Pop.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Over Christmas a fresh brace of pheasant
And port make a real welcome present.
They create a warm glow,
Which, to those in the know,
Means gemutlich, "agreeably pleasant".

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Nought divided by eight is a mad sum.
Two plus two equals five is a bad sum.
Our additions, though, dear,
Make it pleasurably clear:
The arrival of children is gladsome.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What are ethics? They're principles, rules
Of good conduct. We use them as tools
That help culture stay strong,
Choosing right over wrong,
So we act more like angels than fools.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The act of enduring can be
Pretty hard on a young 'un like me.
I have practiced abidance
Without any guidance,
Becoming an orphan at three.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
As the vampire looked up from a crypt,
From his foul mouth a small trickle dript.
"My good buddy, Count Drac,
Said, 'Let's meet for a snack,'
But he sucked this dude dry. I've been gypped!"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A prince had to kiss Sleeping Beauty.
He did so, some claim, out of duty.
But we all know the truth
For, egads and forsooth,
He's just after sweet Beauty's booty.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
An old rapper was canned for abuse,
And his talents fell into disuse.
Now his infamous jeer
Has relaunched his career,
And his diss use supplies all his juice.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
In this church I will not rant and rave.
We're not here to condemn but to save.
Today's homily's bland,
But have faith in the land
Of the See and the home of the nave.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Say big government; you're on the side
Of conservatives: they've often cried
That it means too much spending
On those who unending-
ly think they deserve a free ride.

limerick_list.author: Blind Pig
limerick_list.text:
When the GOP's under attack,
You hear class war from each party hack.
Hey, the class warfare's done,
The rich people won.
Can't you cut the poor workers some slack?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Diphosphate combined with adenosine
Is an ester that's certainly menacin'.
It's a nucleoside,
A high-energy ride.
(You won't find ADP reading Tennyson.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My head foreman just called to relate
That my cattle fell off. Well, that's great.
"There's no cliff on my land."
"No, you don't understand.
To fall off means the cows have lost weight."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Do you not understand what I said?
Can I not get it into your head?
Would amplification
Help this situation?
Or should I speak LOUDER instead?

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Yes, we do define words like bosthoon,
So our work is becoming a boon
To all word-lovers who
Seek for answers, like you:
He's an ignorant, tactless buffoon.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
Once arrested, the wealthy post bail
So they won't have to stay locked in jail
Till their trial completes.
They can then hit the streets,
But while free they must not hit the trail!

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Rossini's compactor went thump, thump, thump;
It squeezed down the trash to a lump, lump, lump.
A loud spousal scoff,
Then Giacomo's off
To the dump, to the dump, to the dump, dump, dump.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Yes, a bull can be sated: he's fill-a-bull.
With the proper cow-tipping, he's spill-a-bull.
And, of course, when he hires
Attorneys (what liars!),
He's certain their hours are ...

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A chemical ruled amphoteric
(And sometimes this beastie is ferric)
Is acid one place—
In another, a base—
Which can drive placid chemists hysteric.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A minority suffers aggrievement
When injustices lead to bereavement.
They fight, don't you see,
For their right to be free,
Which becomes their historic achievement.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A Code Green can make staff go berserk,
Since it stands for some force-wielding jerk
(Maybe armed—we don't know),
Or a fire drill, though
When it's safe, it's "All clear—back to work."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
They're arraigning an angel in heaven
Who's charged with purloining the leaven.
(This arraigning has airs
With its five letter-pairs—
Scintillescent is said to have seven.)

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Early on in the year '33,
FDR said we all need a tree.
Though it sounds most berserk,
He put people to work
Building forests: the old CCC.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Help his brother drain gas? Tim abstains,
Since it's clear Ted's deficient in brains.
He'll exhaust all the gas
From the tank then, alas,
Strike a match to see how much remains.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
As she falls in the pool in her gown,
Heavy waterlogged clothes pull her down.
"Strip them off!" people shout,
But decorum wins out,
So with modesty salvaged, she'll drown.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Through life one should certainly strive
To be vital and truly alive.
Vitamins help
And perhaps eating kelp.
Good habits will help you survive.

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
limerick_list.text:
It's a bus stop, where buses may pause
To disgorge weary souls from their jaws.
Other folks get onboard,
Join the sardine-packed horde;
Yes, it's transport—with too many flaws.

limerick_list.author: Engineer
limerick_list.text:
Billy screams and he jumps on a chair.
So I look, but I see nothing there.
Still he yells as he squirms,
"I'm surrounded by germs!"—
A bacteriophobia scare.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To call Ursula Andress "a blonde girl"
Is a joke.  She is light-years beyond "girl."
Pulchritudinous?  God,
What a dynamite bod!
She earned fame as our very first "Bond girl."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I took, on blind faith (with no proof),
Goof-Proof Roofers' claim: "We'll seal your roof!"
Boy, was that a mistake;
What they "sealed" has a break.
In my den there's a lake — proof they goof!

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
It's got currants and cherries, and rum,
And there's ginger and allspice, and some
Cloves, brown sugar and port,
Flour and eggs and it's short
Of a dozen more items to come.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
The calico bass is a game fish.
Sac-a-lait, to a Cajun: the same fish.
This Pomoxis (black crappie)
Is tasty and scrappy
And, mounted, a fine Wall-of-Fame fish.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
In Montana, I often can't wait
To depart, for I'm not feeling great.
But I also should add
That it isn't so bad;
I'm in more of a borderline state.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
The culchies are bumpkins or boors;
They get dirty from working outdoors,
And yet, even in Dublin
They're found with no trublin
The best families, sir — even yours!

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
Fluid ounce:  It's one fifth of a gill.
Take twenty of them, and you will
Have a pint (says the Brit),
And I freely admit
So much whisky is really a thrill.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A catechist got in a fight
With a dogmatist way more uptight:
"But I'm teaching of Jesus…"
"Well, that doesn't please us—
Just God and myself know what's right."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Aboriginal Aussies got slurred
In a song by Rolf Harris.  What's heard?
Let me Abos go loose.
He ditched later the use
Of that hurtful, disparaging word.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Here's an Asian volcano pop quiz:
Can you tell me where Demavend is?
Take a hint if you can:
When it blew up...I ran!
If you know, you can say, "I'm a whiz!"

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Jean D. Ark was alone with a quark
Singularity, squashed, till a spark
Set it off with a bang
(Universal loud twang),
And our Jeannie then lit up the dark.

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
As the clowns down below hear my speech,
I proclaim, "Once more into the breech!"
The cannon is loaded
With me! Then exploded—
And that's why good spelling I preach.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A long-winded loser named Smith
Found a maxim to share with his kith.
The apothegm ran
A few hours, a span
That was painfully lacking in pith.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
With the skin disease known as courap,
You'll be lucky to get through a nap.
The perpetual itching
And torturous twitching
Lead many a victim to snap.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
So exciting, to get you undressed!
Removing your bra—that's the best:
 With my hands helping gravity,
The cup's smooth concavity
Slides from the curve of your breast.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Not just beautiful—talented too!
Tyra Banks won an Emmy. (Who knew?)
First a star of the runway,
She's shown more than one way
She has to impress me and you.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Corresponding by letter was why
We used pencils or pens to apply
To a blank paper sheet
Words like Dear, so to greet
Absent friends. Now we email, type, "Hi!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
These old coal shafts, though no longer mined,
Can be hazards for those left behind.
Kids delight to explore
In air courses galore.
Some are trapped; fate is often unkind.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
There are many good words you should know
En français.  As regards à-propos,
Such remarks might amuse.
If they do, you might choose
To describe them as someone's "bons mots".

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I have a young friend in Iraq,
Deployed there to fight, to attack.
She joined the armed forces,
Took requisite courses....
I hope that she'll safely come back.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My armor is strong, chased with brass,
The tuilles, cuisse and pauldrons first-class.
A culet? My sweet,
Since I'd never beat feet,
I've no reason to cover my ass.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In the '60s, film-lovers would go
To the spy-genre film Doctor No.
All would grow to be fond
Of its hero, James Bond,
In the first of a very long row.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Every good radiologist knows
How the axial plane really goes.
It's a slice front to back,
And so only a quack
Says it goes from your head to your toes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
They wore buckskins through many a jam,
Way out west, but it now seems a sham.
Once from skin of a buck,
Now we're just out of luck,
As they're made from the hide of a lamb.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Hey, computer geeks, here's my new etching!
There are some who have found it quite fetching;
And you can afford
To mount this circuit board—
Fits its slot and your budget, no stretching.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Note that fame has an infamous side.
It's a breeding ground, fueling a slide
Into drugs, and this trend
Carries on with no end.
What a shame.  Far too many have died.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
There is currency risk in near any
External transaction. This, many
A firm or investor
Can sadly attest, for
It's cost them a real pretty penny.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I need to ensure you'll remain
Close at hand, so I plan to detain
You awhile. I'm afraid
That your schedule's delayed,
So don't move, but feel free to complain.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Since learning about them, my goal
Is to chow down on brown English sole.
These Pacific northwest fish
Are praised as the best fish —
True trenchermen swallow 'em whole!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My kitty was anxious, afraid;
Then she hissed, and her claws were displayed.
With the flying of fur,
She created a stir
And a huge altercation, when spayed.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Chang and Eng, each a Siamese twin,
Were named for positions by kin.
Chang means left; Eng means right,
So their folks at first sight
Could pick which twin to chuck 'neath the chin.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
Gyp hated the Jews, so they say,
And "republican" wasn't her way.
She wrote novels galore,
Least a hundred or more,
But her books are not read much today.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A hedge trimmer showed his Britannic
Reserve when he asked without panic,
"Could you help me here, guv,
Get me hand from this glove?"
And his fingers came off with the dannock.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
Current income: that's dollars and cents
Earned from dividends, interest, or rents.
My income is current-
ly rather deterrent
To spending a lot, so I'm tense.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In our class, this old cup is the Grail.
More canvas, more wind — we'll prevail.
Make this glorious yacht
Show us all that she's got.
We're leading. Keep crowding on sail!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Hear the dog! Now the badger is penned
In a butt-hole (impasse, or dead end).
We'll dig all about
Till Old Jones can reach out,
Grab old brock by the tail (teeth would rend).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A paleontology wonk
Felt a stone hit his head and go "Bonk!"
He looked up in surprise,
And in front of his eyes
Was a conchite (a fossilized conch).

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
Alternative medicine's skill
Won't be paid by insurance, but still
Acupuncture is swell
If the jab is done well,
But beware, you'll get stuck with the bill.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
The weather today will be fine:
The sun is preparing to shine,
And a light breath of breeze
Will just ruffle the trees
While the temperature hits twenty-nine.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
He's a deadbeat!  Although he's your friend,
He had borrowed your money to spend.
Time's gone by, and you've learned
That it won't be returned.
There's a moral here:  "Think when you lend."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What's an aeroshell?  That's element'ry.
It's (in terms of design) supplement'ry
To a spacecraft's protection.
It's the outermost section
So the craft won't burn up on re-entry.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Though we're far from the center of shock,
The quake's crumbled our whole city block.
We'll need massive assistance
Despite the quake's distance
Epicentral. We're still taking stock.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Lights are out; there's a squeak — what the dickens?
Just a freak — houses creak. My pulse quickens.
I cry out in the dark;
Comes a muffled remark:
"Ain't nobody here but us chickens."

limerick_list.author: aitch
limerick_list.text:
In Abbott you won't see a Lexus
Or anything foreign. The nexus?
All its people are true
To the lone star on blue,
And shun that what ain't made in Texas.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
While the upside of caring for mother
Is the sum we'll inherit, my brother,
The downside's so steep
That the ultimate sleep
Can't come quick enough—strangle or smother?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
By the warm Aitutaki lagoon,
Overseen by a dazzling moon,
The breeze in the palms
Both caresses and calms.
I'll return, Polynesia — and soon.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your demands for more crap are so numbing!
At all others, your nose you are thumbing,
Unwilling to share.
I must urge you: beware!
Friend, your greediness isn't becoming!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
A community prospers and thrives
Around neighbourly folk and their lives.
Empty second homes, though,
Kill communities, so
Let's condemn them while kinship survives.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Let's examine my cranial dome,
The curved bones that serve neatly as home
To my walnut-like brain,
Which remains the domain
Where my body-mind impulses roam.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Her sergeant said, "Take these red hoods—
You can catch that old wolf; get the goods!
You'll be fine undercover;
Just don't let him discover
You're a cop, not some babe in the woods."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Dermatomycosis is not
What I'd like to admit that I've got.
Athlete's foot is the least
Of my trials with this beast,
As (under my clothing) I rot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A breathless young lady named Beth
Got excited and tried crystal meth.
She flew high—up she'd soar—
But she soon needed more;
Then hardcore, from the drug met her death.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though the era would culminate fatefully,
The czar, who had carried on hatefully
(He had acted detestably),
Found the peasants, suggestibly,
Thought him valiant and cheered for him gratefully.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Love in shambles, I must disengage
From this sham.  Time to start a new page,
A new chapter in life,
'Cause I can't take the strife.
I bow out.  I'm departing this stage.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
bob killian
limerick_list.text:
In order to not be divisive,
At a minimum, don't be derisive
Of one side or belief,
Or you'll soon come to grief —
Better neutral than wrongly decisive.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Arithmetic mean (straight in between)—
Geometric mean (product's root, lean)—
Inequality, see,
Tells us: A's more than G,
But if a equals b, mean is mean!

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
The bank clerk, not much of a scholar,
Got angry and started to holler.
"This cent here," he roared
At my uncle, "Good Lord,
Is the one-hundredth part of a  dollar!"

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
These ants are such small, busy creatures.
As insects with typical features,
They live in their hills
And display stunning skills.
You want more? Ask biology teachers.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
When something goes wrong and awry,
I could spit, swear out loud, even cry.
It's a bummer, a drag,
When my plan hits a snag,
And things shift to a low from a high.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Once, a horse-racing friend said to me,
"I've four certs here. They'll win, wait and see."
Well, the first three were fast,
But the fourth horse came last.
My accumulator win? Not one p!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Descriptive geometry's known
As the way that constructions are shown.
Drawn perspective's the key
To creating 3D
Views of sections of planes with a cone.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
The bear-bottom ads are disarmin';
Those ursines are no way alarmin'.
What Gargantua sought,
Now, hurrah, can be bought —
He'd have said of this torchecul: "It's Charmin!"

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Type an ampersand, "ndash," and then
With no space, semicolon. The "n"?
Expanded, it's "endash,"
A sort of a penned dash
To use between dates, and such kin.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
I exclaimed, "It is just as I feared:
There's a tree with the name old man's beard,
And Lear's limerick is true,
Though an avian crew
In this fringe tree has not yet appeared."

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
A chambrel's  a roof with two slopes.
It's a route for a girl who elopes.
But the lower slope's steeper—
Could be a grim reaper—
For her safety, she'll need some strong ropes!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A dungeon's an underground cell,
Icy cold, dark and damp; life is hell
In this windowless hole
Where, unless you're a mole,
Pretty soon you won't feel very well.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our climate's predictably dry,
And there's rarely a cloud in our sky.
But of late, it's turned zany,
Always coming on rainy.
Plan a picnic? God spits in your eye.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
At eisteddfods, Wales' citizens hear
Long narrations of verse, loud and clear.
In this festival test
Judges choose from the best
Songs and poetry, sweet on the ear.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Consumerization is taking
Your goods or your products and making
Them highly available,
Massively saleable,
Appealing, but not budget-breaking.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Can't you see that I crave copulation?
Your reticence causes frustration.
