I've made myself clear:
Get your butt over here.
Do you need an engraved invitation?

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Coeur D'Alene is an Idaho town
That's achieved a fair share of renown:
There's  a hole (by and large)
That floats on a barge,
So golfers can watch their balls drown.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
"Let's jet off for your birthday!" she said.
"Say, a villa in Rome? Or Club Med!
Then we'll dance by the Rhine;
Head to France for fine wine!"
(In the end, we watched TV in bed.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He announced for George Bush by attacking
John Kerry and zealously backing
Republican themes.
From these actions, it seems
His political sense must be lacking.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Some speak English, Armenian, Dutch,
Spanish, German, Norwegian, or such,
Each a glossonym: name
Of a language. Their aim:
To facilitate keeping in touch.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Two young cheese fans were having a chat.
Said one, "Derby's unique, and that's that!"
"Why is that, if you please?"
"It's the world's only cheese
With a name that's the same as a hat!"

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Their murderous scheme really worked:
Plied with drink, soon the victims were burked.
They'd be stuffed in a box
For the good Doctor Knox.
(If dissected, I'd surely be irked.)

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Watch out for my brother: he'll grill ya
Some bits of a cow that'll kill ya.
Take a shooftee at that—
Bloody loaded with fat.
(Mate, chuck us anotherie, will ya?)

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Talking price means you cannot afford
That new pad that your wife has adored.
But if you've got the rent,
Tell the world what you've spent
So your status your friends can record.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
A well-spoken young Indonesian
Contracted a cortical lesion.
	His sentences hence
	No longer made sense:
Acataphasia wrecks verbal cohesion.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
A dog on the beach in the dark
Started yelping, an earsplitting bark.
A bivalve, it seems,
Had gone to extremes—
Slamming shut on his nose:  Pup v. Ark.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
My apologies, sir, on my word!
My courtesy flush won't be heard.
I feel like a fool,
Since I'd swallowed a jewel
And must thoroughly check every turd.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A lackluster degu, who knew
That his image was shabby, would stew.
So he married a hare
To assume savoir faire,
But he's still just a rat from Peru.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Now the cab of my train's overhauled,
With new safety equipment installed.
No more "trainload goodbye"
If I black out or die—
Dead man's handle, it's cheerfully called.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
When I went to the races today,
I bet all that I had on a bay.
Old Stewball, the horse,
Came in first, so of course
For the bayard the bookies must pay.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
A stock market bear bravely dares
To sell high (and deflate?) stocks and shares
Which he hasn't yet bought
(When the price drops, he ought!) —
He "sells bearskins before catching bears".

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Controversialists like to dispute.
Speak your mind, and they'll go in pursuit
Of an argument.  Don't
Speak your mind, and they won't.
('Round my family, I'm quite often mute.)

limerick_list.author: Doug Smeath
limerick_list.text:
A gentleman, garish and gaudy,
Met a woman who made him feel naughty.
But she found this poor bloke
Too ornate and baroque —
Mademoiselle preferred earthy and bawdy.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The heifer seduced in the shed
Has been feeling abused and misled,
Since the herd, so we hear,
Gave her quite the bum steer.
Poor advice led her into his bed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
From our word list, two words I am getting:
Besotting, and also besetting.
One "reason derailing,"
The other "assailing";
You won't mix them up, I am betting.

limerick_list.author: Engineer
limerick_list.text:
When King Henry took Catherine to wed,
He agreed to be hers until dead.
But he wanted a son
And, alas, there was none;
He divorced her and wed Anne instead.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Big Dipper is now within view,
And Orion and Gemini, too.
When we snuggle out late
'Neath the stars, it's so great
To astronomize nightly with you.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I present this behavioral thesis,
From studying one of my nieces:
This sensitive lass
Has an ego of glass;
She will fall, if lambasted, to pieces.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
There was once a gay bouncer named Bubba
Whose truncheon was made out of rubber.
If a night-clubbing lass
Ever fondled his ass,
He'd put clubber to clubber and club 'er.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
One of Hitler's top henchman, he gave
Up his conscience and served as a slave.
Was Eichmann psychotic
Or merely robotic
In herding a mass to the grave?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ms. Detective, your plan is defective.
Consider the burglar's perspective.
Wearing yellow sateen
You'll be easily seen;
Here a dull coloration's protective.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a thief who steals all sorts of crops,
At avoiding detection I'm tops.
At least that's what I'd say
Till my luck changed today.
Man, this cornfield is crawling with cops.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Do arterial noises beguile?
What they're caused by can kill any smile,
And my doc won't say whether
A bruit "like new leather"
Means both of us going in style.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Artemisia abrotanum? Oh, dear!
It's a wormwood once used to make beer.
This American plant
(I say southernwood) can't
Get my old man much drunker, I fear.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Pastor Phil often waxed evangelic
While portraying a Hollywood relic.
When he preached us the Word,
It did not seem absurd
That his face bore a mask of Tom Selleck.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
All good fairytales end with a moral.
Here be one: a wise prince shall not quarrel
With a princess whose feet
Be not fragrant and sweet,
Lest she say his bouquet be not floral.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Limbaugh hopes that Obama will fail
With his "socialist" plans.  Minions rail
Against Rush and his brand.
The deflecting command
From the President's ship is "Assail!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Disingenuously, what I mean
To convey is: I'm simple and green.
But I'm canny instead
And I'm rather well-read.
It's my old daft wee laddie routine.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When our dad bought our first TV set,
All us kids danced with joy, you can bet.
Though the critics found faults
With my brother Bob's waltz,
I drew praise for my fine minuet.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When red and black yarns intersect,
So the pattern appears to be checked,
Then the wearer is clad
In a buffalo plaid,
With a checkerboard kind of effect.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a sheet where you fill in the blanks
To please post office workers or banks.
Form can also mean "shape"
(As in ovoid for grape),
And means "custom," like ways to say "Thanks."

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
A girlie mag's view, if you heed 'em:
For ladies, no clothes equals freedom!
Be proud of your bod!
And yet here's something odd:
I don't think it's the girlies who read 'em.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Met my wife at a fun contra dance
Where up and down lines we would prance,
On toes and on heels,
To jigs and to reels.
Till then, I'd been contra-romance.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The foreigner couldn't distinguish
One word from the other in Enguish.
"Hell, they all sound the same;
It's a terrible shame!"
He exclaimed (in his own native linguish).

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
An assassin by name of O'Kane
Did a job and retired to Spain,
Where he built a fine villa
Named Casa da Killa
(Best not to suggest he explain).

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
It  will not shoot stone walls to the sky;
As a wall rocket plant it will try
Out a perch on the rocks,
With its roots between blocks,
And survey its domain high and dry.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
An archbishop from somewhere in France
Had a yen for interpretive dance,
But his stage fright was plain
From the large yellow stain
On his archiepiscopal pants.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Lovely Breda arrived in Breda,
Having fled from the wrath of her pa.
For the province (Brabant,
In the Netherlands) can't
Interfere with her running a bar.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Six elephant ears were a treat.
Flat, fried dough that is sugary sweet
Was too good to pass by
At that street fair.  From my
Dietitian I'm taking some heat.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You're a rigorous rogue, it would seem,
With your loan stipulations extreme.
An escape clause built in,
Insists, "Take only skin."
That pact may be hard to redeem.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If a strip about monsters you seek,
One that prompts more a grin than a shriek,
With a zombie, a donor
Of an off-the-wall groaner,
Allow me to recommend Eek!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Eventuation, or coming to pass,
Is what psychics might see in a glass,
Where each rosy prediction
Is fanciful fiction,
Foretold with the boldness of brass.

limerick_list.author: limarico
limerick_list.text:
The skull's chondrocranium phase
Is the cranium's cartilage days.
Soon, it's ossified bone;
Thus the accident-prone
Can be saved from their perilous ways.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Big Crunch is a future event
In which matter collapses—intent
On regaining the state
That preceded the great
First explosion. (There's time to repent!)

limerick_list.author: skipjordan and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
My old fence had a fatal design,
So the builder I had to malign.
For the fine cyprine planks
I have given my thanks,
But the posts were just common old pine.

limerick_list.author: HeuristicsInc
limerick_list.text:
If you want to have friends all life long,
It's important to do them no wrong.
If it's garlic you eat
(Or your breath smells like feet),
Chew some mints that are adequately strong.

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
My lawyer's persistent (unstopping);
Today for a forum she's shopping.
To put in the fix,
Find a jury whose mix
Makes for settlements prone to be whopping.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
Antique may mean "old," it is true,
Connoting a value that grew.
Though a compliment when
It's applied to a gem,
It's an insult for me or for you.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
An image in stone he was carvin',
And he hoped for a sale—he was starvin'.
This carven depiction?
A creature of fiction:
My favorite Martian called Marvin.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
The street sign reads Valley Creek Lane.
There's no creek nearby; that much is plain.
"It might flood," builders analyzed.
Now the creek's piped and channelized,
And my mem'ries are all that remain.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
On some stonework of Classical Greece,
We've found banker marks, piece after piece:
A requirement, a perk,
Common pride in one's work,
Or the laborer's sign of  release?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Grow down is a term that, historically,
We've been told not to use metaphorically.
Yet The roots of the tree
Will grow down—you can see
You can use it like that, categorically.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Counting Jennifer's flaws?  There are many.
But her scruples?  She hasn't got any.
Her job is provoking
Young folks into smoking.
Her friends call her Carcino-Jenny.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The giant Goliath achieved
A height of nine feet, it's believed.
But young Dave, with his sling,
Achieved much for his king
When Goliath's huge head he retrieved.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A bad habit (say, picking your nose
Or biting the nails on your toes)
Isn't seemly or nice,
But improper—a vice
(Or a ratty old piece of nun's clothes).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The burqini's in fashion for chicks
Who are Muslim and quite in a fix
At the beach, where they'd sin
If they showed too much skin.
It's a swimsuit Imams shouldn't nix.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
With that silly fraternity hat, boy,
You're looking the part of a frat boy.
Since joining that House
You're a dumb, sexist souse—
I had hoped you were better than that, boy.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Walt is gentlemanlike in his ways;
Correctly behaved is a phrase
That describes him. He treats
Every person he meets
With great courtesy. Walt deserves praise.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
In your age bracket, Pa, people are
Retired from work. You're by far
Not the fittest on earth,
So for what it is worth:
Take the bus and do not drive a car!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If a gallstone is stubbornly tucked
In your gall bladder's sole cystic duct,
It will back up the bile,
And the surgeons will smile,
As they love to find stones that obstruct.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
Low-temperature-gauging thermometers
Are specialised ones; they're cryometers.
(They're not used to measure
The screams of your "treasure"
Which resound within fourteen kilometres.)

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
In the film Mary Poppins, we heard
The sweep's accent — bizarre and absurd.
An' it gave us a laugh
But weren't cockney by 'alf,
More like cockneyish — prolly a furd.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here's a word that I bet you can guess:
D-A-N-C-E-R-E-S-S.
Have you figured the answer?
That's right: "female dancer."
Your intellect's bound to impress.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Birth of Venus by S. Botticelli
Shows a body to die for, her belly
A beauteous pearl—
So is that why the girl
Was allotted a dais so shelly?

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
In the fall, leaves and flowers senesce;
Anthocyanin colors finesse
Reds, purples, and blues—
Their brilliant hues
Brightly glowing—then all evanesce.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The net's out; now the problem's to shift her,
So we sail in a craft called a drifter.
The crew's singular wish
Is a netful of fish
And a boat with a hoist fit to lift her.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our teacher, the dismal Miss Dissel,
Insists that we learn this epistle —
Know by heart every page,
Else she gets in a rage
And refuses to signal dismissal.

limerick_list.author: Quickbeam
limerick_list.text:
To make aleberry, find some good beer
(Budget lager won't cut it, I fear),
Then heat it with spices,
Add bread in thick slices,
And drink to a Happy New Year!

limerick_list.author: Bob Colonna
limerick_list.text:
The ground cover, lovely Calluna,
Won't grow for me here in Laguna
Since Europe's mild weather
Is best for this heather.
(I wish that I'd known of that suna.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
One more lodgepole stacked up in a deck—
Men at work keeping nature in check.
Lumber fresh from the felling
Is not as compelling.
See it all without craning your neck.

limerick_list.author: equinox
limerick_list.text:
Coleoptile: botanical sheath
That protects the young shoots underneath.
Its eruption from earth
Marks the miniature birth
Of a new blade of grass on the heath.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
If you're well up on yoga and stuff,
Sometimes four limbs are just not enough,
Since ashtanga means eight.
My advice to you, mate —
If you bend with a friend, please don't chuff.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
"Raffiniert ist der Herrgott..." he said;
And, "God doesn't play dice."  Give him cred,
Einstein hewed to the end
To this view, wouldn't bend,
And pursued it wherever it led.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I get off on her strawberry pie.
I get thrilled, also feel a tad high.
She's a cannabis dealer,
And THC healer.
Her pies are infused, so that's why.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Though true blindness, for you or for me,
Is a handicap real as can be,
There are those who are blind
Not in eyes but in mind —
"None so blind as the ones who won't see!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
From the kitchen, my wife could be heard —
"In our yard, there's this gray and white bird.
From its plumage I'd say
It's a Canada jay."
So I came, and I saw; I concurred.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
That geology paper, "The Hillock"?
I found reading it less than idyllic.
To my deep consternation,
That Russian translation
Required I master Cyrillic.

limerick_list.author: Lanny
limerick_list.text:
Bur marigolds, often called weeds,
Make beggar-ticks: barbed, sticky seeds.
Unlike those of blue phlox,
These seeds cling to your socks—
A torment that nobody needs.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
My lawyer and I were concerned:
Had my ticket to freedom been earned?
The judge raised his head,
Banged his gavel, and said,
"Not guilty! This court is adjourned!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Someone's husband was caught shootin' dice?
And she's strayed from her vows once or twice?
And you heard what they said?
You've got gossip to spread?
"Bite your tongue" is the wisest advice.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Being fat means you have adiposity,
And it raises this odd curiosity:
These know-it-all nerds
Have me eating my words.
Were they food, I would be a monstrosity.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Once upon ... Long ago ... One fine day ...
An enchanted princess ... Far away ...
So these fairy tales start
Reaching into the heart
Of small children and, magically, stay.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Chalcanthite, a beautiful blue,
Has some uses—in fact, quite a few.
In dyes, it's a topper.
It's made up of copper,
And sulphur, and oxygen, too.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
This suffix forms adjectives: -fic.
I can name a few words in a tick:
Take horrific, morbific,
Prolific, terrific.
"Making happen" — the goal of this trick.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When you're shipping the juice of a fruit,
But it's costly to ship it dilute,
Try to concentrate, ponder—
Don't let your mind wander—
And think of a way that's astute.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
You've got what you need, but still push
For yet more, and your new plans go whoosh
In the air! You'll have heard
(It's oft said) that a bird
In the hand is worth two in the bush.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
À votre santé!  Bottomzup!
To your health! Down the hatch! Drain the cup!
Try to find, as the host,
The right words for your toast:
And your own cup?  Make sure it's filled up!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A bottleful's all that I've got.
I admit that it sounds like a lot,
But my husband will come
When I open this rum,
And he'll drink it right down like a shot.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A day in the life of a band
That's impossibly talented, and
A response to their peers,
Sgt. Pepper fuelled fears
There'd be no other album as grand.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I lusted for fortune and fame
In the poetry publishing game.
I wrote of a bucket
And a man from Nantucket,
Dishonestly signing my name.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
King Arthur encountered a fellow
Who was known for his backbone of Jell-O
And lack of acumen.
"I dub thee Sir Rumen—
Like earwax, you're thick and you're yellow."

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
In the heat of the day, God in Heaven
Heard a prayer from ascending soul Kevin.
"I'm so dry. Do you think
You could give me a drink?"
Thus the Stairway to Seven-Eleven.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I'm modest and don't like to brag,
I'm just thrilled with my new Douglas bag.
In this tube's where you blow—
It is airtight, you know.
Tests for oxygen once were a drag!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
While my insulin regimen's strict,
My reaction I cannot predict.
Seems that progress is little,
For this type is brittle
Diabetes: and mine is not licked.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
What's up with the Friday face, Matt?
You sure look like you just lost your cat.
There's no need be sad—
Skipping meat ain't so bad,
And the weekend is near, so there's that.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
I've engaged a new intern; she's hired
To assist me whenever I'm tired:
Sort my post, pay my bills,
Pour me drinks, bring me pills;
Spill the beans, though, and—bang!—she'll be fired.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
Abiogenist designates one
Claiming life is from nothing begun
In bad meat or foul hay,
But he won't get his way:
Omne vivum e vivo, my son.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I made oodles of cash selling fuel,
Bought a gem, but the next step was cruel.
Alinasally, puncture
Was made at this juncture;
It's there that I'll wear my new jewel.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My jokes will outlive this mere mortal.
Don't cry when I pass through death's portal.
When remembering me,
Snort and chuckle with glee.
What an honor if people would chortle!

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
I awoke from a horrible bender,
And my tongue was all bloody and tender.
Crushing daiquiri ice,
I forgot the advice
Not to drink till I'd turned off the blender.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
This word is itself a catastrophe,
For kids often fluff the (alas) -trophe.
Some say "strofe" after "catta",
And some suspect that a
Catastrophe's just a cat's ass trophy.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ace reporter Chris Jay got the scoop:
All four Beatles reforming the group!
George and John are to sing
Through this ouija board thing.
What a story—a really big whoop!

limerick_list.author: Kirk Zurell
limerick_list.text:
I've embarked on a job in T.V.,
But need glasses, not contacts, to see.
My lenses corrective
Are antireflective
So viewers see through them to me.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Little hairs along eyelids abound
On the edges, and sometimes astound;
Extra eyelashes, mixed
With those growing, and fixed,
Both enhance and allure, girls have found.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
Richard Nixon kept quite a collection
Of his top secret tapes for protection.
Even after he died,
In the Archives some hide.
Please, declassify them for inspection.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
We've set up the ropes and the wires,
And the cross-bars and aerial fires!
You'll be thrilled!  You'll be scared!
So you'd best be prepared
For our aerobats: brave trapeze flyers!

limerick_list.author: Kirk Zurell
limerick_list.text:
My wife's biological clock
Is ringing to wake Dr. Spock!
So, now that we've lunched,
Time to get my card punched,
And start work at producing a flock.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A chap who had felt he was dissed
Said, "I'm lazy?  I'm ethnic?  I'm pissed!
But I have enough brass
To sit on my ass;
On the dole I will gladly subsist."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak and mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Though it's not my ambition to loll 'em
To sleep with my bi-weekly column,
My editor thought
Stock analysis ought
To be colorless, boring, and solemn.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and rusty
limerick_list.text:
The first of this facial hair group
Is an easy design—no big whoop.
It's a Franz Josef twin,
Tidy, neat as a pin,
But instead of right angles, you swoop.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
In his creaseproof new outfit, Miguel
Came to Athens to dwell for a spell.
In his wrinkle-free suit
He was given the boot,
For his clothing was Greeceproof as well.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To be devilless? Hell, that's my goal:
To live life Satan-free, on the whole.
But this deviless, see,
Says she's horny for me,
And she's totally hot, bless my soul!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The groom bridled on seeing his bride
As she hurdled each pew to his side:
Her tracksuit looked weird —
As did her false beard:
"Wedding's off!" he immediately cried.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said King Edward the First, "I declare,
Although acre means 'field,' I don't care.
That is, henceforth, no more.
Now the yards measure four
Thousand eight hundred forty—that's square."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
That waterway? Naught but a runnel!
I'll make it my mission to tunnel
Beneath its expanse
From Dover to France.
The Thirties will bring us a Chunnel!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am late for a date—a big feed. One
Of those cabstands should help; Yes, indeed. One
Seems deserted.  A strike?
Then I'd best go by bike.
Man, you can't get a cab when you need one!

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
He designed it to fit in the fist,
And give exercise (good for the wrist).
"The solution," said Rubik,
"Decidedly cubic,
Involves an intriguing new twist."

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Genghis Phelps had a great Mongol army,
But the fellow was utterly barmy.
He forbade all his horde
To make war with the sword,
So they fought on instead with salami.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The broadcast you heard on art deco,
Or flamenco as danced by J. Greco—
Signals all bounced to ground
Off a satellite round:
A balloon, and the first one was Echo.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Adolescent, that fuzz on your chin
Is just bumfluff, all downy and thin.
But grow up a few years,
Proper beard growth appears
And the twice-daily shave can begin.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Plant corn on the 15th of May.
June 20th harvest the hay.
Such farming advice,
Plus sunsets precise,
Most almanacs plainly display.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Just a wee doch-an-doris, that's aye:
A drink at the door, afore "Bye".
As you leave the abode,
It is one for the road.
Ever we gang awa wi a sigh.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
With a toss of this coin I'll be wed,
But just who'll share my marital bed?
If the face is a tail,
I'll be married to Gail,
Or to Grace if the face is a head.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cerebral cortex: the gray—
It is there human reason holds sway.
When desires from the id
Rise from where they've been hid,
Superego will keep them at bay.

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
Did you hear of the bigamist who
Once married two women I knew?
I declared to his face,
"That's an utter disgrace,
For you can't have Kate and Edith, too."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My love life with Kelvin I'd cheer; oh,
His energy made him my hero.
Now his movement is nil
(He's so cold, lying still),
Making Kelvin an absolute zero.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The warrior reached for the purse,
Which had hung from his girdle. "A curse!
I'd have thought I'd have felt
The thief lighten my belt,
But now I've no funds to disburse."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Clyde loves college; he goes there a lot.
Look at all the degrees that he's got.
Is he educated? Yes,
A collegial success
(Though in real life he doesn't know squat).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
This world hasn't known such behavior
So selfless as, Lord, when you gave your
Own life for our sins.
Our salvation begins
When we recognize you as our Savior.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
There are many whom I'd like to plunge
Headfirst in a deep vat of gunge.
That's so smelly and sticky,
They'd all find it tricky
Themselves from this gunk to expunge!

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
This humble white powder, real cheap,
That's so versatile offers a heap
Of wonderful, handy
And really jim-dandy
Amazing ideas to reap.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
While camping one day, in the fog,
I rested my feet on a log.
An acrasiomycete
Left slime on that dry seat—
Nevermore will I camp near a bog!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Gus was livid; he fumed and he fussed.
How disgustingly loudly he cussed
In profuse purple prose!
As his temperature rose,
I was certain that Gus would combust.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I'm a cow, and I moo with a stutter.
Maid: "Your milk makes a ton of sweet butter,
And I wonder just how
You can do that, dear cow."
"S-significant udder," I utter.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cephalins make your blood clot.
In the brain and the spine they are hot.
They are part of the basis
For brain hemostasis—
Whether you like it or not!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Euclidean geometry's great
On a plane; all is well, lines are straight.
But, for lines on a sphere,
We have problems, I fear;
One axiom we must negate.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
If you think only gals and not men're
Most apt to be airheads, well then're
You listening to me?
Though he sings a high C,
He's as dim as can be, is the tenor.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
He runs averagely, not fast or slow,
With a moderate distance to go.
He's of medium height
And his weight is just right—
Not a star but your typical Joe.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
John Bull, a personification,
Embodies the whole English nation;
Stout, middle-aged, wise,
Prefers beer with the guys—
Country stock, common sense, some frustration.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
So transparent and bald-faced, she lies,
And her blatant dishonesty cries
To high heaven for righting.
Every friendship she's blighting—
Telling whoppers, she sure takes the prize.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
With your heart ripped apart by that boy,
You're as low as can be. I'll employ
All my gifts every day,
In a gradual way,
Till your woe, bit by bit, becomes joy.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Hairy Perry the barber pared hairs
From pairs of polite, hairy bears.
Once, working when weary,
He wounded one. Teary,
He performed hara-kiri upstairs.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
On eBay the price was at zero
For the Green Lantern character Nero.
Said my son, "Daddy, bid!"
And he clapped when I did.
To my kid, I'm the last auction hero.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
A wheat farmer, Billy Bob Graff,
Wasn't any too bright. (Not by half!)
See, his threshing was vain
'Cause he threw out the grain
And then tried to make bread from the chaff.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
I decided this summer, for fun,
That I'd nap in the nude in the sun.
I awoke on the sand
With my abs nicely tanned
And my critical organ well-done.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Pelvic viscera needing a check:
Are they healthy or more like a wreck?
A culdoscopy shows
If you've medical woes
As it goes on a biotech trek.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Delirament? Who could endure-o
The problem for which there's no cure-o.
Crazy fancy I know
To take part in that show;
Senza lire, we go with the euro.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Just a small golden bloom to begin—
Dandelions, so hardy, dig in.
Though I try very hard,
They now carpet my yard—
And my neighbor's, to both our chagrin.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
A Bemba said, "Let's sail the seas—
Away! Far from Zambia, please."
They set off by boat
On a very long float,
And wound up as Vietnamese!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Arizona is known for its sun.
(We've got sunshine out here by the ton.)
With clear weather all day,
Let's go watch the teams play
Now the Cactus League season's begun.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
A brine gauge can help me to measure
The intense, salty liquids I treasure.
If the reading's below
Where I'd like it to show,
I'll add salt to improve palate pleasure.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The cavalry need have no fear,
As each soldier's a carabineer.
They have carbines, and that'll
Bring vict'ry in battle
(If the front lines ain't shot by the rear).

limerick_list.author: Kim Le
limerick_list.text:
The passengers scream out in fright;
Pilot tries, but the gear doesn't bite.
There's a sharp, scraping sound—
Belly landing on ground—
And the pilot sighs, "Phew, we're all right!"

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Old Van Dyke, a Dutch hewer of logs,
Went to masquerade balls in his clogs.
When disguised as a tree,
He'd mistakenly be
Discommoded by drunks and rude dogs.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Have you ever considered the strains
Placed on couplings occurring on trains?
Note, I don't mean the sort
That could end up in court!
No, the kind that a dragbolt contains.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The process Fritz Haber had found
Can put nitrogen back in the ground.
Ammonia he made,
With industrial aid.
For his work, he is widely renowned.

limerick_list.author: David Roberts
limerick_list.text:
Creeping lily—it sounds like a fellow
Might find her in what—a bordello?
She's a glamorous cutie
Of poisonous beauty,
Whose flowers are purple or yellow.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Embryology's rather intrusive,
Its subjects, by nature, reclusive:
In the womb, yet unborn,
Yet to view their first morn.
Safe conclusions are often elusive.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
What an evening that E. has just chaired;
No one else and his product compared.
He's ablaze through the night
(Is he faster than light?) —
Mr. E is a fine emcee squared.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The serum from grandmother's blood
Showed coagula, cloudy as mud.
In the test tube were lumps
Of coagulum—clumps;
And my tears tumbled down in a flood.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
With purposeful gabble and babble,
Some toddlers convened in a rabble.
Their target: the wall.
And their aim: first of all,
To besplatter, besmear and bedabble.

limerick_list.author: expat
limerick_list.text:
That chicken is standing atilt
On one leg like a tall single stilt.
It was hatched by a heron
Whose true nature it's wearin',
Rejecting its coop for some silt.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Scotsman was known for his brawn—
Tossed the caber each dawn on the lawn.
But one braw windy day
It was swept right away.
"Why it's gone with the wind," he said, "blawn!"

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The new pilot heard this from his tech:
"Today's ceiling's unlimited. Check?
Visibility's high,
With no clouds in the sky:
The conditions are CAVU—don't wreck!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Mary said,  "What I need is a poke."
I replied, "Is this some kind of joke?"
"John, I'm not talking sin —
The poke pigs might come in,
Not the poke your lewd mind might evoke!"

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
"This new sunlamp could be a big earner,"
Said the boss, "so I don't mean to spurn 'er.
But concerns have been raised
Of some folks getting braised;
So we're putting it on the back burner."

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
An apprentice with brains of a gnat,
Shown the secret of cutting a mat,
Being shown yet again,
Then replied with disdain,
"Oh yeah. Sure, if you do it like that!"

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
limerick_list.text:
Four roads formed a carfax where I
Stood and wondered, "Which way?", with a sigh.
So I asked Mr Frost,
Who was equally lost.
He said, "Take the one least travelled by."

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
I'm late and I can't miss this train!
It's arrived, and I'm here, yet in vain:
I must climb down these stairs,
But some guys, broad as bears,
Have me blocked—all my plans down the drain.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Many quiet things aren't heard much,
And Belgian things aren't called Dutch.
Most lunches aren't free,
Just like giants aren't wee,
And museum things aren't to touch.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
If you see that four sixths is two thirds,
Then cross-multiply, do it in words:
Six times two, four times three;
They're both twelve, you'll agree.
You all get it?  You're certified nerds.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
A belligerent Ankylosaurus
Conked his dinosaur wife, known as Doris.
He did not go to jail,
But he lost his knobbed tail
In the settlement reached through divor-us.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A coroner's clerk, Lisa Beth,
When enlisted to find cause of death,
Advised thus: "I have found
That the principal ground
Of this death was cessation of breath."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Surfer Jed planned to go to the Med,
But he chose the Pacific instead;
And the consequence was,
Of his visit to Oz,
That he met with a shark and is dead.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
When I'm petting my dog, he enchants,
With his coat a soft, shiny expanse.
But what's not so enchanting —
His constant loud panting.
In brief: love his coat, hate his pants.

limerick_list.author: Fringe
limerick_list.text:
Dan was tired and spent, it was true,
But he still tried to date randy Sue.
But when she abused him
And clearly refused him,
He knew he had just fallen through.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Her calling us bezzies should end:
It sounds brash, and is hard to defend.
Yet, my sister's new fad
Lets me know that she's glad
To have me as her bezzie — best friend.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Take good heed of the almanac-man.
Move to high ground as fast as you can.
He says, "Trent's on the rise!"
So all would be wise
To proceed to their safe backup plan.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
As a wood-turner I go berserk,
When a person finds fault with my work
Though it's flawlessly done:
Grooves or scratches? Not one!
(Such a critic is simply a berk!)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend says he's got a position
As an ALAT; but what is his mission?
He can't be a catalyst;
But maybe a chattel-ist?
He's an animal-focused technician.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He's the Latin American kind
Of political boss not inclined
To think well of the weak
Who are trying to speak
Their own mind. (Thus cacique's been defined.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Coleopteran? Beetle or weevil.
Most are harmless, but some may do evil—
I haven't forgotten
The bugs that spoil cotton
And cause economic upheaval.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The anti-Darwinian crowd
In the pulpits refuse to be cowed.
"Evolution," they scream,
"Is the atheist's scheme
To deny we're divinely endowed."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The scholar, a skilled documentalist,
Said he planned, by next spring, to present a list
Of Ralph Emerson's files,
Which comprise many piles
Of the works of this famed transcendentalist.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
She sits, languid and pale, loath to eat;
Sometimes totters when up on her feet.
'Tis the green sickness. Find
Her a husband (and mind
She eats much of good greens and red meat).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To acierate iron, I feel,
Is just not that perplexing a deal.
Carbon first, then begin
To stir other things in.
Presto Change-O!  It turns into steel!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My first cousin is sexy, it's true.
I'm in luck since my sisters are too.
In our clan, it's no sin
To be wed kin to kin.
We're endogamous. ...What's it to you?

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"To argue, m'lud, I disdain.
This case is de plano.  The main..."
(Why can't those QCs,
With their fat words and fees,
Just speak plainly, and say "It is plain"?)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Denutrition will surely undo you.
If you're not eating well, that'll screw you.
When your food's not enough
To sustain you, it's tough.
Look! Strong light simply passes right through you!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Jackie Peck from Quebec was a hacker.
He was active and never a slacker—
Neither drippy nor dippy,
A rippin' hip cryppie
(Cryptology system attacker).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Here's the scoop: yummy ice cream creations
At Cold Stone surpass expectations.
They fold what you've chosen
On granite that's frozen.
Delight in their vast combinations.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice,
Shame on me.  Fool me ten times?  Not nice.
Shoulda known you'd repeat
Your behavior and cheat.
My fool's paradise came at a price.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Did dodos die? Or, in dire doo-doo,
Do they (due to bad juju or hoodoo)
To put it succinctly
Exist, but extinctly:
As Doomed Dodo-Zombies of Voodoo?

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
The pirate who lives in my garret
Is the number one fan of Syd Barrett.
Every time he's away,
I hear screeching all day—
It's "See Emily Play" (by his parrot).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If we work as a team, our collectiveness
Will be sure to improve our effectiveness,
So don't be subjective,
Or worse—introspective.
Group thinking displays our connectiveness.

limerick_list.author: dwalker
limerick_list.text:
I was granted a wish by an elf,
And was changed to a plant on a shelf.
Now, come breakfasting hour,
I use chlorophyll power,
Autotrophically feeding myself.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A government minister heads
A department, and constantly dreads
Messing up, losing face
And some voters, in case
The prime minister tears him to shreds.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Berkswell cheese, made from sheep's milk, is swell.
Made in colanders (Me: "What the hell?")
For a shape that's well known,
With a taste all its own,
And a "goaty" aroma as well.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
A swan's signature might be the grace
Of its white-feathered body and face.
But its grey, gawky baby,
So awkward, means maybe
A cygnet sure isn't in place.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The lymphadenopathy shows,
What with fever and weight loss and woes,
A complex severe —
AIDS-related, I hear,
So my future's not bright, I suppose.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The beautiful people are those
Sporting jewelry and fabulous clothes.
They vacation in France,
Go to discos to dance,
And besprinkle their speech with bon mots.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Modern art, though my eye is untrained,
Is a huge waste of paint," Gramps complained.
"I would humbly suggest
Norman Rockwell was best.
Give me art that need not be explained!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I'm asked, I am bound to know which fern
Prof speaks of, when naming the ditch fern,
And the class will adjourn
When I answer: "King fern—
Yes, that royal fern sure is a rich fern!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I'm investing at last in a tux,
And this label connotes certain luxe.
Yes, I have to confess
That I'm out to impress,
So I'll need to fork out the big bucks.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
The new day dawned upon the sweet green
Of the grass, which displayed a slight sheen
From the dew left at night—
Like teardrops. A sight
Left by pixies, whom no man has seen.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
An organization's regime
Can be vanquished, when new members scheme
To undo its positions
And foist their ambitions.
Such work is an entryist's dream.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
When Desi left Lucy for Miriam,
"Oh, Ricky!" she cried, in delirium.
The Desilu prez
Often pines for Arnaz.
Does Desi deserve desiderium?

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
